space: Since I live in the USA, it is difficult to manage from here, so I am only considering rentals for SIX MONTHS or longer (1 year preferred). Discount for monthly is 1400 euros per month. My home in Paris is as central as you can get....YOU CAN SAVE MONEY by WALKING to everything so you can eat baguettes and chocolate croissants each day: only 5 minutes to the Centre Pompidou, 3 minutes to the Les Halles RER/metro station, 1 minute to the Chatelet metro stop, 5 minutes to the LATE NIGHT bus stop, 10 minutes to Place St. Michel on the other side of the Seine, 10 minutes to the Louvre, 15 minutes to the heart of the old Jewish quarter, Le Marais, 30 minutes to Place des Vosges or St. Germain des Pres, about 30 minutes promenade to galleries in La Bastille, 15 minutes to Notre Dame and the island....you are as central as you can get! My charming apartment is on the fifth floor facing an interior courtyard on one of the busiest streets in Paris, rue St. Denis. There is the Australian bar, OZ
description: Location! Location! Location! Just bring your toothbrush to this charmingly restored cheerful one bedroom in the center of the city. Exposed beams, facing an interior courtyard, walk to the wonderful rue Montorgeuil market: what else could you want? Brand new renovation, electricity upgrade and new carpet this year. Prefer to rent for a minimum of 6 MONTHS (one year is preferred). Monthly rent discount is 1400 euros. transit: All the major metros and RERs are at Les Halles or Chatelet. Very easy to arrive and the night buses are also nearby at Hotel de Ville, 5 minutes away walking. Velib in front of building!
access: You are alone in the flat, the entire city is at your feet. You will enjoy being able to go outside and be astonished at the liveliness of the area and then come back home and it's facing two courtyards so there is a calm which helps make being in the center attractive.
interaction: I am available 18 hours a day by text, have lots of friends (and friendly neighbors) in Paris available to help answer any questions. It's easy to rent with me. Like having your family flat for your personal use!
house_rules: This residence is limited to TWO people and is for a MINIMUM rental of SIX MONTHS.
host_about:
I am a Native New Yorker (yes, I was born and raised here!) and have lived in Boston, Paris and Los Angeles and speak a bit of French and Spanish and about two words of Italian. I work in the legal field. I went to culinary school to study pastry many years ago and now I just bake cookies at Christmas when I have the time!

I have traveled to over 60 countries, go away to my house in Pennsylvania on many weekends and like meeting new people. 

As to the listings on AIRBNB: I have one "Supersize Studio" on the Upper East Side, which is a walk-up and has no doorman and I do not live there. The building is approximately 50 years old. The entire apartment is at your disposal. There is a queen sized bed, a table and chairs and it is perfect for a sole occupant needing a home-away-from-home. It is in Yorkville, home of the old Austrian and Hungarian and German bakeries, long gone. On Saturdays, at Saint Stephen's, which is opposite the apartment, there is a market which is wonderful. Otherwise, you have more than enough small cute places  to eat and hang out and if you are a couple of young single people, all the bars and restaurants you might want to go to until closing are on Second Avenue, one block over. This apartment is a very large studio with high ceilings and faces north to a garden, which is quiet. It comes with linens and dishes and has a small kitchen. There is a $60 cleaning fee and a $500security deposit required. AIRBNB collects the security and I ask you pre-pay the cleaning fee on arrival in cash.

So as to avoid confusion, the second listing, "Paris in New York" location is my home and about which I speak below and this is the apartment which has been reviewed the most. I no longer allow it to be rented.

I traveled to Europe the first time on my own via SERVAS many years ago and have not forgotten the kindness of the people I met then. I hope to reciprocate and make new friends!

Please contact me if you are interested in staying at one of my places. You MUST be a non-smoker but smoking is allowed in front of the building outside if you are desperate.

Please have your profile here. It is easier if I know  something about who you are, where you live and what you do. If I don't know something about you, it's hard for me to answer a request to stay quickly, since I like to have a level of comfort renting.

I've known one friend who lives in Abu Dhabi who I met via SERVAS over 30 years now. I expect to know my AirBNB guests just as long!

Thanks for your interest!

As to the other listings: the apartment in Paris (Chatelet) is not available again until 2015.  It is rented a minimum of six months. The apartment in Hossegor, in the Southwest of France, is available off-season each year from October until May. 

The Victorian house in northeast Pennsylvania is available on select weeks if you are interested in skiing at Elk Mountain, which is 20 minutes up the hill on Route 106 from Carbondale.

Just ask me!

space: Enjoy a slice of Parisian history and stay in an authentic Haussmann apartment. Sleeping up to five people, it is a charming apartment (50 m²) with parquet floors, mouldings and a fireplace with two adjoining bedrooms, a fully equipped kitchen and a large balcony decorated with flowers. On the 5th floor without a lift, appreciate the clear view of Paris and get excited by how central this apartment is to so many attractions. A short walk away are three Metro stations with numerous connections to the main line RER, airport, taxi and bus stations nearby. The movida room : An association of clear bright colours lightens this room with a design decoration just a touch psychedelic to recall the sensual and slightly kitsch ambiance of the films of Pedro Almodovar....But it’s only an unpretentious nod and a wink !  Associated with an old fashioned setting of mouldings, parquet floor and fireplace the overall effect comes across as rather appealing... judge for yourself. With it’s two single b

host_about:
I usually live in Paris, but with my husband Daniel we love to travel, and particularly to sail, which we do each summer in the mediterranean waters. Therefore I rent my appartment in the summer from June to September.
I've lived in several districts of Paris but finally decided to anchor in Montmartre, because it is charming, friendly, human scaled and very lively, and also perfectly served by public transportation, which makes family, friends, entertainment ... within easy reach. It combines perfectly all the benefits of a large metropolis and the charms of a very familiar spot.
Since I stopped working I went back to school ... history, philosophy, political sciences, art, are on my weekly agenda together with gymnastics and pilates.
With Daniel who is a great cook, we love to have people in for friendly evenings - we shaped the appartment specially for our social life -  in between the joyful invasions of our grandchildren, a bunch of five aged two to eight.

house_rules: Absolutely non-smoking. 1. Number of Persons/Replacements Only those people listed on the booking may use the property. The number of people must not exceed the number of sleeping places. Pets are not permitted. Children under 10 are permitted only in special cases. 2. Arrival and Departure Times Rentals commence after 2 pm on the date of arrival and terminate no later than 11 am on departure day. If we have a guest departing the same day as your arrival, you may drop your bags off after 11:30 am on your day of arrival while the apartment is being prepared. If there is no guest departing the same day, the apartment can be ready by 11 am and potentially earlier. Please plan on providing an estimated time of arrival and a contact number before you make your way to Paris. Arrivals and departures prior to 9 am and later than 20:30pm are liable to a surcharge, as follows: 20:30pm-21:30pm, 20 euros; 21:30pm-23:00pm, 30 euros; 23:00pm-00:30am, 40 euros; (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) euros; 5am-7am, 4
host_about:
Hi! I'm 38 and I've been living in Paris for more than a decade now. I was born and raised in the south of France, in and around Nice. Travelwise, I am a big fan of Taiwan, where I have made great friends in recent years. My main job is acting, and I also work in dubbing for cinema. Voilà, c'est moi! 

I bought this little studio from a friend this year. He completely renovated not long before I bought it, with a view to offering a great, bright and cosy spot for visiting friends and other guests. It's been very popular since the first few days we started advertising it!

If this is the first time you're considering booking an apartment, you should be glad: you're about to discover how much better than a hotel it is! Staying in a self-catered apartment you get a better feel of the city, really. Shopping for food at the nearby market to prepare good meals with fresh local produce instead dining out all the time makes it feel much more like home. Having a pad where you can invite people over is also a great plus.

I hope you'll have a great time here. And if Parisians look grumpy, don't worry, it's just they're being like everyone else. When you smile at them and apologize for not speaking French (which IS a crime), they usually melt and are the friendliest people you'll meet (almost).

Thierry

space: A very quiet place, rue du Faubourg du Temple, in the 10th district of Paris, 2 minutes walk from the Canal St Martin, situated in a very lively area (theatres, cafés, shops, restaurants...), this sunny 45 square meter apartment will offer a very nice stay in Paris.  It is entirely renovated with a parquet floor and a balcony with flowers. space: I'm living in the 20th arrondissement in Charming 3 br flat, between place gambetta and maraîchers in a realllllly nice neighbourhood ( see publication of Le point it describes the quarter and its artistic, bohemic, bars and cafés etc. ). It's also not far away from Père lachaise cimetery. The flatis located ground floor, it's a 65m2.  It has TV with cables , Wireless internet access (Internet via cable is also available),  a fully equipped kitchen,  washer, 2 bathrooms ,and Phone calls free to some countries. The building is safe and you have grocery shops and supermarchés open till 22:00. and the market nearby is really nice and relatively cheap. There is also a doorman for your safety. It's ideal up to 6 persons. It has a kid friendly and family environment. Groups of friends can have great time in it. Great for short visit, business trip, mid-term holidays ( weeks ). space: The apartment is available at a discount from now (August 23) to August 30 with a preference for people staying 4+ nights. Feel free to enquire for the apartment / send me messages about your trip to Paris, I'm glad to answer any question even if you end up staying somewhere else !  I have had more than 20 guests on Airbnb over the past two years and they all loved the apartment and the prime location ! Emmanuel ---- It is a one bedroom in a modern building with doorman very close to Parc Monceau, rue de Chazelles more precisely.  Elevator, kitchen, bathroom, plasma screen, WIFI, phone free to call the U.S, black leather sofa, lots of light, no surprises !  I am the owner of this apartment (it is an important detail as many other apartments on Airbnb are sublets or agencies). I have lived there for two years. space: PLEASE ALWAYS CHECK WITH ME FOR AVAILABILITY BEFORE BOOKING JULY/AUGUST BOOKINGS PREFERABLY ONE WEEK All of Paris at your command from this light, airy, spacious apartment (62 square meters) on the 7th floor (with elevator) of a pleasant 1930s building on a quiet street just one minute from the Bir Hakeim (Eiffel Tower) metro station (line 6). The bedroom sleeps 1 or 2 people, with accommodation for a third person in a study with comfortable sofa bed. The apartment has windows on both sides, so you get sunlight all day long. There is a large living/dining area and fully equipped kitchen.  It’s just a short stroll to the Eiffel Tower, the Seine,the Bateaux Mouches and the spectacular Quai Branly Museum. Metro and bus routes get you in minutes to the Arc de Triomphe, the Louvre, Montmartre, the Marais, and all the key sites in Paris. space: Hello! Bonjour!  Welcome to our fabulous one bedroom apartment! It is situated in the beautiful Montmartre "village" and located on a small, quiet street, literally steps away from the famous Sacré Coeur church.  Our apartment has everything you need for a wonderful stay in Paris. It is located on the 2nd floor (1er étage), and can accommodate up to 3 people.   The apartment has a queen size bed, full size pull out couch, equipped American kitchen with washer and dryer, and bathroom with giant bathtub and shower. We also provide all the sheets, towels, plates, glasses, etc.  There is also free wireless internet, telephone with free international calling to the US as well as several other countries, and a TV with international channels.  The metro station Chateau Rouge is 5 minutes away and the 85 bus nearby goes straight to the Louvre, St. Michel Fountain and Luxembourg gardens.  Please let me know if you have any questions!
description: Our apartment is the perfect size for a couple, but can accommodate an extra person easily on the pull-out couch. transit: There are 3 metro stations within easy walking distance: Chateau Rouge (line 4), Anvers (line 2), and Abbesses (line 12). You can also take the 85 bus nearby which goes straight to the Louvre, St. Michel Fountain and Luxembourg gardens. Another option is the velib, which is a public bicycle system which is available everywhere in Paris. And, if necessary there is also a taxi service which you can order by phone and is available 24/7.
access: The guest have full use of the apartment.
interaction: We will arrange to have someone welcome the guest when they arrive, and we will provide the guest with a contact person in case of emergency. We are always available to answer by email any questions that the guests may have either before or during their stay.

host_about:
Hi everyone,

I'm really enjoying sharing my knowledge and experiences of the city through the many wonderful people who've stayed as my guests through Airbnb - what a fantastic concept it is. I take much pleasure in making sure anyone staying with me has a great experience and stay and have a very professional approach in the preparation and presentation of my apartment.

This apartment used to be my home in the city, and although I've moved now, I've taken a lot of care and paid a lot of attention in re-decorating and equipping it to make it the perfect pad from which to explore Paris...
If you've got any questions or need any help while planning your trip to Paris I'd be very happy to lend a helping hand.

Looking forward to hopefully meeting you and welcoming you to Paris...!

Michel

space: Looking to rent my place from 5th August to 5th September. The flat is 38 sq. meters, bed sheets and towels are provided. Small kitchen but comfortable enough to cook. Suited to 1 or 2 people. Rent 1000€ per month. conveniently located near a tube station, Poissoniere (line 7), very central, you can walk to the Louvre in 20-5 mins. The neighbourhood provides everything: supermarket 1 min away from the flat, nice covered market with butchers, fishmongers, etc, 4 mins away. nice restaurants and cafes all around. Gare du Nord very close if you want to jump to a train to London, or visit other cities near Paris. Internet WIFI connection provided.

space: We decorated this apartment for ourselves to live in, and we are happy to let travelers use it while we are living abroad for a couple of years! It is a beautifully restored 1-bedroom, 1-bath apartment in a French Haussmann building, with a full kitchen near the historic Latin Quarter of Paris. Near pedestrian street Rue Mouffetard, outdoor markets, Botanical Gardens, and the Mosque. 2 minute walk to metro (line 5 - St. Marcel). 20 minute walk to Islands and historic Latin Quarter. In quiet building with quiet residents, on a private courtyard. We ask that renters please respect that this is a building with permanent residents, and to be quiet and respectful. There is a queen-size bed. Sleeps 3 with the couch (not a sofa-bed - not meant to be a permanent bed). The apartment is fully furnished, wireless internet, cable TV, phone, maps and guides are included. No AC. No elevator – 4th floor. No washing machine. You'll find the laundry service just across the street. No pets or smoking al

transit: The metro in Paris can take one everywhere. There are also the city rental bikes (velibs), which you can get a day-pass for. There is a station right next to the apartment.
interaction: Even if we are not here, a host will be present to meet guests when they arrive, and to get them settled. She can introduce them to the apartment and amenities, as well as talk about local things to see and do.
house_rules: Please be considerate of our neighbors - sound travels through floors easily in old buildings!
host_about: We have lived in 3 countries and traveled to 20+ others. We love to discover new destinations around the world for nature and  hikes, and like to simply meet people globally, because we love learning about different cultures.

space: Planning a trip to Paris?  Want to experience the real Parisian life?  Come and  stay in a confortable all furnished apartment in on of the most popular and trendy part of Paris. 1 bedroom apartment ideally located at the heart of the lively and adorable Montmartre area. Just get by the window and you'll fell "real life", just close the window and dive in the warm and quiet atmosphere of this lovely place. You won't have to walk more than a few meters to find any kind of fresh food, restaurants, bars, shops and anything you might wish.  Big living-dining room with open kitchen and a sofa bed for two more persons.  One bedroom.  Shower room.  WIFI access.  I can offer you more and  give you a taste of the real Paris like only one native of this city can._ I will give you the keys to plan an unforgettable and personally tailored vacation, everything from lodging to dining to entertainment to shopping. Time saving and quality enhancing guaranteed! Ask for more details.

house_rules: No special house rule : just enjoy your stay here, respecting the place, the neighbours, and the things that are being left in the apartment to make you feel home. Treat them as they were your own :-) Windows shall be closed when leaving the apartment, door should be locked... Well it's just as you would do if you were in your place, isn't it? :-)
host_about:
A Parisian at heart…
I was born in Paris 38 years ago (not so easy to find a Paris native in Paris!) and grew up in a milieu where French art de vivre is key. 
I love Paris, where I have my habit but  where I always keep room for surprise. 
I’m the one, friends have always kept calling asking « where could I take my parents for dinner » « what would you suggest for an anniversary  », « It’s so sunny today, where can we have a brunch ?
Just  like you…
I love travelling, discovering new parts, going out to concerts, movies, exhibitions, partying or spending quiet times with family and friends by the fire place in a sunny park .
I love good food, good wine, and I feel truly sorry when I see disoriented tourists sitting in a tourist trap where I wouldn’t go even if paid.
I decided it was time ! 
After studying in HEC management school and working for 10 years in big advertising agencies, I left the top management position I had achieved, deciding  that it was time that I launched my own business, make something that I really liked. That's how I founded my own business, with this ambitious project of making you experience Paris like only a Parisian can. 
Looking forward to seeing you in Paris ! :)

space: This 21sqm 1BR studio is located "rue des Boulets", in the 11th arrondissement, between Bastille and Nation. space: You rent the entire space of a beautiful French style studio, recently renovated, on the first floor in a building located in the heart of lively hip Marais district. If you are looking for a place during the fashion week in Paris it is a perfect choice. This unique renovated 16th century apartment makes your trip unforgettable.
description: A Parisian Musician Loft, Cosy, Just Exceptional, in the Great Marais Neighborhood You rent the entire space of a beautiful French style studio, recently renovated, on the first floor in a building located in the heart of lively hip Marais district. If you are looking for a place during the fashion week in Paris it is a perfect choice. This unique renovated 16th century apartment makes your trip unforgettable. The building has a closed courtyard where you can secure your bike if needed, and if you don't have a bike, Velib' stations (bike rental) are a mere 100 yards away. Clean sheets and towels provided. - First floor - 36 m2 with mezzanine (390 square feet) - 2 security code - Very high ceiling - Beams with original paintings from 16th century - Tiled floor - Large windows with many natural light without direct sunlight - Furnished apartment - Internet Wi-Fi - Apple TV - Washing machine - Fridge - Heater and hot water - Bathroom with bathtub - Functional kitchen - Double bed - Travel
transit: 5 min walking distance from Oberkampf, Bastille and Republique. 10 min walking distance from Georges Pompidou Art Center (Beaubourg). The apartment is situated next to the Picasso Museum and the famous "Place des Vosges". It's a 20 minute walk from Notre Dame and the City Hall and 5 minute from the nicest places to have a drink and eat or hang out at night. Closest subway stations are Saint Sebastien Froissart (line 8, 2 minute walking distance) and Oberkampf (line 5, 10 minute walking distance). Also many bus lines if you don’t fancy subways. Chatelet-Les Halles is close to the studio (a 15 min walk) which is the biggest hub for subway/RER (express subway) lines in Paris. From Chatelet-Les Halles, direct express line to Roissy-Charles de Gaulle and Orly international airports (a 50 minutes ride) although the best way to get to the studio from the airport is taking RER B and changing in Gare du Nord to take Subway 5.
access: The building has a closed courtyard where you can secure your bike if needed, and if you don't have a bike, Velib' stations (bike rental) are a mere 100 yards away. Clean sheets and towels provided. - First floor - 36 m2 with mezzanine (390 square feet) - 2 security code - Very high ceiling - Beams with original paintings from 16th century - Tiled floor - Large windows with many natural light without direct sunlight - Furnished apartment - Internet Wi-Fi - Apple TV - Washing machine - Fridge - Heater and hot water - Bathroom with bathtub - Functional kitchen - Double bed - Travel Cot for your baby - Grand Piano usable only upon request and under conditions You have the whole apartment on your own. The studio apartment consists of a large living room, a mezzanine with a full size bed (140x190cm, accommodates two) and a large bathroom with bathtub / hair drier and a kitchen so you can cook at home. Large grocery store on the same block and supermarket one bloc further. High speed Optical
interaction: I live and work nearby. You need something? Just call or send me a text message, I will be there shortly if I am available.
house_rules: --IMPORTANT-- Please provide a copy of your passport when checkin. Piano would be available only upon request and only during a limit of time in the day. Please avoid to put any abject on the piano. You will stay in a musician loft with many books and instruments. Please be respectful to the space. Please avoid to make any excessive noise or loud music after 9pm and before 9am. Making party and inviting more than 4 or 5 people is not allowed. This is a non smoker space. -WHEN YOU GET HOME Make yourself at home and take care of this place as if it is yours. Please pay attention to some rules: 1- Take off your shoes. 2-Please turn off the heaters and lights when you are out.

description: You feel at home in this charming 3 rooms apartment situated at Porte d'Auteuil, 16 th arrondissement. The building, situated in the middle of a beautiful garden, was built in 1912. The apartment is 70 square meters, ideal capacity is 4 or 5 guests. we have 2 bed rooms, one with a queen size bed and the second one with a comfortable folding coach. The kitchen is fully equipped : micro wave, regular oven, washing machine , fridge , boiler, dishwasher. We display Cable TV with 54 feet plasma TV and high speed Wifi in the bed room ( fiberglass), iPod deck Bose. There is also a Nespresso machine with some capsules.  Price : 300 €  The cab and art visit of Paris is a package of 500 €. The flat is very convenient, with all facilities and near to 3 subways. The closest metro station is Exelmans and Porte d'Auteuil  only at 3 minutes (line 9).  We are situated  20 mn from Châtelet and Opera, 10  minutes from porte de Versailles by tramway on Garigliano bridge .There are also 2 velibs stations
transit: The area  has very good transportation capacity : bus,3 subway stations " Exelmans"  ( line 9)  and "Michel Ange Molitor" , very convenient to go to Quartier Latin ( 15 mn) . Also we have 3 "Velibs station" and "Autolib" and the brand new Tram that goes `porte de Versailles for the different salons and fairs in Paris, specially Paris Fashion Show.
access: The flat is very convenient, with all facilities and near to 3 subways. The closest metro station is Exelmans and Porte d'Auteuil  only at 3 minutes (line 9).  We are situated  20 mn from Châtelet and Opera, 10  minutes from porte de Versailles by tramway on Garigliano bridge .There are also 2 velibs stations ( bicycles) and 2 Auto-Lib, electric car stations . The area is quiet, very accessible, and only 35 minutes from Roissy CDG airport by train. They are plenty of  restaurants and stores at Porte d'Auteuil area and the biggest Hyper in town If you're interested in Paris history, art, museums and galleries, book a private visit with an artist, Skall ( (URL HIDDEN) . He'll take you to the best galleries of Marais and museum of art of Paris, according to your wishes, or even go for an exclusive shopping!  Hyper market Carrefour in only 3 minutes.  We have 2 nice typical parisian markets , from tuesdays to Sundays at Place d'Auteuil and Porte de Saint-Cloud. Also, we are 30 minutes away
interaction: Extra tips : book a private cab from airport or for  a whole day in Paris with Jean-Yves , private driver who has his own valet car. He’ll take you to any places in Paris for a whole day for 300 €.  I'm always nearby, easy to reach and willing to help!
house_rules: It's definitely not a part place! I like the guests to be respectful , while there are families and old people in the building. I appreciate if the guests are discreet, respect the number of hosts ( 4 maximum) and, overall, No smocking and no pets. sorry!
host_about: I'm a french filmaker, graduated from INSAS , film school in Brussels, and Columbia University Film School in New York city. I'm directing mostly documentaries for TV, corporate films and commercials. I travel a lot for my work and  like to meet new people. I speak spanish, german and italian. I live at "Porte d'Auteuil" because I love tennis and I'm 5 minutes from Roland Garros stadium!

space: The studio is situated on a quiet street and is an open living space measuring 250 square feet.   It is located on the 1st floor of a 1970’s French apartment building which has a lift and a coded entry.   The studio has lots of natural light and can accommodate two persons (four persons - for short periods). The sleeping arrangements include one double sized bed and one sleeper sofa.  You also have an internet connection (wifi or USB cable), television, DVD player (Zone 2: will not play US DVDs), iron and ironing board, closet space as well as a small table and four chairs. Smoking is not allowed and sorry no pets. The kitchenette is open and is equipped with a oven and cooktop, microwave, small fridge, coffee maker, electric kettle, toaster, and all cooking utensils necessary.  The bathroom is fitted with a shower, toilet, sink and washing machine (+ a drying-rack tower). One set of towels and bed linens are provided during your visit. A hairdryer is also available (one less thing to

METRO:  Métro station Château Rouge (line 4), Marcadet-Poissonniers (line4) or Jules Joffrin (line 12) are just a (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) minutes walk away.  BUS:  Bus n°85 goes to the center of Paris Châtelet, Les Halles (many shops) and Le Louvre, Luxembourg garden.  Bus n° 80 goes to Place de Clichy (Pathé Cinéma theatre, restaurants...), Saint-Lazarre station, the Champs Elysées, Pont d'Alma, the Eiffel Tower.  The Montmartrobus is a fantastic way to get around Montmartre (Sacré-Coeur, Place du Tertre, Pigalle) without exhausting yourself climbing up and down those hills! space: Located in the heart of Le Marais and its trendy shops and restaurants, just steps away from the metro (St Sebastien Froissard) in a beautiful and quiet Beaux Arts building recently designated a historical landmark, this gorgeous 1BR/1BA designer apartment (accommodating up to 4 people: 2 in the bedroom, and 2 in the convertible sofa bed located in the living room) enjoys southern exposure and is filled with wonderful natural lighting throughout the day. host_about: My name is Carine and I have been living in New York for 20 years. I  bought this lovely apt in Paris as i travel back often and wanted a home "away from home". My husband and i put all of our hearts into making it a lovely, cozy, comfortable place. We travel extensively, and most often use vacation rentals as we're tired of hotels. Years of vacation rental experience (very good and very bad ones ;) allowed us to set up this home for you. We tried to think of every possible detail, in order to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.... we love this apartment and hope you'll love it too!

space: Have you ever day dreamed of admiring, kissing in front, or even living in one of the most romantic and fantastic panoramas in the world, thinking only millionaires could afford it? Well, it's true that only a handful of luxury hotels in Paris offer you a half view of the Eiffel Tower. I am lucky to have found a dream inducing luxury apartment which offers you all of Paris at your feet. All of it: from Montmartre to the Eiffel Tower, from the Invalides dome to the tubes of Pompidou, from the towers of Notre-Dame to so many lesser known spires or the skyscrapers in La Défense. The apartment is designed for 3 people (1 master bedroom + 1 kid bedroom) but can sleep up to 4 (high quality single bed, and single Airbed provided), or 5 including kids. Rise and greet the world by doing your yoga on the terrace (nobody can see you), or training on the elliptical bike, enjoying the incredible impression of riding over the city. Enjoy a sunny brunch with birds over the Parisian roofs. Go for a st

transit: The metro stop Pyrénées is about 200 meters from my building entrance. The 11 metro line stopping there goes direct in 10 minutes to the Seine, Notre-Dame, the Marais and Châtelet (major metro hub, where you can catch the RER train going to Orly airport).  Right next to the metro entrance is the #26 bus stop, which will take you directly to gare du Nord to catch your Eurostar or RER train to CDG airport. Of course, I can also make a taxi reservation for you from your arrival point.
access: Everything except my dressing!
interaction: Either I or one of my friends will be there to greet you and show you in, even give you a little tour if you're not too tired. But everything is explained in a very detailed Home booklet anyway. Then we leave you to enjoy the place, except if you need direct help with something at some point. Of course I can always be reached by email or phone. With AirBnB guarantees, check out is optional. But it's actually happened quite a few times that guests and I get along so well that we decide to meet for a brunch or apéritif!
house_rules: The apartment is designed for 3 persons (2 bedrooms), and the price given for 3 guests.  I don't recommend more than 4 people staying in this home, except if that includes several kids (see above). Smoking is allowed only on the terrace.
host_about: Wondering the World has been my motto ever since a teenager. French origins, though after living and traveling in many countries, that becomes just one of many identity nuances.

space: The flat is a converted Artist Studio. It is a charming duplex with huge windows, 3 bedrooms, a veranda and a terrace. It is situated at the last floors (6th and 7th) of a beautiful building from the 30's, in a private square where children can play safely. The place is very luminous and very quiet. On the first floor of our apartment, you'll find the living room, an artist's studio with a big balcony. There is a piano in it, as well as many books and DVDs. The kitchen has all facilities including a Thermomix robot and a dishwasher. The bathroom is equiped with a bathtub, a washing machine and a tumble dyer. There are two bedrooms with single beds where one can easily put an extra-bed on the floor. On the second floor of our flat, you'll find the main bedroom with a King Size bed and an ensuite bathroom and toilets, a small office with a computer and Internet, a veranda, with air conditioning (quite useful in summer) in which a sofa can be transformed in a double bed, and a terrace wit

space: For your stay in Paris, I propose you my charming and cosy 2 rooms apartment. It is well furnished, light and calm, well located in the 18th district of Paris, close to Montmartre and Sacre Coeur, near metro, Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est, RER ... Very convenient for visiting Paris.  3rd floor with lift, 45m ², parquet, fireplaces (convicted)  1 bedroom with double bed (140x190), on street side. the main room is quiet overlooking a courtyard, with a double bed sofa, TV, stereo, wireless internet, a table and chairs, and kitchen with bar, fridge / freezer, oven, micro-wave, gas kitchen  1 bathroom with shower and washing machine and separate toilet.  Very lively and cosmopolitan area, you can access the old Paris and Montmartre Abbesses in 10 minutes on foot and reach easily Pigalle and the Moulin Rouge on foot.  The apartment is located near the metro line 4 (2 minutes), which serves the center of Paris (St-Michel, St. Germain, the Louvre ...) and line 2 (5 minutes) which joins the Ch

host_about:
Parisian for 10 years now, i love this beautiful city even if I've not finished to discover the whole of it yet! I will be pleased to receive you at home and help you having a nice stay in this magic area of Montmartre! Welcome in Paris!

Parisienne depuis 10 ans maintenant, j'adore cette ville magnifique même si je n'en ai pas encore découvert toutes les facettes... Je serais très heureuse de vous accueillir dans mon appartement et de vous aider à passer un agréable séjour dans ce quartier magique qu'est Montmartre! Bienvenue à Paris!

space: The appartement (6th floor, with lift) has parquet floor, and magnificent views over the canal and the Sacred Heart. It has a living room with sofa, dinning table, couch, a bedroom (140x190), a bathroom room with bathdub and a well equipped kitchen. And a balcony where you can take your meals. The flat is very cosy and comfortable. For sure you enter in a home ready to live: you don't need to take with you sheets, linen, hair dryer, washing machine, etc. and you don't need to buy oil, salt, sugar to survive! And for sure you are having the whole apt for you and you are not sharing it.  Hight speed Internet / Wi-Fi.  Closest subway stations is Louis Blanc or Chateau-Landon (line 7) 2 minutes walking distance. 5 minutes walking Station Gare de l’Est (line 4,5,7 ans train). 12 minutes station Republic (Line 8,9,11) Also many bus lines if you don’t fancy subways. space: On Quai de la Seine, next to Bassin de la Villette:-) Large, baby/child friendly  2 bedroom apartment. One with large high quality queen size bed. The other with a toddler bed and a fold our queen size sofa bed. Each room with it’s own balcony. Right on the Canal, in summer only a few meters away from the fabulous Paris Plage and Parc de la Villette, tons of music, open air cinema etc in month of august. 5 minute walk to MK2 cinemas on Canal. The apartment is about 87 square meters (all rooms have balconies). It is well situated, 1 minute walk from metro (crimee-line 7) - (direct line and 10 minutes to Opera, Louvre, Galerie LaFayette etc), but also right next to canal which is not only beautiful, but if you are looking for live music and arts etc, this part of Paris is full of it! Also two big cinema complexes on the water, and all the shops, cafes, bakeries, supermarkets etc that you need. Fresh fruit and veg market out front twice a week. The apartment itself is fully equipped  -hig
description: Big family friendly apartment de 80m2 (heaps of toys/puzzles/books for kids), toddler bed and a baby bjorn bed. Spacious and comfortable with lovely views. One side looks over a square with an old Parisian church, the other side looks over a big private garden with lots of trees. It is  right next to canal, cinemas, supermarkets, cite de science, parc de la villette, cafes, live music, butts chamion and transport, and a quick metro ride to central paris. transit: there is a metro 100 metres away (line 7) that goes direct to the Louvre, opera, pont neuf etc. Another metro (line 5) 5 minute walk that goes direct to Bastille, gare de leon, gare du nord, etc. And there are buses 100 metres away too. Also a velib bike station in front of flat with bike paths all over Paris, it's a great way to get around!
interaction: I love helping visitors with information about Paris, directions and anything that could help their stay be easier and more enjoyable.
house_rules: Smoking only permitted on balconies, no smoking inside please, thankyou!
host_about: Hello, I'm a writer and love traveling to the south of france to write. My husband is a music composer and we love to travel. In order to do so we rent our big apartment. We havn't rented much in the last two years with work and baby, but now he's older, we enjoy chances of getting away. I enjoy helping visitors to Paris, it is a wonderful city and holds many treasures. We live right next to Le Bassin de la Villette, heaps of cafes and things to do. Hope to meet you soon!

space: The place:  Beautiful and atypical modern apartment with stunning views over the city and the Eiffel Tower. Being on the 7th floor, it's filled with light.  It has a large living room, a full bathroom, kitchen and master bedroom.  The living room has two couches (one folds into a queen bed - not the most confortable but ok), a big TV and a projector/folding screen systems. Beautiful hardwood floors and brick wall give the place a lot of charm.  The master bedroom has a king bed and space to unpack your stuff.  The kitchen comes with a view (!) and is fully equipped with modern appliances: American-style fridge, freezer, washer and dishwasher, drier, big stove and microwave.  Hit us up if you need additional info on the appartment, the neighborhood, or if you're just planning to visit Paris and would like some advice.
description: We rent our modern apartment in the 17th arrondissement of Paris (walking distance to the lovely Batignolles & Montmartre neighborhoods). It is a large 1-bedroom apartment, fully equipped with all appliances, filled with light on both sides and offers gorgeous views over the city (7th floor), in a clean and friendly building. This is the perfect place to explore Paris like a local. The place:  Beautiful and atypical modern apartment with stunning views over the city and the Eiffel Tower. Being on the 7th floor, it's filled with light.  It has a large living room, a full bathroom, kitchen and master bedroom.  The living room has two couches (one folds into a queen bed - not the most confortable but ok), a big TV and a projector/folding screen systems. Beautiful hardwood floors and brick wall give the place a lot of charm.  The master bedroom has a king bed and space to unpack your stuff.  The kitchen comes with a view (!) and is fully equipped with modern appliances: American-style frid
transit: Getting around:  The apartment is 5 minutes away from 3 subway stops on line 13 (going to main train hubs like Saint-Lazare and Montparnasse, as well as landmarks such as Invalides, Champs Elysées). Many buses (including one 2 minutes from the apartment) will take you right to the middle of the city in less than 30 minutes. A Velib (shared bicycle system) station is right below the apartment.
house_rules: - just the usual: be careful when using the oven/the stove, close doors and windows when leaving the house, and the golden rule: be respectful to the neighbours! No loud parties allowed
host_about: I love living in the right bank of Paris. Contact me if you're interested in my place, or just need advice on places and things to do in Paris. And have a great stay here!

space: Ideal for 2, but sleeps up to 3 or 4 adults (the living room has a sofa bed). Located in an 18th century listed building, on the 2nd floor (3rd floor US) without elevator. 3 nights minimum, available year round.  - 30m² or 323 feet², 1 separate bedroom plus pull-out sofa bed in living room - En-suite bathroom with shower cabin - Free wifi - Free local & international calls - Bed linen & towels provided - Washing machine, microwave oven, stove, crockery, cutlery etc. provided - TV with international channels (CNN, BBC World etc) - Baby's cot available on request. A few minutes walk from Notre Dame, & within walking distance to most of the major tourist attractions. access: The whole apartment is for you. FOR ARRIVALS AFTER 9PM :  EUR50 SURCHARGE TO BE PAID ON ARRIVAL. My guests are always met at the flat by my apartment manager for a proper check-in & introduction, I do not use a code activated key box or allow for any form of self check-in.

host_about:
From Paris, love travelling whether for work or pleasure.
I have been renting out my apartment for over 10 years, so I fully appreciate the demands for clean and high quality accommodation.
You get the whole apartment to yourself, not just a bedroom.
 Ideal for couples, but I also have a sofabed for a 3rd person.  I can provide a baby's crib on request.

space: Located in the legendary bohemian neighborhood, the setting of "la vie en rose" and "Amelie" with the best bakery in Montmartre down the street. Minutes walk from the subway and the bus, the Dali Museum, Sacre Coeur, Moulin Rouge, etc.  The bus right outside the door takes you straight to the Opera, the Louvre, Saint Germain, and Montparnasse. space: Our home is a loft-style apartment that was originally an artist atelier built in 1900.  It has been completely renovated by a well-known architect into a family friendly duplex loft space.  What makes the apartment original is that we have beautiful 6 meter high windows and ceilings, so the space is very light and sunny.  We've furnished the duplex in a contemporary, but homey style.  The duplex features 3 bedrooms and can sleep up to 6.  On the top floor, we have a large master bedroom, a bedroom with bunk beds, bathroom and separate toilet.  On the lower level is another bedroom (with either a single bed or double futon) and a large open space. The open space includes the living room, dining area and a kitchen with culinary island. We have all the amenities necessary to make your stay as comfortable as possible: WIFI, high-end stereo and homecinema system, dishwasher, washer and dryer.  The interior decorating features high quality furnishings from european designers. The duplex is

space: Located in the Maris, Paris' oldest neighborhood, this very cozy and well equipped 1 bedroom is a perfect quiet alternative to any hotel room. The 45 m2 (490 square feet) 1 bedroom is on the 2nd floor of a quiet stone-paved courtyard, minutes away by foot from the Pompidou Modern Museum, Seine River, les Halles, Louvre Museum... NEW FEATURE: Free calls to French land lines AND mobiles + free calls to all US numbers (except special numbers). The bedroom has a large queen-sized bed, small desk, and large cupboards. Please not that bedroom and living room are separated by a partial wall only. If someone uses the additional single bed in the living room, there is no complete separation between the two rooms. The Living room has a large couch, a chaise that can double as a single bed for guests, a large 3D 55-inch flat screen screen with amazing surround sound, Ipod control, cable TV, and hundreds of DVDs. Equipement includes a Blu-ray player, 7.1 THX receiver, vinyl player, and for gamers
description: The perfect place for your stay in Paris if you like modern confort, technology and quietness, all in the heart of Paris' oldest neighborhood. Whether you like culture, shopping, or simply Parisian ambiance, this is for you... NEW FEATURE: Free calls to French land lines AND mobiles + free calls to all US numbers (except special numbers). The bedroom has a large queen-sized bed, small desk, and large cupboards. Please not that bedroom and living room are separated by a partial wall only. If someone uses the additional single bed in the living room, there is no complete separation between the two rooms. The Living room has a large couch, a chaise that can double
transit: The apartment is surrounded by several bus routes and features two Metro lines, including the ultra fast and convenient 1 Line.
access: Guests have access to the whole apartment and its amenities.
interaction: I'm constantly available if you have any issue or question.
house_rules: The sound system is very powerful, so please be careful when watching movies/listening to music after 10pm. The heaters are electrical and unfortunately not very ecological, so I ask that you please not leave the apartment with the heaters set too high, for it will waste a lot of energy. Nespresso coffee machine: please do not buy other brand capsules, even if they are advertised as compatible: they are NOT and will not wok on the machine. Trash: the bin features two compartments. On the right please throw all food & organic trash. On the left all paper and metal cans for recycling. GLASS can either be left on the floor for my cleaning man to dispose of, or thrown in the building's dedicated glass trash cans, with a white cover. Upon check out, ONLY IF time allows, please throw your towels in the washer and start a washing & drying cycle. This will greatly help preparations for the next guests. Again this is only if you have time when leaving, you'll still be great guests if you don't.
host_about:
I'm a French independent film producer, constantly traveling between Paris and Los Angeles. I'm very keen on making my apartments as comfortable and convenient as possible. Cleanliness and taking care of my things are a big priority for me, so I prefer guests who are the same...
I'm happy to host all the nice travelers out there, whether in LA, Paris, Morocco or Cap Ferret.
I'll always be there to answer your questions or needs as best as I can.

space: This 73m2, 2 bdrm, 1.5 bath apartment is located in the center of Paris, in the lovely Marais district. The apartment is on the fourth floor with an elevator. It has a living room and one full bath and one bathroom en suite with a shower and sink. The apartment is spacious, quiet and lots of old parisian charm... Area: Throughout the centuries, Le Marais gradually came to offer one of the richest architectural ensemblages in Paris. space: A private room in my appartement with a private bathroom. It's located on the first floor, on the street. The room is 9,3 m2 big, the bathroom 1,9 m2 The Entrance with a dressroom : 1m2 The nice thing about the room is, you don't have to come into my apartment first. The room has a little kitchenette with a fridge, hotplates and a little oven. The bathroom is with shower. Nearby you will find all the shops you need. There are supermarkets (Carrefour, leader price...), groceries, a nice bakery 25 m from your door, many restaurants, cafés, and even a Nicolas wineshop. At 10 mns walk from the appartment is the beautiful parc Montsouris : created at the end of the XIX century, this parc that is styled as an english garden abounds with different vegetal species and birds. 3 buses are passing near the house, the metro station is close too.

space: If you want to immerse yourself in the life of Paris, this apartment is for you! It is located in a neighborhood where you do not come across many tourists. But it is fairly central and served by metro and bus to visit the city easily. At the heart of a neighborhood friendly and popular of the 11th district, charming 2 rooms of 30m2 fully furnished, for 2 people. The apartment has a living room (no TV), bedroom (bed 140), a kitchen, a bathroom with shower and toilet. It is located on the 2nd floor without elevator. The kitchen has a refrigerator, stove and oven: everything to make his own meals and save!, Its also available: a washing machine, internet access, bed linen and towels are provided. The end of stay cleaning is the responsibility of the tenant. Good location for a real immersion in the Parisian life, you will be a 10 minute walk to Pere Lachaise, the Bastille and the Place de la Nation, 10 minutes by subway REPUBLIC. Nearby there is a pool, all shops, a market ... The metro

host_about: Parisienne depuis quelques années, je découvre encore Paris mais le 11ème arrondissement reste pour moi un des meilleurs pour vivre, se promener et sortir. J'aime penser que mon appartement sert à des touristes aimant vivre immergés dans un pays inconnu. J'aime donc bien rencontrer mes locataires et leur laisser quelques adresses. Je suis respectueuse et demande donc à mes locataires de l'être aussi en retour (respect des horaires, respect des lieux, honnêteté, cordialité...). Je serai aussi disponible si vous avez besoin de renseignements lors de votre séjour.

space: Great studio apartment with a panoramic view of Paris. The big bay windows open up to the breathtaking view of Paris monuments. You can enjoy it from your balcony where you can sit at the table and enjoy a flaky, buttery croissant with your coffee. “Paul” in the Montparnasse station just a 1 minute walk away, sells a full spectrum of pastries from croissants to pains au chocolat to quiches. Indulge. The apartment has a practical floor plan! If you’ve ever stayed in a French studio apartment before, we are sure you will agree that this is a very comfortable size compared to most. You can also relax in the roomy bathroom which provides a nice deep bathtub. You’ll be delighted with the sleek, efficient European kitchen. There are two gas burners for stovetop cooking. The clothes washing machine is also in the kitchen. Pots, pans, dishes, glassware, cups, cutlery and many other food prep utensils are in drawers and cupboards. Just open up and you’ll find it all. house_rules: Recycling system. Trash not to be thrown out after 20h00 and before 09h00.   Yellow container = cardboard, plastic bottles, paper White container= glass Green container= every kind of trash   NO parties allowed.  Families welcomed, infrastructure for young children less than 2 years old. Baby bed, trolley at disposal upon requests. If along stay of more than one week the cleaning is compulsory and done by the person in charge.  NON SMOKING - Smoking in the premises may cause the payment of a cleaning and deodorizing service of 100€
host_about:
I will be glad welcoming people from around the world in our “Chambre d'hote”, sort of Frenchy B&B. I also have a spacious appartement in Montmartre rue Orsel for those who travel in family or group. 
We hope to be hosting people from all over the world to make them discover the fascinating live of Montmartre  a real Village within the city. Come to 'La Chambre d'Amelie', get breakfast at Amélie's Café, and drift around the neighbourhood to live like a real Parisian! In Saint Germain des Près, you will have a fasciniting flat pretty close to the Mecca of GAstronomy 'Le Bon Marché'. Drift around Saint Germain des Près and the Latin Quarter to discover one of the most traditional Parisian districts. 

We will share with our guests all the new addresses in the city, the greatest restaurants in town, the nicest exhibitions and all our feelings about Paris and is exciting gastronomic and cultural live!

space: This is a recently-renovated, very completely furnished and equipped independent self-service flat with white pine floors in a historic (low building) neighborhood, in an 1860 building that has a crooked charm. The main room has two beds arranged as couches and an open serviceable kitchen, the bedroom has a large queen bed (slightly wider than a US queen, it is 160 cm by 200 cm) and a shower room off it with a beautiful stone italian open shower. Full capacity: this apartment can sleep 4 and is very comfortable for a couple. There are clean feather pillows. The cupboard usually has a few teas and coffees, and there is plenty of gear for cooking (a huge open air market occurs three times per week -- Sunday, Tuesday and Friday; on top of that, this apartment is near Chinatown and its markets), and plenty of guidebooks, cable tv, wifi internet, and a few spare novels. There is a washer-dryer and A/C in the apartment. There a separate toilet with a sink off the main room. The windows are d
description: In Parisian Paris, a sunny well-renovated tastefully and very-completely furnished self-service independent flat for a couple, with +2 extra sleeping capacity. Standard French contract terms (1-year renewable). This unit has two rooms (one bedroom + one living room), totalling 33 m2 (108 square feet). It is up one flight of stairs on an old cobbled mews in the Butte Aux Cailles, a charming and lively neighborhood, reminiscent of Montmartre, with good transport connections to all Paris. transit: Very close to public transport links at Place d'Italie and Corvisart (metro lines 5, 6, and 7; there are also 5 bus lines stopping). Place d'Italie is a major public transport hub, giving easy access to all major sites by bus metro, and links to trains (links to SNCF and RER trains out of town); taxis and rental car services are also available at Place d'Italie. Covered parking is also available under the Italie 2 shopping center on Place d'Italie: its entrance is on Avenue Italie (and exit on rue Bobillot); street parking is also available on most streets for a fee (meters take credit cards).  There are public rental bikes called Velib' at the corner of rue du Moulin des Pres and rue Bobillot, but these tend to require you have a chip card.
access: The long cobbled courtyard is a shared common space for locking a bike or eating outdoors. Please keep in mind that it requires that you be steady on your feet. There is no elevator and entry requires a one-story walk up.
interaction: Generally, I will meet you to give you a key and a tour.
house_rules: Leave the unit as you found it. On departure, please strip beds and pile linens for washing. Replace  an item if minor breakage. Other common sense rules: neighbors need respect (11 pm to 8 am quiet time), and discretion; be sure to lock windows and door when you're out; and please call for any repair.
host_about: Originally from New York, have lived in Paris 18 years and dare to ride a bike here.

house_rules: Check-In / Check-Out •  Arrival: Please always make sure to call the number(s) provided in the booking confirmation for any last minute communication regarding your arrival (ie: your arrival is delayed, etc). At luggage claim at the airport or one hour before the estimated arrival at the apartment if you're traveling by car or train, always call the key holder/owner number you've been provided in the booking confirmation. Please note that the key holder will not go to the apartment unless you set an appointment with her/him, don't assume to find anybody at the apartment or you may end up waiting. Please ensure to have a copy of your ID with you upon arrival. •  Check-in Time: Check-in is free if it takes place between 12:00 am and 8.30 pm. If you want to check in earlier, you will not be charged any extra fee, but you may have to leave your luggage at the apartment and wait until the apartment is ready. Late check-ins between 8.30 and 10:30 pm are charged an extra fee of 20 euro. Check

space: Apartment very well located and close to all commerce and activity. Very bright south-facing (3 large windows). Haussemanien type, high ceilings, wood floors, moldings, marble fireplace. With less than 50 meters: bakery, pharmacy, tobaccos, supermarkets, butchers, restaurant, fast food. Direct access to the apartment : Montmartre, Arc de Triomphe, Concorde, Champs Elysees, Invalides, Galeries Lafayette, Opéra, Châtelet, Gare du Nord, de l'Est, Montparnasse. To arrive at the apartment since the airport the simplest acces (my favorite with minimum change) is :  - to take the RER B(REGIONAL EXPRESS NETWORK) to "Gare du Nord"  - To exit "Gare du Nord" (out the station in the street) and To Take the Bus n°31 in the direction of "Charles de Gaule Etoile" on the street "Boulevard de Magenta". The bus stop is "Guy Moquet" !

space: Ideal for the Family! This typically Parisian large flat of 106 square meters may welcome up to 6 adults and is ideally located in front of the metro station "Lourmel" which connects to the very heart of the city in less than 10 minutes. The place is also at 20 minutes walking distance from the Eiffel Tower, going through very typically Parisian shopping streets full of cafes, restaurants, farmers market, grocery store, boulangerie, starbucks... The main bedroom has got a "king size" bed (160cm * 200 cm), the children's bedroom has got bunkbeds (90cm * 190cm) and the living room may welcome more persons on 2 comfortable sofa beds. The kitchen is especially large for a flat in Paris with a seating for 4 persons, all the modern appliances you could expect (included Nespresso Coffee machine). The large living room allows diner for up to 10 persons, flat TV with cable (100+channels all languages) , high speed internet access (fiber optic of 100Mb) and DVD. Two bathrooms are available, one

space: In the heart of the old Paris (Arts et Métiers, 5 mn to Le Marais and République), a duplex on the 4th and 5th floor of a 17th century building, a charming renovated 2 bedroom apartment . And made to be extremely comfortable and cozy for families - and even with young children, or for couples. Up to 5 people can sleep in the apartment , which is child-friendly.  You can either cook in the cozy kitchen/living area, rest on the couch overlooking the lovely Rue du Vertbois, or look at the stars on the bed under the rooftop.  The apartment is in the same building as the famous restaurant l'Ami Louis, where Bill Clinton, Woody Allen and Jacques Chirac have been seen before among others. The neighbourhood is 5 minutes from the Centre Pompidou, 5 minutes from Le Marais and from République.  The pictures are from how it was before we did works recently. While waiting for the Airbnb photographers to come, imagine that It will look even better than this!!

transit: The apartment is close to the 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 11 lines of the parisian subway. (Stations: Arts et métiers, Temple, République, Réaumur Sebastopol).  There is a private parking near the house, although I generally suggest not to come to Paris by car, since it is difficult and expensive to park your car, which you won't need so much as  the apartment is very central.
access: Guests will have access to internet, tv, and free telephone to fix numbers in Europe. Also access to our library and DVDs.
interaction: We will can be reached by e-mail or by telephone for urgent matters during the stay.
house_rules: Please keep the apartment clean and in good condition.In the room upstairs: do not leave the stores of the windows closed during the day (sun and heat damages its capacity to stay closed)Do not attempt to walk on the roof!When you shut the entrance door from the inside, check to see if the door is well shut, it is not easy at first sight.Please do not bring pets. And avoid smoking in the apartment.

space: Une spacieuse salle de séjour avec TV écran plat système de son surround, cheminée, table à manger pliante et ses 8 chaises.  La cuisine américaine entièrement équipée ouverte sur le salon et est équipée avec tous vos besoins. (Ustensiles de cuisine, KitchenAid Robot, etc) + Lave-linge combo sèche et un lave-vaisselle, bien sûr.  Les deux chambres ont leur propre salle de bains, la chambre principale est équipée d'un jacuzzi élégant (de nombreux programmes, lumières, etc) / douche et d'un lit queen size (160cms) avec matelas confortable (nous changeons côtés de matelas à chaque saison). Dock iPod évidemment dans la chambre à coucher. Le 2ème, plus petit, avec seulement une douche et un lit double (140cms). Contrairement au passé, cette chambre a maintenant une vraie porte (du 13 décembre), chaque chambre a sa salle de bains. Les toilettes sont séparées.  3ème étage français, pas d'ascenseur.  1 min à pied de la Bastille métro (4 lignes principales de là)  Je recommande cet appartement

access: Free Wifi + Free international calls to more than 100 countries (land line only for all and mobile for US).
interaction: I currently live abroad so a gorgeous woman called "France" will take care of your arrival and during your stay.
house_rules: Smoking at the window only. Preferably no pets. I only allow 4 people max to sleep in. The sofas in the living room are not pulling out into a bed and cannot be used to sleep in. No extrabed will be added. Babybed can be added for a small fee. (25 usd)
host_about:
I am native from Beirut, Lebanon. Lived in France and now moved out to Indonesia where I have founded my bakery in Bali.

I have started my pro life as a computer engineer, trader on financial markets (Forex + derivatives), and finally became an entrepreneur in 2003 by turning my ideas into businesses.


I am the owner and executive chef of my bakery, passionated by food and entreprenariat. I have also founded a worldwide cooking classes website cook-o

I love the concept of Airbnb, I am using the website to host and travel. People dealing with people brings the best of them. I thing meeting people is key in life, I will be happy to host you in Paris or Bali and get connected in a way or another.

house_rules: Please try  to keep this apartment as clean as you find it when you arrive . Don't put luggages on the bed ...  you have been  rolling it  it all over the world .how can you sleep after putting it on the bed !  Thank's a lot . Marie
host_about:
Hi every body ,  Je suis un pur produit Français , Belge par mon mariage , j'ai 2 enfants .
Chef de produits au service   export  chez LANCÔME: Grèce,  Liban , Irlande, Allemagne , Suisse , puis j'ai monté ma propre société à Paris ,"Cosmétiques/ Esthétique  .
Je suis gourmande ,et je fais  de la bonne cuisine , et surtout d'excellents chocolats.
je suis une fervente admiratrice des arts en général , et proche des ateliers des peintres .

Je suis proche de nos amis étrangers , et peux les guider utilement pendant leur séjour .

space: Located in a calm little street, the flat have a side on the street with the kitchen (fully equipped) and the living-room, and the other side on a little court with the bedroom and the bathroom. The building have 4 floor and the flowery courtyard open to everyone. Despite the ground floor, the day light comes in the living room pretty well (south facing facade). The bedroom is really quiet (we sleep regulary with the window opened). The living room have a sofa bed so the hosting capacity could be 2 people + 2 optionnals. We own a big cave just under the flat wich allows us to put easily our clothes during the renting. Therefore you could fully use our drawers and wardrobe.
description: 42 sq m, ground floor, practical, clean and quiet. Bedroom with a king size bed, kitchen, living room (with a bed-settee) and bathroom. Located in the 20th district in the Belleville neighborhood, at 5 minutes from Jourdain subway station Located in a calm little street, the flat have a side on the street with the kitchen (fully equipped) and the living-room, and the other side on a little court with the bedroom and the bathroom. Shops: A lot of supermarkets, with 2 specialised in organic food and 1 in froze
transit: The subway line number 11 is a 5 minute walk. It will take you directly to the Republic Square in 10 minutes, and "Chatelet" (the big hub of the city) in 15 minutes. The subway line number 2 is 10 minutes walk and takes you in 15 minutes to Montmartre and 25 minutes to the "Arc de Triomphe/Champs-Elysées". 3 bus stations, an electric car renting and bicycle station just next to the flat.
access: Shops: A lot of supermarkets, with 2 specialised in organic food and 1 in frozen food. Markets around everyday (except monday and wednesday). Butcher, fishmonger, cheese shop, vegetable shop too. Parks:  2 littles parks closed to the flat, and Buttes Chaumont at 15 minutes by foot. Bar, restaurants: Bunch of affortable and quality places that we would be glad to advice.
interaction: We give you a neighborhood's map with advices and tips.

space: Beautiful openplan 90m2 loft situated in a private, courtyard with decking & bamboo. Recently renovated loft converted lovingly into our family home with wooden floorboards throughout, new kitchen, bathroom, 1 lounge, 2 double bedrooms (160cm width Simmons matress on a ‘bed-up’ suspended system which enables the bed to be pushed up upon the ceiling during the day allowing bedroom 1 to be used as an office if required + 140 cm width Simmons matress standard double bed) and 1 childrens  bedroom with a single bed plus 1 baby travel cot with a real matress including childrens toys and books (0 – 7yrs). 1 double sofabed (Habitat 140cm width) in the lounge, 15m2 private courtyard, accessed directly from the kitchen, tranquil and light. The flat is located in rue Pajol, in front of the new eco neighbourhood of Zac Pajol, which consists of gardens, parks, concert hall, bars and restaurants, orgnanic bakery, library and gynasium. Situated next to three metro stations, La Chapelle (line 2), Marx

host_about:
We're a french/english couple with two small boys and have been living in Paris for many years. We've converted with love this old parisian atelier in a bright and unusual loft to make it our home in a lively and very well located neighborhood. We will be happy to supply you with all the necessary local tips!
Life is not a race... its a journey. Enjoy :) 

English, french, german and spanish spoken.

space: Hello, This is a very nice apartment, located in the heart of the capital near the Jardin du Luxembourg. The Jardin du Luxembourg, or the Luxembourg Gardens, is the second largest public park in Paris(phone number hidden) m² (22.5 hectares) located in the 6th arrondissement of Paris, France. The park is the garden of the French Senate, which is itself housed in the Luxembourg Palace. In my flat there is a large living room and a quiet bedroom on a garden. For the equipment there is a washing machine a dishwasher a microwave an oven kettle . In the bathroom there is a shower and a  bath, 2 WC,a hairdryer,  We also have a tv and the internet. For the metro it´s  Rennes or Saint-Placide. Saint-Germain-des-Prés, Montparnasse, Latin Quarter known for its student life, lively atmosphere and bistrosis at  5 minutes walk. Musée d'Orsay on the left bank of the Seine and the Louvre: only at 15 min walk

For a maximum of six people.  Renting for one week or more, only in summer (July/August) Don't hesitate to ask for more information.
description: An industrial building transformed into a house, 130 m2 on three floors, three rooms, one office, two bathrooms and a sunny roof terrasse of (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , a three levels house, with a sunny roof terrasse on the top. A peaceful and quiet home located in a vibrant neighbourhood (nearby Canal Saint Martin and Parc de la Villette).  For a maximum of six people.  Renting for one week or more, only in summer (July/August) Don't hesitate to ask for more information. Guests will have access to the whole house.  I will welcome the guests. But I won't be present during their stay.  The most modern, vibrant and rejuvenated neighbourhood in Paris – the 19th District. This former industrial area is a hotspot for great nights out, massive investment and romance along the scenic canals - featured in Amélie.  Our house can be found nearby the Bassin de la Villette – connecting the famous Canal St-Martin. It's also a well connected district in Paris, with two underground Metro stati
transit: Easily accessible by metro, a few stations from Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est (thus connected to the Paris airports). We don't have a private garage, but a car can be easily parked in the street or in a public underground car park.
access: Guests will have access to the whole house.
interaction: I will welcome the guests. But I won't be present during their stay.
host_about:
Une maison est un autoportrait. Dans celle où je vous propose de vivre quelques jours, les bibliothèques – littératures, sciences humaines, arts –, la filmothèque, mais aussi la terrasse arborée, les étages qui permettent à chacun de s'isoler ou de recevoir, le calme au cœur de la ville dans ce qu'elle a de plus vivant : tout cela en dit davantage sur moi que je ne saurais le faire en quelques lignes. 
PS. Je suis professeur de littérature française dans l'enseignement supérieur. J'habite désormais seul dans cette maison que j'ai partagée, et louée régulièrement, avec Mario. C'est pourquoi son nom continue d'apparaitre dans les commentaires. 
A home is a self-portrait. In mine, the numerous bookcases – literature, social sciences, arts –, the film library, but also the terrace with trees, the three levels allowing both privacy and social life, the atmosphere of calm in the heart of town : all this describes me better than I could. 
PS. I teach french literature in higher education. I now live alone, in this place that I shared for years with Mario : that is why his name remains in the comments.

Table for meals and TV table. • A bathroom with double sink, shower bath. • A room with a double bed (for a booking of two people). Comfortable mattress and bedding included. • A futon bed in the living room added on request (set up with bedding so superior booking of 2 people). You will also find on-site hair dryers and irons on request (+ a small ironing board on request), unlimited internet, huge TV and also a map of Paris to move. • Other informations : - Decoration under the sign of Buddha. Zen cozy atmosphere. All amenities and residential area, 400 m subway Belleville and park buttes chaumont. Cleaning fee € 20 extra in cash to give during the check in. access: At the heart of Paris. Line 2 or 11 metro stop "Belleville". 6 minutes walk afterwards. Allow about 45 minutes from Charles de Gaulle Airport and 1 hour drive to Orly.
interaction: A guide is propose to you in the flat with the best addresses around and in Paris. Don't hesitate to contact me by mail or airbnb or wattapps. I speak English, I finally try.
house_rules: Making clean the apartment and leave the furniture as found on arrival. Also thank you to close windows and shutters on departure. Parties, animals and smoking in the flat are not allowed.  Thank you to follow these few guidelines. Enjoy paris, it is an extra city
host_about: Salut j'ai 33 ans et vous propose mon appartement à Paris. Fan également d AIRBNB lors de mes voyages internationaux, je savoure aussi en tant que hôte et reste à votre disposition si vous avez besoin d'aide et de conseils. Je suis ravie de partager mon espace, c'est atypique, y'a rien de mieux ... Bienvenue chez moi

space: Studio located in the 13th arrondissement of Paris (Chinatown) Down home, you will find a bakery, pharmacy, grocery, Chinese restaurants, French, Italian, and especially Parisian brasserie subway stop, bus station & bicycle. At 3 minutes from the commercial center of the Place d'Italie. 10 minutes from Chatelet-Les Halles and Notre Dame. The apartment is a studio of 22m ². The bathroom includes shower, toilet, washbasin. The studio is separated into 2, comprising, on one side, a sofa bed or can be made to sleep two people, and the other a double bed. TV with cable channels, DVD player, table available. Washing machine, fridge, oven, microwave, two electric The studio is equipped with floating floors and tiles in the entrance and in the bathroom. Bright apartment: 2 large windows + small window in the bathroom. Lots of storage!

interaction: Nous remettons les clés de l'appartement en main propre au locataire et répondons a toutes ces questions. Apres nous sommes joignable uniquement au téléphone
house_rules: pas d'animaux, possibilité de fumer mais uniquement sur le palier
host_about:
Plutôt que de me décrire, je vais vous dire comment ca se passe si vous venez passez un séjour dans notre appartement : 

La veille de votre arrivée, le nettoyage de l'appartement est fait. Les draps seront lavés. Le lit sera fait.

Le jour de votre visite, je vous souhaite la bienvenue. Vous avez quelque chose à manger à l'arrivée (type: pain, œufs, café, beurre)

Lors de notre rencontre, je répondrai à vos questions et vous conseiller sur les choses à faire dans la ville, si vous voulez.

L'appartement est à vous pour la durée de votre séjour. Il n'y avait que vous, personne d'autre.

À bientôt

Martin

space: SPACIOUS AND SUNNY The apartment is quiet, spacious, has lots of light on all sides. Very nice sized rooms, extremely quiet (soundproof windows), in a young, lively environment with bars, shops and restaurants all around. On the second floor (no elevator) it offers the privilege of an open and green terrace (very rare in Montmartre), where you can eat all together.  1 master bedroom giving access to the terrace. One kids' bedroom  with bunk beds. And the kitchen space integrated within a dining/living room space.  The apartment is 50m2 -  Plus a wide open terrace (20m2), complete with patio furniture, table, umbrella, six chairs and BBQ!!! Sleeps 4 comfortably. A/C unit on wheels and fans in case of heat wave. The kitchen and bathroom (with bathtub) have just been remodeled.
description: COMFORTABLE, QUIET, SUNNY, GREAT VALUE! BIG 50m2. Sleeps 4.  RARE: terrace for dining out (or smoking) ANCIENT. Wood beams. Many amenities. BBQ, juicer, vapor cooker, wifi, laptop. transit: Very well located at the intersection of three metro lines, (Abbesses, Anvers, Chateau Rouge) and 4 bus lines. With Sacré Coeur and its luscious green park being just behind the house. It takes 20 minute metro ride to Notre Dame, 10-15 minutes to the Opera, 15 minutes to Bastille, Arc de Triomphe and Chatelet and 30-35 minutes to the Eiffel tower. FROM CHARLES DE GAULLE AIRPORT Take the RER B (suburbs' train) and get off at Gare du Nord. (about 30 to 40 minutes) Then take metro line 4, towards Porte de Clignancourt, you will be here in 5 minutes, Metro Château Rouge. Then up the hill till Montmartre, 3 minutes on foot.  FROM ORLY Take the OrlyBus to Denfert-Rochereau. Then take the metro, line 4, DIRECTION Porte de Clignancourt, and get off at Château Rouge. (30 minutes) Then up the hill till Montmartre, 3 minutes on foot. FROM BEAUVAIS Take their Bus service to Porte Maillot. Then walk to metro Porte Maillot, take Line 1 Direction Château de Vincennes. Get off 2 stops later, at Charle
access: MANY AMENITIES Enjoy Hi-speed internet. BUT NO TV.  Dishwasher, microwave and hot air oven, blender, etc. Even a free phone for you to make international calls anywhere (LAND LINES ONLY) Tea bags and coffee will be there for you, as well as toilet paper and cleaning products for your use, with the only condition to please replace them if you finish them. We base our relationship on trust and mutual respect.  We've prepared a folder containing some neighborhood maps. And plenty of suggestions for some of the best restaurants in town.
interaction: We are out of town, but you'll be able to reach us at all times by phone or email. And in case of a physical presence needed, our friend and neighbor Krystyna will come to your rescue if we can't.
house_rules: Non-smoking apartment please. (Smokers can go on the terrace, but please use the ashtrays and not the flower pots!). For allergy reasons we cannot allow pets. PLEASE COMMUNICATE your arrival and departure times CLEARLY. We want to be able to clean no later than 2PM. You are welcome to leave your bags in the flat if your plane is leaving later than that. And if you arrive extra early or extra late, special arrangements MUST be made in advance. Thanks ;)
host_about: We love movies and art and good food. We've travelled a lot in Asia and in Europe and a little in Africa. We are both artists, a filmmaker and a composer, and we are very laid back, tolerant people. We enjoy others and life. We try to lessen our ecological footprint by consuming less energy, so we bike and only use rental cars. And we use ecological materials in our home renovations.

space: An ideally situated apartment, right in the heart of Paris, in Montmartre quarter, very close to the Sacre Coeur. Completely renovated, this apartment of 35 m2 offers you all the comfort and conveniences that any tourist may expect during his stay in Paris. The apartment is situated on the third floor of a very quiet building. It has two rooms:  The living room with a comfortable sofa bed (140 x 200), TV with all the cable channels (Free), a convertible coffee table that you may use for your meals when converted, a stereo, free WI-FI. The open kitchen (American style) is fully equipped with oven, microwave, fridge with freezer compartment, washing machine, toaster, kettle, coffee machine, ceramic hob ....) The separate bedroom has a comfortable new bed (140 X 200) and lockers. Supplied sheets. Cot on request. A shower room with toilet offers as well all the needed comfort (hair dryer, towels ...) Parquet floor in the living room and the bedroom. The apartment is located in an inner cou

access: Les voyageurs ont accès à tout l'appartement qui est entièrement équipés: Cuisine entièrement équipée pour cuisiner, salle de bain avec serviettes fournies, Chambre indépendante avec draps et couvertures fournis, Salon avec canapé lit, TV et Internet Wifi. Aucune zone de l'appartement n'est partagée. Pas d'interdiction de prévues tout en restant dans le respect des voisins et en évitant de faire trop de bruits.
interaction: Les propriétaires habitent dans le même quartier et sont rapidement sur place en cas de besoin. Ils sont joignables à tout moment par téléphone, mail ou messagerie Airbnb. Disponibilité assurée!!
host_about: My name is Sandy. I am a true Parisian. You are always welcome to Paris and enjoy a nice stay in the entire apartment. I will let you know lots of things you wish to be informed about Paris.
