space: Duplex located on the 5th and 6th floors (with lift) of a Parisian 30's building, just one street off the St Martin Canal, at the heart of trendy Paris (10th arrondissement), near the newly Place de la République. Near Metro lines 3,5,8 & 9 (République station) and 11 (Goncourt) Direct metro to the Eiffel Tower, Marais, Concorde, Tuileries, Champs Elysees, Bastille. 15mn walks to The Marais. The neigh borough is very trendy, with numerous restaurants, cafes, bars, shops and a food store just at the end of the street. 2 bedrooms (2 queen size beds), 2 bathrooms, 2 toilets, living room, American kitchen. Wifi and cable TV. 2 single beds possible in surcharge (one in the same room with one of the double bed). Bed sheets, towels included.

interaction: Nous serons nous même en congés pendant la période de location et donc absents mais nous serons joignables.
host_about: We are a couple, both raised in Paris, and we love this city. We have 2 children, 11 and 15 years old. We rent our flat from times to times, when we are on holidays. We love it ! You have to know it is a living place not a postal card place :-) See you soon !

space: We are renting out our apartment/loft, situated between Place de la Republique and Belleville, a short walk to the romantic Canal Saint Martin and the feisty neighbourhood of Oberkampf.  - 100m2 with three bedrooms, and 1 sofa bed in the living room (possibility to sleep 2-3 adults and 2 kids) - Two bathrooms: one with a bathtub and the other, an Italian shower - A separate washer and dryer room - Fully-equiped kitchen (fridge, dishwasher, oven) - High Speed Internet Wifi  The apartment has lots of light and sits in the middle of a large, quiet, enclosed courtyard, so kids can play safely outside. Also, it offers beautiful, unobstructed views of Parisian rooftops. Ground floor of the building are workspaces for artisans.  The apartment was completely renovated and refurbished in 2010. Easily accessible with two metro lines (2 and 11) and bus routes (46 and 75). Ideal for artists, who seek a quiet place to work, or for families with kids. The courtyard is very safe, with two sets of cod

host_about: I was born in Singapore and grew up in California, now in Paris, working and raising two hellions. I've done my share of globetrotting, and have settled down, to my parent's relief, in this corner of Belleville, enjoying the vibrant and culturally diverse neighborhood, which can sometimes be a bazaar, but filled also with lots of quiet corners and hidden treasures, which I hope you too, will have the chance to encounter.

space: In the heart of Montorgueil, in the 2nd district, on the first floor of a historic and classified building. Newly refitted, kitchen with all the amenities, bright, 5 big windows for 48 square meters, bathroom with big tub, dressing, bedroom with shutters and blinds. There's Wi-Fi, TV with international channels, DVD/CD player, electric fan. It's a very sought after area, pedestrian streets, markets, cinemas, theatre, close to everything Paris has to offer. One of the highlight of this wonderful part of Paris are the prototypical of indoor shopping malls, the Galleries, which got their start in 1786 when the Duke of Orleans realized that there was money to be made by renting out his cloistered garden to small shops.  A walking tour of the galleries can easily be accomplished in an hour or so, and is worthwhile. Start with La Gallerie Vivienne which is the best preserved of the galleries and whose décor has been maintained in authentic colors from the era. It's really the mosaic floor wh

house_rules: There is one king size bed in the bedroom and one pull-out sofa in the living room that can accommodate one person, maybe two if they're small. In addition, there is a mattress that can be spread on the floor for a fourth guest. There is an electric fan for the summer months. Check in time is from 15:00. Check out time is up to 12:00. If possible, check in and check out times can be flexible. Il ya un lit king size dans la chambre et un canapé-lit dans le salon qui peut accueillir une personne, peut-être deux si elles sont petites. En plus, on peut mettre un matelas sur le sol du salon pour une quatrième personne. Il ya un ventilateur électrique pour les mois d'été. Heure d'arrivée à partir de 15h00. L'heure de départ est à 12h00. Lorsque c'est possible, check-in et check out sont aménageables.
host_about:
Fitness coach at Klay club in Paris :). 

Welcome in Paris and to the Montorgueil district which offers two amazing sides of Paris= the Olf city with its little boutiques and bars, and for instance the Passage du Grand Cerf where our home is located; and a few blocks away, Les Halles and Beaubourg with a vibrant cultural and shopping life.

space: The apartment is located on the 1st floor overlooking a courtyard, It is fully air-conditioned. You have a living room with a sofa bed in gray leather with a very comfortable bed. A coffee table, an extandable dining table, a flat screen TV and international channels. The unlimited internet with wifi is offered .. The kitchen, is in extension of the living. It features all the appliances you want with, in particular, a dishwasher and a washer dryer. Varied dishes and cooking utensils are provided to you. One bedroom overlooks the courtyard and is very quiet. It consists of a double bed, bedside tables and a large closet. Toilets are independant. The apartment is air conditioned, electric heating is a wood flooring covers the apartment.

space: Hello, My studio is located in the Montorgeuil pedestrian neighborhood at the 2nd arrondissement of Paris. The walking distance to the Louvre museum is 10 min. so we're at the very center of Paris where the day and the night life is very animated. The studio is very close to the main attractions, you can reach everywhere by walking or cyclling.  Seine River side is only 10 min., Opéra 10min., Hotel de Ville 15 min., Notre Dame De Paris 20min. away by walking distance.  In order to go to Champs Elysées, you just take the metro at the Louvre-Rivoli (M1) station and 4 stops later, you're there. You can also reach Champs Elysées by walking in 20-25min. Eiffel Tower is situated at the south of Champs Elysées, so once you get in Champs Elysées, Eiffel Tower is very close... As the center of Paris is, in fact, very small, you can reach all the main attractions by walking...if you have enough time. If not, you can also rent a bike at the side street of the studio, there's a bike station. First

space: 60m2 (645 square ft) appartement with 2 Bedrooms with double bed and  a large living room with a balcony overlooking Paris! From the balcony you can enjoy an exclusive view of almost all major Parisian monuments including the Butte Montmartre with the Sacre coeur on top, The Sparkling Eiffel Tower, the Roof of the Opera the Paris and La Défense Business district far in the end! The flat is located in front the 18th century Hospital Saint Louis. The flat is on the 5th floor with elevator in a 1900 "Faubourg style" building. The kitchen is fully furnished with refrigerator, freezer, nespresso machine, boiler, stove, microwave, oven and a dishwasher. The 2 bedrooms are located in the other side of the building, with a view on the courtyard, so it's extremely quiet at night.

space: Hello, I'm renting my studio for travelers who wish to visit Paris without paying overpriced hotels. It's located in the east part of Paris, in Gambetta. There are many bars and restaurants there, as well as a movie theater, theaters and the famous "Pere Lachaise" cimetery.  The Buttes Chaumont park is accessible by bus (only a short 10 minutes ride). In the east part of Paris, you'll find the best places to hang out : the streets of Menilmontant and Oberkampf are very popular for their tons of bars (it's like East Village in NYC!), you can have a picnic on the Canal Saint Martin, along Quai de Jemmapes and Valmy.... My studio is fully refreshed, it's sunny and very quiet. There is an elevator (6th floor). It's nicely equipped with free wifi internet access, bathtub, a hair dryer, an oven, and an iron. For your comfort, the towels and bed linen sheets are furnished.  Feel free to contact me for further informations.  License Numb (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  Cheers, Natacha

space: Pretty studio, ideal for a couple discovering Paris. It is close to the Grands Magasins and the Opera, and next to the Metro Saint Lazare.  The building is not a luxurious Haumannian building, it is a simple and clean Parisian building, no frills. If being in a fancy-luxurious building is important for you, don't book my place. The 9th district is one of the trendiest areas in Paris, very french with many bistros, restaurants and bars!!!  You'll be 15 minutes away from Montmartre, the Sacré Coeur, the Canal Saint Martin and Pigalle.  You'll have everything you need nearby: the subway, bus statiosn, taxis, bikes (Vélib), shops and convenience stores, parks..  The place is entirely furnished with a comfortable bed in the room, a bathroom. You'll be able to have your own French meals thanks to a fully equipped kitchen!  Come and live Paris like a local!

host_about:
Bonjour à tous,
Pour me présenter en quelques mots, je travaille dans le secteur audiovisuel et j'adore voyager! Je ne pourrais pas vivre sans livre, le studio en est plein, en français et en anglais! Avec une préférence pour Mickael Connelly et Harlan Coben. Vous pourrez aussi regarder un bon dvd par temps de pluie! (De Claude Sautet à "Sex and the city" en passant par  "24h")
Voilà! A bientôt!
Carole

host_about: I'm Australian. And French. I teach English in various forms at French Grandes Ecoles and am also a freelance language and communications trainer. I've been living in France for nearly 20 years but have spent at least some time in about 50 other countries. Some of these I've lived and worked in too. I like to think travelling broadens my mind. As my homely flat is of a modest size I don't usually host, however I am happy to have trustworthy strangers move in while I'm away mostly in the summer.

space: 2 bedroom apartment in central and convenient Marais neighborhood of Paris (4th arrondissment).  2 sunny living rooms with one balcony.  Full kitchen, wireless internet, cable tv, digital piano, bathtub/shower and toilet. 85 square meters. I've repainted the living room and hallway and replaced the bathroom window. 2 queen beds (1 in each bedroom), 2 couches (1 in each living room).  An inflatable air mattress is available if needed.  Sheets and towels are provided. Smoking is permitted on the balcony, which has a great view of rue de Rivoli. No pets please. There is an elevator in building or you can take the stairs up 2 floors. There is a full kitchen with a microwave, oven, gas stove, refrigerator and freezer. Great location in the Marais just across the street from bus stop, taxi stand and metro line #1 (direct to Louvre, Concorde, Etoile and more). space: Charming Parisian apartment in the heart of the Latin Quarter. Apartment is very quiet and the location is amazing - 5th arrondissement (district), metro Maubert Mutualité (Line 10) close to Saint Michel (with direct train to CDG airport).  A few minutes walk to Notre Dame (approximately 250 meters), Sorbonne University(300 meters), within St Germain des Près and more...   The apartment is fully furnished, on the 2nd  floor (no lift) and overlooking a courtyard.(no street noises).  It's a 2-bedroom flat with a queen size bed and a double bed, a living room, 1 bathroom with shower cabin, and a well equipped kitchen. Bed linen and towels are included.  At place Maubert is only a few meters from the apartment,  it is a typical french open-air market 3 times a week (mornings), selling  fresh  fruits, vegetables, cheese and other  regional products. space: This clean, well-lit apartment, situated on the 9th floor of an elegant building on a quiet street, has spectacular views out across the iconic Père Lachaise cemetery and is within walking distance of some very cool neighborhoods.A large, bright, open living space, with a completely refurbished open kitchen with wooden bar and new appliances. In the living room there is a comfortable sofa bed, and then in the spacious, separate bedroom there is a double bed.The view is especially unique, over the trees of the most famous cemetery in the world, final home to Edith Piaf, Oscar Wilde, Maria Callas, Frédéric Chopin, Eugène Delacroix and Jim Morrison.And because of it's location, even with the windows open, the sound is occasionally the wind through the trees.- Wifi internet - Washer/dryer - Dishwasher - Fresh towels and linensI'll meet you upon arrival to show you the apartment and help get you settled in, and then I'm always available throughout your stay if you have any questions.Between

space: Located in a quiet street in the Marais district, this apartment has high ceilings that evoke past times (it was constructed in 1666). It enjoys a view rarely found in large cities: a church, a bell tower and a park filled with trees that mark the passage of the seasons with their ever-changing colors.  It can host up to 7 guests distributed in different sleeping areas: there is a double bedroom from which it is possible to directly access one of the 2 bathrooms, a single bedroom, 2 different sleeping lofts low ceilings where there are 2 single beds and a double sofa in the living room. A small but functional kitchen complete the distribution of this flat.  The marais is a beautiful area with a lot of nice shops, cafés and restaurants. You can for exemple have a nice Middle Eastern meal at "la rue des Rosiers". It is a perfect area for every persons who like to live like a parisian and discover small charming streets.  The nice flat is situated near the metro stations "Rambuteau", "Hôt
description: Located in a quiet street in the Marais district, this apartment has high ceilings that evoke past times (it was constructed in 1666). It enjoys a view rarely found in large cities: a church, a bell tower and a park filled with trees that mark the passage of the seasons with their ever-changing colors.  It can host up to 7 guests distributed in different sleeping areas: there is a double bedroom from which it is possible to directly access one of the 2 bathrooms, a single bedroom, 2 different sleeping lofts low ceilings where there are 2 single beds and a double sofa in the living room. A small but functional kitchen complete the distribution of this flat.  The marais is a beautiful area with a lot of nice shops, cafés and restaurants. You can for exemple have a nice Middle Eastern meal at "la rue des Rosiers". It is a perfect area for every persons who like to live like a parisian and discover small charming streets.  The nice flat is situated near the metro stations "Rambuteau", "Hôt

space: Recommandé par le "guide des chambres d'hôtes insolites de Paris" et "guide des chambres d'hôtes pas comme les autres", voici votre chambre "LOUISIANE" au 1er à 140€ la nuit, atypique et charmante, donnant sur terrasse et jardin, ou "SUMATRA" au rez de chaussée à 100€ la nuit, ouverte sur patio intérieur marocain.. Idéalement située a proximité de la Bibliothèque Nationale de France, près de la Seine. Ligne 14,  tramway, RER C ou de nombreux bus vous transportent dans Paris en moins de 20 mn. Vivez votre séjour dans une ambiance calme, exotique et de confort et profitez du jardin, du patio, des vastes proportions en rentrant d'une journée fatigante... L'appartement est décoré avec goût dans un style contemporain et oriental ou le plaisir des yeux va avec l'amour des espaces: On voyage tout en étant dans Paris. space: Two different configurations for the same apartment to suit different needs:  A)A smaller living-dining room plus two bedrooms B)A bigger living room, a dining room and a double bedroom. The change between one configuration and the other can be done very easily thanks to a nice sofa-bed and to the practical curtains. The armchairs are elegant and comfortable and the big modern table allows dinners for six people. The separated bedroom has a big cupboard behind the large mirror and a queen size bed.  The bathroom, with its spacious shower, has been  renovated (march 2013).  The kitchen is separated and fully equipped.  The 19th century wooden beams and the building old style make the rest ti build a great atmosphere! You'll have a wifi access to Internet and television with cable TV.

space: This is a one bedroom apartment situated in the heart of the Quartier Latin, on the sixth floor (top) floor of a 19th century building with an (small) elevator. In the neighborhood there are all sorts of entertainment and services such as cinemas, fashion store, nice restaurants, and cafes. This quiet apartment (by Parisian standards, of course) faces the rue Gay-Lussac street and has a south exposure, with brings in great natural light. The building's main entrance gate is protected by a security system, a digicode-access hallway and a concierge. The flat's entrance gives access to the living room and kitchenette and the apartment has painted walls, parquet throughout, and crown moldings. The bathroom and the kitchenette are tiled with vintage "tommettes". The living room has French doors opening onto a balcony with a table and chairs, and a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower and the Montparnasse Tower. The living room is furnished with a futon, a TV, a sofa that you can use as a bed
description: This is a one bedroom apartment situated in the heart of the Quartier Latin, on the sixth floor (top) floor of a 19th century building with an (small) elevator. In the neighborhood there are all sorts of entertainment and services such as cinemas, fashion store, nice restaurants, and cafes. This quiet apartment (by Parisian standards, of course) faces the rue Gay-Lussac street and has a south exposure, with brings in great natural light. The building's main entrance gate is protected by a security system, a digicode-access hallway and a concierge. The living room is furnished with a futon, a TV, a sofa that you can use as a bed
transit: Easy and super close proximity to the RER B (Luxembourg) and metro (Saint Michel).  Straight line to the airport and train station with NO connections on the RER B... either straight to CDG airport, or straight to the Eurostar and Thalys (Gare Du Nord) train stations. Last but not least (because we love them!) there are a couple of VELIB stations around the corner. You can bike your way through Paris and come home at your leisure with this bike-rental system that Parisians use... A LOT!  :-)
access: Guests have free access to cable TV (freebox), wi-fi internet and local phone calls (convenient if you want people to call you). There is a double set of security doors to access the elevator and you will get the keys to come and go freely and safely.
interaction: We communicate as much as is needed with our guests. Through AirBnB and email, but also by phone when needed once in Paris. You will always have a way to reach us.
house_rules: Contact us for longer stays.  No pets. Sorry about this rule, we cannot accommodate pets, as tiny as they might be. Our insurance policies isn't pet friendly, unfortunately and we would have to jack up the price of the rental.  No noisy parties. You will appreciate the quietness of the building and so do the apartment's neighbors, so please keep the noise level to a minimum between 10pm and 8am. Thank you for all the other tenants ;-) A 75 euro cleaning surcharge fee will be invoiced if the guests do not leave the apartment in mint conditions. On site, cleaning service can be pre-arranged for 60 euros per visit. Once a week max.
host_about:
We are a mother-daughter team... Mom in Paris, daughter in the USA... Mom is retired (she was a computer engineer) and handles the on-location logistics for the rental of our place. 

I work in Marketing and photography and help with all the communication with folks interested in spending time in Paris. So if you simply inquire about our place, I'll be emailing you. If you actually go to our place, my Mom will be with you there :-)

We thoroughly enjoy contributing to the paradigm change that no, not all Parisians are rude (-; 

More seriously, we really enjoy helping people make the best out of their time in Paris and experience it more... like Parisians (rather than only abiding by the traditional beaten tourists paths). 

Oh, and we speak Spanish, Portuñol, French and English and will dabble in a couple more like Italian or German.

space: Furnished, sun-drenched, 55 square meter 2 bedroom apartment located on the trendy rue Oberkampf in the 11th arrondissement available by the week or month only. Good for 2 individuals or a couple. While the apartment can accommodate up to 4 people, our preference is to host two. There is a 250€ supplementary charge/month for each guest after the second. There are two separate bedrooms and a large living room with a door that can close for privacy and with a 160cm couch bed that contains a real mattress meant for daily use.  The living room has a sony bravia flat screen with basic cable included. There is also cable and fiber optic wifi/internet, and a landline phone (free calls to landlines in France, Europe and landlines and cellphones in the USA). I is equipped with a lime retro chair, Italian designed 160cm sofabed (good for daily use), Danish modern coffee table, color tv with cable, and two windows facing northwest. house_rules: This is our home.  So we ask that you treat the place as if you were a guest at a friend's home, a friend you wish to visit again sometime in the future.  Keep it tidy and make sure the apartment and linens are left clean and in move-in condition. And please water the plants ;)
host_about: We are old college roommates who bought a Paris apartment together 16 years ago, having been bitten by the travel bug during a study abroad year.  We have been renting for many years to study abroad students at New York University, professors, and researchers but have since decided to expand onto Air BnB.  Jami lives in Stockholm and is a Professor and Kris lives in New York City and works for a Labor Union.  We both travel extensively and have been both hosts and guests on Airbnb since the beginning.

space: 1 bedroom available in a 2 bedroom apartment in central and convenient Marais neighborhood of Paris.  2 sunny living rooms with balcony.  Full kitchen, wireless internet, cable tv, digital piano, bathtub/shower. 1 queen bed, 1 air mattress. Smoking permitted on balcony. No pets. Elevator in building or stairs up 2 floors. Microwave, oven, gas stove, refrigerator, freezer. Great location just in front of metro, bus stop, taxi stand, bakery, grocery stores, etc. To be clear, there are 2 bedrooms - you would have 1 bedroom and I will be using the other bedroom. There is also an extra room that could be used as an extra bedroom with a small air mattress. Sometimes when I am away, I rent out the entire apartment. See my other listing for details.

interaction: I give my guests space but am available when needed for information or recommendations. I have a fairly large network so if you are interested in meeting people or attending various events, I might be able to arrange that.
house_rules: No parties (unless I host, with your agreement), no pets.  Smoking only permitted on balcony. Please let me know what time you plan to arrive in Paris so that I can meet you at the apartment and give you the keys.
host_about:
I grew up in the suburbs of Detroit, Michigan, then lived in multiple cities in the US and Europe.  I moved to Paris for work many years ago and haven't left yet.
I enjoy traveling, learning languages, trying new cuisines, drinking wine, meeting diverse and interesting people and when I get the chance, kitesurfing and diving and playing music.

space: *** A PLACE YOU WILL REMEMBER FOR THE REST OF YOUR LIFE *** - Surface: 735sq. feet - 70m2 - Capacity: 4 people A superbly designed apartment located at the top of a beautiful Parisian building, a view over the city of lights, its roofs and the sunset. house_rules: - Don't smoke - No shoes - Be clean - Don't organise parties - BE HAPPY :)  Please, take care of my flat as it was yours.
host_about:
Hi guys ! 

Cooking, meeting people, travelling and drawing are some of the things I enjoy the most.
I'm consultant in change management in Paris. I'm used to tasting great recipes thanks to my mum who writes cook books ! So, if you wish, we could organise a cooking lesson at my place.  

This is the flat where I live. Sometimes, I rent it, to get money and  travel around the world on occasion with airbnb.

I'm looking forward to hearing from you :)

Cheers,
Morgane

space: This is a fact. Some guests have rented this quiet and comfortable apartment, spring and fall, for the last seven years. We like all our guests to feel at home here.  The apartment is 400 sq ft (37 m2) one flight up (no elevator). We have AIR CONDITIONING, rare in a century old building like ours. We have owned the apartment for 12 years and the last total renovation was in 2010. You'll notice the walls are white, pure white, because I am a photographer and sometimes do photo shoots in either this apartment or the studio with patio next door, or both. The polished, hard wood floors, molded plaster-of-Paris ceilings and two marble fireplaces add distinguishing touches.  All Paris is easily accessible by metro (3 stations at a 3-7 minute walk): Ménilmontant, St Maur, Père Lachaise, crosstown buses 96 & 69, bicycle (Velib) or walking. Nearby sites are Père Lachaise Cemetery (Jim Morrison!), Bastille, trendy Oberkampf (100+ restaurants/bars within a 15 minute walk). The Tuesday and Friday

house_rules: Prendre soin de mes  plantes  et de mon basilic si vous restez plus de 3 jours. Du bon sens c'est l'endroit ou je vis, respecter mes voisins également, le parquet peut être sonore, enlever vos chaussures en entrant par exemple , être discret le soir et dans l'escalier durant les allez et venues... take care of my plants and my basil if you stay more than 3 (Website hidden by Airbnb) specific rules, just common courtesies: Guests are asked to respect the place (It's the place where I live ) and the neighbours: as hardwood floors can be noisy with shoes please wear socks or slippers inside the apartment. No noise at night or in the stairs when coming or leaving the place. Smoke is allowed in my flat.
host_about:
Bonjour,  VRAI PARISIENNE et dans ce quartier depuis 15 ans je serais ravie de vous faire partager mes adresses préférées pour découvrir Paris de l'intérieur. Mon quartier est plein de surprises aprés le Sacré Coeur, le Moulin rouge et Montmarte qui sont à 5 min de marche il y a le pigalle caché avec ses jardins, la vie des peintres, ses musées, ses nombreux bars et (Website hidden by Airbnb) ne pourrais me passer de mes livres, du gout de l'enfance, d'un bon verre de vin et du fromage, d'un café en terrasse, de mes amis, d'art, de jazz roots. j'écoute beaucoup de jazz. j'ai voyagé en Asie( Thailande, japon), en Afrique noire (Mali), en Amérique centrale (Méxique, Cuba), aux Etats Unis et en Europe, les voyages sont essentiels à ma vie. Mon appartement est un lieu ou je me ressource, j'en prend soin il est essentiel que vous fassiez de même dans le respect de mon voisinnage.
j'aime recevoir et partager mes bonnes adresses du moment.

description: Charming little 2 rooms nestled at the foot of the Sacré Coeur, in a beautiful and ideal to discover Montmartre. Perfect for a couple or a small family for a weekend in Paris. The apartment is typical Hausmanian apartments. Moldings on the ceiling and parquet floor. Simple and refined, the layout is designed for space saving and convenience! Sleeps : up to 4 people (1 double bed + 1 sofa bed) Surface area: 35 m2 Floor :1rst floor (by the stairs) Secured building with digicode The apartment is equipped to facilitate your stay: - Kitchen: Oven, plates, fridge, pressure cooker, blender, citrus press, blender ... - Living room : Video projector (bring your computer -> plugs into the HDMI port), Booze speaker ... - Bathroom : Hair dryer, straightener ... space: MARAIS: Fabulous 1-room studio in an 18th century listed building. Located in the heart of historical city center district "Le Marais", this 32 sqm / 322 sqf studio on the top floor (French 4th - no elevator) overlooks the Archives Nationales and the lovely Hotel de Clisson. The studio is complete with kitchenette and full daylight bathroom (with separate WC).   The bathroom has been refitted in spring 2014 (a big thanks to all previous guests who made this possible !) and the flat is ideal for a couple (it sleeps two in a real bed).    Utilities and amenities include: - Double-bed, - 1930s writing desk & club chairs, - Fresh bed and bath linen,  - Oven, toaster, Nespresso coffee machine, water boiler, Brita water filtering jug (but the tap water is totally drinkable without reservation !), (small) ironing board and iron - A selection of teas from the Palais des Thés, - Fridge and cooking plates, - Kitchen cabinets - Lots of storage and shelf space, - Glasses, incl. wine and beer glass
description: My clean, cool and comfy studio flat in the heart of Le Marais area will give you a true insider feeling of living "à la Parisienne". It nicely fits two, is centrally located and just blocks away from fabulous shops, cafés, restaurants and museums! MARAIS: Fabulous 1-room studio in an 18th century listed building. Located in the heart of historical city center district "Le Marais", this 32 sqm / 322 sqf studio on the top floor (French 4th - no elevator) overlooks the Archives Nationales and the lovely Hotel de Clisson. The studio is complete with kitchenette and full daylight bathroom (with separate WC).   The bathroom has been refitted in spring 2014 (a big thanks to all previous guests who made this possible !) and the flat is ideal for a couple (it sleeps two in a real bed).    Utilities and amenities include: - Double-bed, - 1930s writing desk & club chairs, - Fresh bed and bath linen,  - Oven, toaster, Nespresso coffee machine, water boiler, Brita water filtering jug (but the tap
transit: The nearest subway stop is Rambuteau (line 11) or Hôtel de Ville (line 1 - with direct access to the Louvre, the Champs Elysées or the Bois de Vincennes). Further away, but still witinin walking distance, you'll find the subway stop Châtelet-les-Halles, a central hub on the fast RER subway line which will take you straight to Charles de Gaulle airport and also Orly airport (with a connection).  There are also 3 Vélib' stations in the immediate neighborhood: No. 3007 (67 rue des Archives), No. 3008 (22 rue de la Perle) and No. 3009 (76 rue du Temple), more info at: (URL HIDDEN)
access: All guests receive a detailed email with attachments to take along, containing everything you need to know about how to get to the apartment and the house rules and etiquette.
interaction: As I live in Berlin, I cannot welcome my guests in person but I am very responsive otherwise ! My cleaning lady is usually there to welcome you when you "check-in" during the recommended check-in time.
house_rules: No smoking please ! OK, one by the window is fine.  Please read the house rules and etiquette (provided to all guests): this is my own place, it contains old furniture, art and is in a historical building ...  This is not a party place but a quiet residential building (although there is a lively, but not noisy, café terrasse just down the building) so please keep the volume down or better, enjoy the Paris' nightlife !  Do not slam the door of the apartment but please close it gently while locking it.
host_about: Ex (-born & bred) -Parisian, -Londoner, -Ithaca-er, Moscower and current Berlinerin. I am a corporate lawyer with two kids (wait, it's not as terrible as it may sound), well-traveled and rather cosmopolitan - I also have a country house in Estonia but I do not think it'd qualify for a listing on this site ... I am an avid reader, passionate about Central Asian textiles, Bakelite objects and Soviet porcelain and love to travel in style (unless I am on the Baikal Lake in Siberia). The Paris studio flat is mine and I truly love it so please take good care of it: Each guest receives a very detailed set of "House Rules" and I make a quite candid disclosure of the the fact that there is no elevator, so far no curtains, that cannot flush things in the WC, etc. ... Oh and I have negotiated tough deals with real Russian businessmen so now you are on notice ! I have lived more than 20 yrs in the neighborhood so I can give you some good tips around it. Have fun and enjoy Paris !

space: Top floor (6th), 500 square feet (46 sqm), 1 big living room with 2 sofa beds, 1 separate bedroom with 1 queen size bed, 7 windows, very bright. Old beams from 19th century,  white walls, simple functional furniture. Very small elevator up to 5th floor then a few steps to the 6th.  Building style : typical parisian small building,  inhabited by families, very calm and safe. Very comfortable for 4 guests, can accomodate up to 6.  In Le Marais / Enfants-Rouges/ Musée Picasso area. Great for walking, food shopping. Lots of good restaurants, bakeries, bars and cafés ... and new art galleries every month.  10 minutes walk to Place des Vosges, 20 from Notre-Dame.  Subway stations at the corner. Easily accessible from Orly or Roissy CDG airport. Only 20 mn from Gare du Nord (Thalys, Eurostar).
description: NEW : air con unit ! Top floor (6th), 500 square feet (46 sqm), 1 big living room with 2 sofa beds, 1 separate bedroom with 1 queen size bed, 7 windows, very bright. Old beams from 19th century,  white walls, simple functional furniture. Very small elevator up to 5th floor then a few steps to the 6th.  Building style : typical parisian small building,  inhabited by families, very calm and safe. Very comfortable for 4 guests, can accomodate up to 6.  In Le Marais / Enfants-Rouges/ Musée Picasso area. Great for walking, food shopping. Lots of good restaurants, bakeries, bars and cafés ... and new art galleries every month.  10 minutes walk to Place des Vosges, 20 from Notre-Dame.  Subway stations at the corner. Easily accessible from Orly or Roissy CDG airport. Only 20 mn from Gare du Nord (Thalys, Eurostar).
transit: 30 minutes from Orly airport, 50 minutes from Roissy Charles de Gaulle, 20 minutes from Eurostar/Thalys station (Gare du Nord).  15 mn from Gare de Lyon (to the South of France), 10 mn to gare de l'Est (to the East of France)
access: Whole  apartment
interaction: I live next door in the same building  (but often at my country house in Le Perche) My niece also lives in the same building and neighbors are friendly and unobstrusive.
house_rules: We welcome responsible guests.  We can help with pretty much everything: additional furniture or ustensils, basic information about Paris, etc. We have recent guidebooks about Paris so no need to bring yours... You will get a welcome package and a booklet with all useful information. Please tell us if you are here for business or for tourism and we can adapt our services to your needs. Dogs allowed under exceptional conditions. (depends on animal size and species, and requires an additional deposit and some cleaning fees). Cats not allowed because of potential allergy issues.
host_about: We live in Central Paris (Le Marais) and in the same building we have redesigned a quite nice 50 sq.m. flat, top floor, very sunny, that we keep at the disposal of friends and family for short stays, applying the  concept of "chambre d'hôte".

space: Spacious flat to rent close to Pere Lachaise in Paris, in the great bobo aera of Menilmontant, just nearby the famous rue oberkampf with bars and restaurants. The apartment is situated one minute from the metro and bus, 10 min from the city center. This flat will give you all the commodities u will like in Paris. There is one 32m2 cosy living room with one double bed, and two bedrooms, one with a double bed and the other one with a single bed. The rent is for one week minimum. You'll find everything you need in the fully equipped kitchen (a dishwasher, a fridge). Bathroom with a washing machine and a bathtub. You'll have a free Internet wifi connexion. The flat is really close to the metro station "Ménilmontant", line 2. In the area you'll find plenty of good restaurants and nice cafés. The interesting Père Lachaise Cemetery is also close to the flat. From the flat you can walk to the beautiful "Parc de Belleville".

host_about:
Bonjour!

Hello !

J'espère que vous découvrirez ce Paris étonnant de Ménilmontant et alentours. Je sais par avance que vous ne serez pas déçu... 

I hope you ll love this surprising corner of Paris, named Menilmontant. I am sure that you won't be disappointed.

A bientôt.

See u !

space: Sunny fully-furnished 4 rooms, 2-bedrooms, 2 bathrooms flat in Paris 18th arrondissement. Available for short-term (min stay 4 days) or long-term rental.  The apartment is on 5th floor with elevator Ideal for a couple plus childrens or two couples, 4 adults or 2 adults plus 3 children maximum. house_rules: Pas d'animaux  Fumeurs tolérés mais à la fenêtre / smoking at window please. Pas de fêtes / no parties! Un lit d'enfant peut être ajouté A cleanner (Najat is her name) is possible and recommended (2-4 hours a week), during the stay if long term, and it's mandatory when leaving : 40€ to leave for her on the desk if you do not see her for check-out.
host_about:
Bonjour,

J'aime beaucoup le cinéma. Chez nous à Paris il y a un Home Cinéma et beaucoup de films. Notre cuisine donne sur le Louxor, le plus ancien cinéma de Paris, qui vient d'être rénové.

En Bretagne c'est aussi un endroit magique, un terrain sauvage là ou il n'y en a plus guère, les couchers de soleil, une grande maison face à la mer avec une âme et des souvenirs.

A Tanger c'est la maison de ma mère... il y a aussi un home cinéma, mais c'est surtout la vue qui est remarquable, la baie de Tanger et l'Espagne. C'est une grande maison habitée et chaleureuse, où l'on se sent bien. 

J'espère qu vous passerez un bon séjour chez nous.

D

space: Under the roofs of Paris at the 6th floor of a nice typical Parisian building, at 10/15 mn by foot from Abesses/Montmartre, a charming furnished studio, renovated and equipped.  Underground at 200m (Guy Moquet, Line 13), Bus 31 (Champs-Elysées) and Bus 95 (Louvre) nearby. Direct access from Gare de l'Est Railway station, Gare du Nord Railway station, Saint Lazare Railway and Montparnasse Railway station. Detailed description: - Hall with small cupboard for your coats an others,  - Small shower room with shower and toilet,  - Independent and equipped kitchenette (oven, plates, refrigerator, cooker hood, kettle, etc...)  - Main room with sofa bed and chest of drawers, view on the roofs of Paris. - Internet access and TV - No elevator. Ideal and charming place to discover Paris as a single or as a couple: Montmartre nearby (15 mn by foot) but also direct access by buses for Champs-Elysées and Louvre. interaction: Guest will have the apartment to themselves during the rental period
house_rules: The apartment is a no smoking environment. No pets please. Shoes off in the apartment please. Please limit noise in public spaces as sound travels throughout the building.
host_about:
I am a Canadian who used to be a flight attendant. I moved to Paris a few years ago and  worked in the guest relations department in a palace.( 5+* hotel). 

We have 2 little boys and a french bulldog that loves meeting new friends. In our free time we love to travel, on weekends we often go on escapes...London, Rome, Bruges, Lisbon, the south of France, Burgundy. Living in Europe is great because you are so close to so many amazing places.

When travelling we prefer rent dwellings, or stay in boutique hotels and guest houses of charm and comfort. We tend to avoid hotel chains when we can. We feel that where you stay is an important part of the travel experience.

Since I love to cook, I love having the ability to cook with local ingredients when I travel.

Ce que j'aime :
- Restaurants gastronomiques
- Voyager
- Cinéma

Destinations préférées : 
- Caves à vin de Bourgogne, Bordeaux, Pays de Loire, Saint Nicolas de Bourgueil
- Bord de Mer et Montagne

Livres :
- L'oeuvre de Barjavel
- Le parfum (Patrick Suskind)
- L'oeuvre de Tolkien

Genre cinématographiques :
- Science Fiction.
- Médiéval Fantastique.
- Comédie romantique.

Citations : 
- Veux-tu vivre heureux ? Voyage avec deux sacs, l'un pour donner, l'autre pour recevoir.
- Mi casa es tu casa
- Vous préfèrerez un petit chez nous qu'un grand chez les autres ;)

space: This apartment of 45 m², (2 duplex rooms) is located rue de Buci in the 6 th arrondissement.  It is the 4th floor of a building of the XX th Century with elevator and can accommodate 3 people.  It is equipped with a washing machine, a dryer, a dishwasher , cable , television , DVD player and an internet connection. Only one real room up the stairs , there is a very confortable sofa bed (160cm) in the living room. Odeon metro station - Mabillon Area: St Germain des Pres Located in the most prestigious area , most famous and most lively St Germain des Pres . Close to numerous cafes, restaurants, cinemas, Supermarkets and fashion boutiques . This area is famous for its many art galleries. It is close to the church St Germain , Café de Flore , Les Deux Magots and the Brasserie Lipp . You would be living in the heart of Paris for a stay out of the ordinary .

house_rules: • Check-in time is 2PM. If you open it, close it.      If you turn it on, turn it off.      If you unlock it, lock it up.      If you break it, admit it.      If you can't fix it, call someone who can.      If you borrow it, return it.      If you value it, take care of it.      If you make a mess, clean it up.      If you move it, put it back.     If it belongs to someone else, get permission to use it.      If you don't know how to operate it, leave it alone. NO SMOKING Hello , first of all thank you for choosing the apartment. I will be very happy to welcome you for your stay in Paris. The entry is done starting from 14h and departure of 11am if we have people who come after you on your day of departure. space: Independent studio, fully furnished in a quiet, typically Parisian, many shops nearby (rue du Commerce) 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower in 8mn walk from the Seine and the Ile aux Cygnes 3 minutes subway Commerce (line 8), 5 minutes from metro Lamotte Picquet Grenelle (line 8-10-6), you go very quickly to Opera, Champs Elysees, Saint Germain and very easy to Bastille and Versailles. You can also take the bus at a stop just below and within few minutes you arrive at the Louvre. This is a quiet area with nice shops nearby (clothing but also butchers, cheese shops, various supermarkets including organic, cafés, etc ...) and close to everything! You will find many public gardens in the area. The studio is on the 7th and last floor with elevator, it is very clear, its two windows face the courtyard overlooking the Eiffel Tower. You will have the sun in the morning when the clouds are not there! It consists of a main room with a real double bed which has its separate space. In this room
description: This is a nice and quiet place with view on the shining Eiffel Tower. In a quiet and safe area, with lots of restaurants and shops and close to almost everything you may want to see in Paris. transit: Metro Commerce or Felix Faure, line 8, 3mn Metro Charles Michel or Emile Zola, line 10, 8mn Metro Lamotte Picquet-Grenelle, line 6, 8, 10, 15mn Bus 74, 88 (Connecting particularly and respectively the city hall of Paris and the train station Paris Montparnasse) A taxi station places Charles Michel, 5mn from the building or it is also possible to take a taxi in the street, down to the building, which has a rather frequent passage.
access: You will have the whole studio.
interaction: I shall be reachable for any question or necessary intervention. I shall possibly be helped by friend or familiy depending where I am.
house_rules: This apartment is the one in which I live most of the time, just care as if you were invited at a good friend's house, respect simply the place. This place is quiet, respect the peace and the tranquillity of the neighbors. If you use the kitchen and the dishes, leave as clean as you found it. In a general way, even if I like animals, dogs are not authorized in this studio which does not seem to me appropriated to receive them. Please do not smoke in the apartment. You can however smoke in the inner courtyard of the building.
host_about:
Hi,
En quelques mots j'aime beaucoup les voyages et j'ai déjà voyagé en Europe, en Asie, en Afrique, En Amérique du sud et du nord, j'aime parler des langues différentes et je serai heureux d'en apprendre une nouvelle avec vous ou la connaître mieux. Je lis beaucoup et m'intéresse à tout : histoire, spiritualité, société, philosophie, arts, économie. J'aime la musique, toutes les musiques : classique, jazz, soul, traditionnelle, salsa. Je danse un peu le tango. J'aime la bonne cuisine du monde entier, et beaucoup la cuisine épicée. J'aime la marche et le tai-chi. J'apprecie le calme et la tranquilité là où je vis tout autant que sortir et faire de nouvelles rencontres. Et je serai heureux de faire votre connaissance, de discuter, si vous avez le temps,  de tout et de rien...
amenities: {TV,Internet,Wifi,Kitchen,Elevator,Heating,"Family/kid friendly",Washer,Dryer}

space: Charming appartment of 2 rooms, 25 m2, 3rd floor without elevator, ideally located in the center of Paris !  You can find close to the flat : - at 100 m: the Canal St Martin, with its bridges, its bars and cafés, a great atmosphere, particularly when the weather is good. Perfect for a picnic ! In the bars of the area, very typical, you'll find young, cool and friendly people.  - at 100 m : Place de la République, perfect for the subway : lignes 3, 8, 9, 11, 5. - at 2 subway stations (l.5): Gare du Nord et Gare de l'Est. - areas you can go walking : le Marais, Bastille, Oberkampf, Grands Boulevards. The flat, you'll have at your entire disposal, is full of charme, luminous, with wooden floor and a fireplace (the fireplace doesn't work). It is quiet and calm. It is fully equiped :  The bed is a sofa bed very confortable and large. The bathroom has a tube and toilets.  The kitchen has a fridge, 2 electric hotplates, 1 sink, 1 oven. There is wifi internet in the flat, a television, an iron
description: Charming 2 rooms appartment, welcoming, cozy and typically Parisian ! Conveniently located in Paris , very central and 5 metro lines nearby (lines 3, 5 , 8, 9 , 11) . Trendy and nice area, while remaining quiet at night. Charming appartment of 2 rooms, 25 m2, 3rd floor without elevator, ideally located in the center of Paris !  You can find close to the flat : - at 100 m: the Canal St Martin, with its bridges, its bars and cafés, a great atmosphere, particularly when the weather is good. Perfect for a picnic ! In the bars of the area, very typical, you'll find young, cool and friendly people.  - at 100 m : Place de la République, perfect for the subway : lignes 3, 8, 9, 11, 5. - at 2 subway stations (l.5): Gare du Nord et Gare de l'Est. - areas you can go walking : le Marais, Bastille, Oberkampf, Grands Boulevards. The flat, you'll have at your entire disposal, is full of charme, luminous, with wooden floor and a fireplace (the fireplace doesn't work). It is quiet and calm. It is fully
transit: L'appartement est à 100m de la Place de la République et de ses 5 lignes de métro : lignes 3, 5, 8, 9, 11. Idéal pour rejoindre rapidement n'importe quel point de la capitale ! La station Jacques Bonsergent (ligne 5) est à 30m de l'appartement. L'appartement est à 2 stations (Ligne 5) de metro de la Gare du Nord et Gare de l'Est.
interaction: I am reachable 24/24h during all the stay of the guests.
house_rules: It is possible to smoke in the flat. Animals are not accepted. Guests must be nice and polite with the neighbors in the building, and must take care of all the material at their disposal in the flat.
host_about:
Jeune actif vivant à Paris depuis 3 ans, je cherche à faire profiter de mon super petit appartement de 2 pièces de 25m2 parfaitement situé à des provinciaux ou des étrangers qui ont envie de découvrir Paris.

D'esprit plutôt hédoniste, j'aime profiter de la vie, sortir avec mes amis, faire de nouvelles connaissances et nouvelles expériences. J'habite à 100m du canal St Martin, où j'ai l'habitude de retrouver mes amis pour boire un verre au bord du canal. Je sors aussi régulièrement dans le marais, qui est à 15 minutes à pied de chez moi.

J'adore les nouvelles expériences ! J'aime rencontrer de nouvelles personnes, d'autres cultures, d'autres mentalités. D'esprit plutôt alternatif, mes convictions politiques sont écologiques. Lorsque je suis dans une ville pour la première fois, j'ai surtout envie de connaitre les endroits typiques, représentatifs de style de vie spécifique à cette ville. J'aime aussi découvrir la ville la nuit.

space: CENTRAL - DESIGN - TRENDY - BRIGHT ... Our apartment is a large 31 sqm (335 sqft) studio located in North Marais (NoMa), in the protected and historical Temple area, which has lately become one of the trendiest places for Parisians, around Carreau du Temple, rue de Bretagne, Marché des Enfants Rouges, away from over-crowded south Marais and close to major subway connections. It is on the 1st floor (US 2nd) of a 4-floor (US 5) 18th century building (NO LIFT). It is oriented South and has 2 wide windows overlooking a large, almost pedestrian street, and a third large window on a side street. It has an open outlook and is very bright. The area is lively in the summer evenings due to the restaurants in the street, but there are no night bars or clubs. Visit our guide which we keep updated! The building exterior was refurbished in 2011 and the apartment itself was fully renovated by an architect in November 2011. The staircase was renovated a few years ago and shows signs of age but is well

host_about:
I have been living in Paris for 20yrs and 10yrs in North Marais.
I love Paris and in particular this neighborhood.
I carefully selected the location for this apartment and I fully renovated it with quality material and the help of an architect. I am very proud of the result, I am sure you will love the apartment and I will make sure you will enjoy your stay.

space: NOTE: This apartment host requests politely that you pay a cleaning fee directly to the person who meets you at the apartment. This fee is a one-time 60 Euros for one person, or 70 Euros for two. This fee is not included in your airbnb booking and it allows the rental to be less expensive. It also encourages the cleaning lady to meet the guest at whatever hour they arrive.  This charming studio with inner terrace/cour is located in the center of the Island of St. Louis, one of the most beautiful and safe neighborhoods in Paris. It is the exact center of Paris, surrounded by Notre Dame, St. Michel, St. Germain, the Marais, the Bastille, etc. The four bridges on the island make it close to all, both right and left bank.  • The apartment is on the first floor (one-flight up) of a clean and quiet Parisian style building. There is a living room with double large windows out on to the terrace. The ceilings are high and there is one exposed wooden beam. The main apartment is roughly 20 sq. me
description: This apartment is the perfect place to see Paris from. You are right in the heart of Paris and on a gorgeous and quaint little island next to Notre Dame. space: Haussmann in a building, a beautiful studio of 33m ² renovated with stone of the building visible. Close to subway: St. Augustine, Madeleine, Saint Lazare and the Auber RER. Nearby department store and 10 minutes walk from the Champs Elysées. In a quiet area, overlooking the street expiatory chapel. The central kitchen island offers all modern comforts: Induction, dishwasher, oven, microwave, refrigerator. Nespresso coffee machine, toaster, kettle, juicer, pots, pans and all utensils. The bathroom has a large shower, toilet, washbasin and washer dryer. The sofa is a real bed with mattress 17cm. It opens without removing the cushions, with a simple pull handle. The studio is equipped with TV with cable channels, high speed internet and phone for calling landlines free States and Canada and many countries. In case of weekly rental, you will have a cleaning service for one hour included in the rent.

space: We are renting our appartment of 90 m2 - open space - grand floor A charming and very quiet appartement with a yard and common courtyard - « The country » in Paris – style « atelier » Friendly environment The appartment is very well situated The building is located 50 meter away from shops and the very convenient métro line 11 (brown line). From the métro Pyrénées you can reach the center of Paris (station Chatelet) in only 7 minutes, with easy connections to the other lines. Its ideal for site seeing.  You are only 5 minutes walking distance from the « Buttes Chaumont » one of the biggest + most magical part of Paris. One of the best « Boulangerie » « The 140 » in Paris is very near for the fresh baguettes + delicious patisseries. In case you would like to enjoy one of the best view over the town, walk to the « Jardin de Belleville » where you will take great pictures!  Jourdain and Pyrénées is a real village inside the city, come and discover its beauty! THE APPARTEMENT Entrance :  S

interaction: Le quartier C'est un petit village, avec de nombreux commerces de bouche (une superbe boulangerie, fromager, cave à vins), des librairies, (3 dans la rue!) et des cafés très sympa. Tout est accessible à moins de 5 minutes à pied.
host_about:
Bonjour et bienvenue sur notre profile,
Nous habitons notre appartement durant l'année et travaillons à Paris. 
L'un est photographe et l'autre travaille pour un designer. 
Nous avons deux enfant un de  8 ans et l'autre de 4 ans. 
Nos hobbies: les musées, le cinéma, la photo, la décoration, Paris et la campagne, le yoga, la natation et les voyages.

space: Lovely loft with a minimalistic design located in the 6th arrondissement of Paris 5 minutes away from the "Jardin du Luxembourg" and 12 mn walk from the well known district of "Saint Germain des Près". The loft is composed of:  - an american kitchen with all the necessary equipment to cook,  - a bathroom with a bath/shower + hairdryer provided,  - a separated toilet,  - a room with a double bed (queen size) and a desk with a screen where you can connect your computer,  - a beautiful terrace heading south with a diner table outside as well as a heater when it gets cold and an electric barbecue for the summer.  - a beautiful view on the rooftops of Paris and the Montparnasse tower light up at night for a few hours during dinner time. - a parking right underneath the building with the elevator that bring you straight to the apartment (available upon request). The appartment is equipped with cable fiber wifi internet connection (really fast), a landline (allowing to call for free most fore
description: Modern and secured building with a concierge. Appartement located in the 7th floor with elevator, very bright (oriented south) with large bay windows in the bedroom and living room. There is a table outside on the heated terrace that can welcome 6 people. The internet is extremely fast (fiber). A parking (if needed) is possible inside the building for an additional 8€ per days. transit: Subway lines: - 4, 6, 12, 13 à Montparnasse - 10, 13 à Duroc There is also a lot of bus around and taxi stops.
access: Guests have access to the entire apartment.
interaction: I can definitely give you all the help you need upon request. I remain mostly reachable on  my cell when I'm not traveling.
house_rules: - Faire extrêmement attention à la moquette qui est de couleur clair. - Be extremely careful with the carpet, it is light grey and get dirty very easily. - Fumer est interdit excepté à l'extérieur sur la terrace. - Smoking is not allowed except outside on the terrace. - Arroser les plantes tous les 2 jours minimum. - Water the plants at least every 2 days.
host_about:
Je suis un parisien de 27 ans travaillant dans l'emarketing.
Je suis un personne plutôt maniaque, adorant voyager et decouvrir de nouvelles cultures.
Je suis aussi un adepte du minimalisme et des endroits épurés.

space: Available mostly on weekends In the special area of Montmartre, the magic heart of Paris, at 2 min from the Sacré Coeur, (see the picture),  a nice and charming studio in an old-fashioned parisian-style building.  Quiet and sunny place for 2 people with : - 1 pull out Sofa - 1 bathroom + toilets - 4th floor  - TV + DVD - Internet - Equiped kitchen Near the appartment you have many bars and cafés (rue des Abbesses) and also one of the finest bakery in Paris for the morning croissant. You also have supermarkets and grocery stores.  I also let at your disposal a guide of the Best gourmet places in Paris by the famous french cook Alain Ducasse.  At 2 min, you have the Metro ligne 12 which brings to Saint Lazare or Montparnasse in 20 min and, at approx. 10 min, you have Ligne 4 (Barbès-Rochechouart station) which brings you in Saint-Michel and Notre-dame in 20 minutes.  It is definitely the best place to stay in Paris.

space: The neighborhood:  50 meters from the station Louis Blanc line 7 and 7 bis, the building is located on the street “rue du faubourg saint martin” downstairs two bars for a quick café and croissant (if in a rush) , two Asian restaurants as well (avoid even if they are very kind and walk a bit there are wonderful asian places all arround, ask and i'll give many adresses)…a launderette/ lavomatic at 50 meters, another one in front, and a third on the other street a bit farer 100 meters. ..around the building, a flower shop, down on the street, wine cellars, cheese stores, bakeries, pastries,  a lot of different catering places, Lebanese, Asian vegetables and fruits markets, a night grocery store, two delis, 2 small supermarkets, several organic grocery stores, pharmacy, central post office of the district, many banks and ATMs, central police precinct of the 10th district. Many things to buy and many things to discover, as you can already see there are various ways to move to Opera, Le mara

transit: Station "Louis Blanc" is in front of our place, many buses stops around, velib (public bikes) in front of the building, as well an autolib as well in front.
access: shower, kitchen, WC, bed, couch, TV, internet, living room, bedroom,  all inside the appartment is yours!
interaction: Depending on the period of the year, I let people free to do whatever they are pleased, hosting guests, just need to be warned if people stay more than their stay, email or texts. The rest of the time i do not interfer in their privacy, unless they contact us.
house_rules: No real rules, do not put the roof on fire, do not be rude with the neighbours, very usual things, as far as we are good with this, we want you to feel home, so we'll not interfer in your privacy.If you some, whatever it is, please do not leave a cold "cigarette" smell in the appartement, open the windows, keep it clean, usual business let's say.
host_about:
Hi There,

Let us introduce ourselves Sophie and Aurelian, typical Parisian born, working and living in the capital
Of lovers (and food sometimes).

We rent this place as we decided to look forward and are sometimes traveling abroad.

Sophie loves veggies and fruits and our three dogs ( they remained home!!! dont be scared we travel only in a solo mode)

Aurelian loves Sophie and shares his life with her and Appollon, Hera and Leto.

Both working in finance (and many other activities), passionated about this city 
in which, you'll find the most amazing museums, architectural techniques, gastronomy, dense subway network, traffic jam and so many things you need to discover  by yourself.

SO do not hesitate to contact us we'll be happy to share online and to answer all your questions.

PS: the black thing behind Aurelian on the couch is his main contestant the black sleeping Labrador, Appolon.

Best Regards

S and A.

space: My name is Jeremix, I am a french documentary film director, often out of town, offering you a charming artsy loft in the heart of the fun and trendy neighborhood of Sentier, in the center of Paris. I am right next to the Louvre museum and the amazing pedestrian market of Montorgueil ( it's an open air market open from 7 days a week), full of shops, cafés, restaurants, bars, clubs and metros ( 1min walk distance). My street is calm though, so you won't be bothered at night ! Musée du Louvre is just few minutes away on foot. It's wonderful at night. ( see the picture ) My loft is made up of a bedroom, livingroom, kitchen, bathroom and seperate toilets. I have lots of books, dvds, cable, tv, internet wireless ( WiFi ) and an fully equipped kitchen too. Lots of art and fun design deco ! By the way, the landline telephone is also included, and international phone calls to North America and all over Europe ( cell and home ) are free , always good to know if you need to call home ! transit: There are 4 different metro stations around the apartment, the nearest is Sentier (line 3, one minute walk), but you can also easily go to Reaumur-Sebastopol (line 4) or Chatelet (line 1 and RER station direct to CDG airport in 30 minutes!)
access: There is all the confort you might need in the apartment ! a very big television screen with plenty of DVD's, internet wifi everywhere, washing machine and dryer for your clothes, HiFi for music, plenty of clean sheets and towels... You can also ask my maid to come during your stay for extra confort ! (change sheets, wash your clothes..)
interaction: I am a real parisian and know the city by heart so feel free to ask any questions regarding your stay and I will be very happy to help you !
host_about: My name is Jeremix. I am a  french documentary director, I am a "real parisian" and I love my city but I also love to travel for work and for fun !  I would like to welcome you to my apartment, I live in a fantastic neighborhood in the heart of Paris and I will really enjoy to share my favorite places and good tips with you !

space: A beautiful and large studio in the heart of historical Paris- le Marais, in the wonderful 3rd arrondissement. The studio had a fresh makeover in May 2018 Located on a very quiet street, walk out the door to tons of restaurants, bars, art galleries, designer shops, mouth watering bakeries and more. There is a supermarket around the corner. An ideal location to visit Paris by foot. Steps away from Picasso Museum and rue Vielle du Temple, Marche des Enfants Rouges, you can also easily walk to Place des Vosges, Notre Dame Cathedral,  the river, Beaubourg, les halles, Bastille etc... Our subway station is St Sebastien Froissart on the Ballard/Creteil Line, or short walk to Hotel de Ville, Republic, Rambuteau or even Chatelet stations to catch other subway lines.  This is a large studio (35m2) on the 2nd floor of a quaint building. 2 windows faces the street and 2 faces an interior court.  The kitchen is equipped with an oven, microwave, expresso machine, and various other small appliances.

space: Calm, sunny, comfortable and fully equipped apartment located 3 minutes walk from the Père La Chaise cimetry. République, Ménilmontant, Bastille: a magical triangle if you like the lively Paris. There is no better part of Paris to dance, have a drink and meet new people. This is one upbeat, lively neighbourhood! The apartment is situed in the the Gambetta area, just 50 meters from the metro entrance and from a number of bus stops. This area has many shops and restaurants. It is just 10 minutes walk from the Menilmontant and Oberkampf lively areas : one of the Parisian night life must see spots with its numerous restaurants and bars. It is also at 10 minutes walking distance from the Buttes Chaumont Parc and the Belleville Parc; 15 minutes walk from Bastille lively area and the Belleville multicultural neighborhood. By metro, the line 3 takes you directly to Opera and Chatelet neighborhoods. The apartment of 40 m2, is composed of a living room, a bed room and open kitchen with a dining

host_about:
After 6 years, working as an engineer in Paris, then  a break travelling in South America, I am today based in Tunis working on SME development. I will be often traveling and renting my see front place.

So Thank you first to all my hosts... And welcome to all travellers &  airbnb members from all over the world  to my appartment, to this lively true mediterranean village... I have been living in the city for years and I am also here to help with advices for visit, discover and try the best places here and there. Hope to meet many of you soon :) !! If I am away, a friend of mine will be there to help.

space: Work shop studio (Modigliani used to leave in that flat in thesame building you also have Gauguin's work shop, nice history..) . It's a very charming place the building is in a cour, quiet, with a big glass wall. The area is very nice you're in saint germain des prés/jardin du luxembourg. Three stations to notre Dame de Paris .Lots of restaurants,cinema, cafe, taxis, bus, subway (ligne 6(six) 12 (twelve) 4 (four). It's a very warming place like me ! space: We are 10 min walk from a metro station of line 14 which is the modern and fast line that takes you directly to the heart of Paris in less than 10 min (and line 14 has connections with other metro lines). We offer you if you are interested one short 10-15 min free ride (I will be the driver) on Autolib, the huge electric car-sharing programme in Paris (see details below). SUNNY:  The studio has a French window giving a lot of light + another window + a window in the kitchen. Direct sun in the morning. PLEASANT:  The studio apartment also has a nice room layout and a small balcony with room for two people to sit on the balcony. CONVENIENT LOCATION: See details below

transit: Good public transport links nearby:  - access to several bus stops, 5 min walk (bus numbers (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)), - metro station "Olympiades" of line 14, 10 min walk (line 14 is the modern and fast line that takes you directly to the heart of Paris in less than 10 min), - metro station "Porte d'Ivry" of line 7, 10 min walk, - RER B station (direct RER to Versailles castle) and line 14 station "Bibliothèque François Mitterrand", 16 min walk (or possibilities to take a bus to go to the station), - metro station "Nationale" of line 6 (line 6 is a direct metro line to the Eiffel Tower, with some breathtaking views of Paris and the Eiffel tower from this partly elevated metro), 17 min walk (or possibilities to take a bus to to to the station),  Airports and Railway stations: Orly airport is a 20 min taxi ride away (longer with public transport), CDG airport is a 40 min taxi ride away (longer with public transport), Gare de Lyon, Gare Montparnasse and Gare Saint-Lazare (three of the major
access: The studio will be fully for you.
interaction: On the day of your arrival, we will welcome you to give you the keys and show you quickly the studio. We will be here also for your departure day. During your stay, we will answer your requests, if any, by phone, e-mail or directly as we are nearby.
house_rules: - Thank you for keeping the studio normally clean (please notably wash any dishes that you will use, and wipe the table). - Please avoid making too much noise at night (it's a very quiet building). - After a shower or bath, please keep the bathroom's door open for a while to allow the humidity to go out. - It's not allowed to smoke in the apartment and in the building (but it's possible to smoke on the balcony if you keep the window closed). - Please feel free to ask if any questions :)
host_about:
French couple from Paris with four year old twins. 
We have been living in the 13th arrondissement of Paris for several years, we love it, and we are very happy to share with you this area of Paris!
 
We love traveling, meeting people, hosting people. We have been traveling and hosting people with Airbnb since 2011.

We are also passionate about sustainability, and want to have a good impact (you will see in the listing description a few little things that we do here).

If you have any questions, please feel free to ask.

space: Cozy, sunny and quiet Paris one bedroom apartment with an amazing view on Paris.  The flat has a large entrance, cozy living room, fully equipped kitchen, comfortable bedroom with a large office, and a bathroom. Toilet has its own room.  The apartment is located in a building with elevator. Very ideal for 2 people but it fits 4 people. The bedroom includes a very cozy double bed, lamps, a night table and a small desk and a chair. There is a large window which makes it very luminous. Enjoy a made glass dining table with 4 seats. There are 2 arms chairs with a sofa bed convertible into a double bed. It's very comfortable. There is a nice flat tv screen with cable and wireless internet. The kitchen has everything you need including a glass ceramic stove, linen washing machine, fridge and silverware. space: Dreaming of Paris cliché, with its architecture, its broad avenues. Of historic Paris with its Alexander III gate, the Invalides’s Esplanade, the Eiffel Tower, the Orsay Museum. Of typical Paris with its gourmet restaurants, authentic bistros... This flat is the apartment for you! Located in an elegant building of the 7th arrondissement, on the 6th floor with elevator, this apartment wooden floors and bargain-hunter decoration, will fit to families with children, friends, couples. host_about: Hello,Hola,Ciao,Priviet,Salut, Szia, and Welcome to Paris, Torino and Budapest . I am Andrea, I was born in Italia and have lived in Paris, BudaPest and Torino for ten years each,  this is why I would like to share these beautiful towns and all they have to offer with my guests! I speak Italian, French, Spanish, Russian, Hungarian and English and have traveled extensively. I enjoy good food, music,night, meeting people, reading, writing and for sure, travel... basicly...life!!! I am currently based in Torino and BudaPest and look forward to sharing insider's tips.

space: At the heart of Paris between Opéra and Palais Royal, in a building renovated century du18ème secure code and the second gate with intercom and videophone, this large studio is ideally located. Covering an area of 29 m², very quiet courtyard on the first floor with elevator has just been completely redone. Tastefully decorated it retains its original beams and oak flooring. It consists of some room with queen size bed (160 X 190 cm), large closet, sea grass floor, part living room with equipped kitchen: fridge with freezer, stove, kettle, microwave oven, table and chairs for 4 people, a bathroom / WC with walk-in shower and a small laundry with washing machine, vacuum cleaner, iron and ironing board. The apartment has a WIFI and ADSL Internet connection and a stereo with USB and cable TV. And that only adds to its charm is undoubtedly the small terrace of 4 m² with table and chairs where you can in sandstones of the seasons, have breakfast, read and enjoy the the sun. Electric heating,

space: Contact me before any booking request!!  In a large and flowered courtyard on the 2nd floor, this large furnished studio of 34m² is located in Montmartre, a picturesque and famous quarter, one of the most important touristic sights in Paris, at only a few steps of the Sacré Coeur and the famous flee market.  Near all shops and restaurants, this studio is very bright and nice to live in, comfortable and fully furnished: a double bed, a kitchen with oven and microwave, Shower & WC. Ideally situated, you will have easy access to metro station Jules Joffrin line 12, busses, cabs, as well as a Velib station where you can rent a bicycle. It will be easy for you to reach the most important touristic sights of the french capital.

space: The apartment is quiet  in a middle of a  disctrict  full of bistrots with terrasses,and charming boutiques  "avant garde"The parc of the Cityhall of the 3rd disctrict is only 300m away. We are at  5minutes away walking  from the metro hub Republique where 5 train lines which take you quickly to many other places of the city Here you have the feeling of being in a countryside little french  city, but you are in the very center of Paris The flat has got 6 windows over a very quiet street almost  entirely pedestrian looking more like a private square with its own « becs de gaz » street lights. host_about:
iN FRENCH FIRST  IN ENGLISH AFTER FRENCH
J'aime les amis la famille, la convivialité, la cuisine et le bon vin (rouge)
J'aime les voyages , suis souvent en Grèce l'été
J'aime la création ,je récupère différents matériaux sur les plages et je recycle ...artistiquement j'espère ! j'ai ouvert une petite galerie à Montmartre qui me permet de côtoyer de nombreux artistes
j'aime les ballades en vélo , la nature et la beauté des paysages ....le jardinage quand c'est possible 
J'aime la politique , l'économie, la sociologie, l'histoire, l'ésotérisme et la spiritualité en général
j'aime la musique  jazz, le new age  et suis ouvert à la pop et au classique 
je n'aime pas beaucoup  les "matchos"et les frimeurs   mais j'aime bien de temps en temps un bel hôtel de luxe ou de charme .....personne n'est parfait .
Mon appartement et mon quartier  sont  à mon image , la déco est pleine de détails concernant mon enfance (les années 60), mes voyages , mes créations, mes goûts artistiques ...c''est mon "petit nid" en plein Paris et on y voit des arbres de la chambre  , on entend les oiseaux  et on est tout près de nombreuses boutiques de  (Website hidden by Airbnb) vous "prête" ce petit nid si vous  le (Website hidden by Airbnb) comme dit Jacques Dutronc dans sa chanson " si vous êtes comme moi .....téléphonez moi !!!

l love being with people , my family and my friends, I love cooking for them and I like a good glass of red wine.....very french no ?
I love travelling and very often I am in Greece during summertime., I have been flying and working for AirFrance for 34 years . I stopped a few years ago since I have began an artistic carreer by creating"assemblages"made with recycled items I find on beaches mostly in Greece.; I have opened an art galery in Montmartre .
I love a good bike riding in the countryside and I am very concerned with the protection and the beauty of the environment
I am interested in economy, politics, sociology, history , and spirituality
I don' t like too much the "matchos" or people showing off.....but I am not against( from time to time) a luxuriuous or charming hotel during my travels and even in Paris
I like to show "my" Paris to my guests (If I am in Paris you can be my guest for a few hours)
Ilove jazz and new age music and I am opened to different kind of music like pop music .
I love watching TV (Debates,news,documentaries on nature,world issues,poitics.....)
My apartment and the district  are at my image and  decorated with full of details connected to my life the sixties( because it was my childhood in Normandy ), souvenirs of travels, personal artistic creations paintings,.....and with  the nature ( you can see the trees  on the square from the bed of the bedroom )...and close to boutiques of young (Website hidden by Airbnb) is my nest in Paris , it is yours for a few days if you wish.

space: Located in the historical heart of Paris, in a very quiet pedestrian passage from the XVIIIth century. The passage opens on one side on Le Marais and all its historical highlights and on the other side on the trendy pedestrian area of Montorgueil, where you can find many cafes, restaurants and a traditional farmer's market. The location is outstanding for it's convenience (everything can be reached by foot) and the quietness of the passage. We only use bicycle as there are now many lanes dedicated to bikes in Paris. For sightseeing it is ideally situated : there are many metro stations at less than 3 minutes walk connecting to all areas of Paris and by foot you can reach Notre Dame in less than 15 minutes, the Pompidou art Centre in 3 minutes, the Place des Vosges in 15 minutes, the Louvre in 15 minutes and many more ! Our cat, Flash, can stay at home or escape for holidays in the countryside, as you wish.
description: The countryside quietness in the heart of Paris !  Large duplex apartment with terrace, recently remodeled, with all the charm of romantic Paris in a secluded pedestrian passage in Le Marais, close from Pompidou Centre and Montorgueil area. As you will see when you live in my flat, I attach importance to details, quality of materials and fabrics, harmony of colors. 
We also have a funny cat, Flash. He lives his life quite (Website hidden by Airbnb) cat usually do !

 Diane and Veronique

space: Enjoy the charm of Parisian building in a one bed room apartment on 6th floor, beautifully preserved 1930's building, bathed in sunshine (orientation South/Ouest) and not overlooked! 32m2, parquet throughout and original fireplace. Well maintained and secure building with guardian and door code. Fully equipped kitchen: electric oven, kettle, toaster, washing machine and dishwasher.  Pleasantly furnished, sleeps up to 2 with one quality double bed. Don't need to bring your hair dryer, their is one in the bathroom.  Hight speed WiFi + cable TV (on request)  with international channels . Traditional Parisian farmers market every Thursday and Sunday, only 2 min walk. View of the canal and 5 minutes on foot from the famous "park de la Villette". Peaceful neighborhood, great local amenities, bakeries, supermarket (open late 7/7) close by and many bars and restaurants.  Close from two different line of metro and various bus also available. Nearest metro stations  Crimée (line 7 => direct acce
