space: "Loft" Design. Duplex to 30m  the Place de la Bastille in  heart of Paris. 90m ² furnished with taste and originality. An ideal place to rest and work at home. The loft is located in rue de la Roquette near Bastille in the 11th arrondissement, 200 meters from Place de Vosges and Marais, 100 meters  Boulevard Richard Lenoir, known for its market (Thursdays and Sundays) colorful and lively in which you can feel the real Paris! The "loft" is composed on the ground floor a large living room with loft. The lounge has a large bow windows overlooking a beautiful courtyard that was the old "Passage Charretier" , where you can enjoy the tranquility of the place. The Living room has a large table of 3 m, the kitchen a little lower and a mezzanine with sofas and TV. On the first floor you will find a large bedroom with a double bed, bathroom, toilet and dressing. The bathtub in the  photo is used like only a shower. All charges are included and we provide linens, towels and internet connection!

transit: L'atelier est à 3' du métro Bastille (lignes 8, 5,1) et à 2' du métro Bréguet - Sabin (ligne 5) . Nous sommes à 15' à pied de la Gare de Lyon et à 8' en métro de Gares de l'Est et et à 9' de la Gare du Nord. Dans la Place de la Bastille qu'est à 30 mètres de l'atelier il y a le stationnement des taxi.
access: Le loft est utilisé par architectes, designers et hommes d'affaires qui viennent à Paris pour  travailler et rencontrer leurs clients. La salle au rez de chaussée est idéale pour réunion de travail ou rencontres professionnels. Ils y sont exposés toutes les créations de la Toton design et d’autres artistes.
interaction: Du lundi au vendredi et de 10h à 18h, il y a toujours quelqu’un sur place pour donner les clefs. Après 18h, ainsi que samedi et dimanche, l'ouverture de l'atelier se fait sur rendez vous.
house_rules: Le respect du lieu et des habitants de l'immeuble. On ne peux pas utiliser l'atelier à des fins professionnels sans l'accord du propriétaire. Il est interdis d'organiser des fêtes ou rassemblement le soir pour ne pas troubler le calme de l'immeuble. Il est nécessaire l'accord du propriétaire pour tout changement de l'agencement de l'atelier.
host_about: Designer et enseignant. J'aime Paris! J'ai écris le Guide du Turing Club sur ma ville et j'aime la faire connaitre aux autres. J'organise des ateliers d'initiation au design et à l’architecture pour construire votre maison idéale.

space: While I am travelling I am renting my 2 room apartment in central Paris. It is a cosy and typically Parisian apartment, very light and quiet. It is completely furnished, has wireless internet access and a washing machine. There is a bedroom and a living room + a small kitchen and bathroom with a shower. You'll be in one of the most beautiful Parisian neighbourhoods with many restaurants, a cheese shop, butcher and a wonderful boulangerie just around the corner. You can also jog around the Eiffel tower or take a walk along the Seine, both are just a few minutes away.  The closest metro is Ecole Militaire (line 8) and La Motte-Picquet Grenelle (line 10, 6, 8). There is a bus stop in front of the house (buses from St.Germain des Prés stop there) and a direct bus to Montmartre 4 min from the apartment (line 80). Besides, you'll find several  velib stations (rental bikes) in the neighbourhood, a great way to explore Paris.  As my previous guests mentioned this apartment gives you the typica
description: My bright apartment is very conveniently located, just a short walk from the Eiffel tower.  Other attractions are in walking distance (Champs Elysees, Musee d'Orsay). It's one of the safest areas of Paris& you'll find lots of restaurants and small shops here. While I am travelling I am renting my 2 room apartment in central Paris. It is a cosy and typically Parisian apartment, very light and quiet. It is completely furnished, has wireless internet access and a washing machine. There is a bedroom and a living room + a small kitchen and bathroom with a shower. You'll be in one of the most beautiful Parisian neighbourhoods with many restaurants, a cheese shop, butcher and a wonderful boulangerie just around the corner. You can also jog around the Eiffel tower or take a walk along the Seine, both are just a few minutes away.  The closest metro is Ecole Militaire (line 8) and La Motte-Picquet Grenelle (line 10, 6, 8). There is a bus stop in front of the house (buses from St.Germain des Prés
transit: Metro line 8- Ecole Militaire is a 5 min walk away.  Lines, 6, 8, 10 at the La Motte Piquet stop is about 10 min to walk, just passing along Champ de Mars parc. There's a bus stop right in front of my house- perfect if you're coming from St. Germain des Pres or the latin quarter.    From the airport CDG you can take the Roissybus to Opera, then line 8 or take the Air France Bus to Champs Elysees and then bus 92 or take the metro.
access: The complete apartment, including a separate part in an IKEA wardrobe to hang your clothes.
house_rules: I just expect my guests to be as respectful as they would be in their own home.
host_about: easy-going, international, like to live with locals, Jazz lover, runner, Yogi
amenities: {Internet,Wifi,Kitchen,Heating,Washer,Essentials,Shampoo}

space: 2 bedrooms flat conveniently located in the very hype heart of Paris.  Very typical, very bright Paris apartment dating from the 17th century,  this 55 m2 flat has been fully refurbished with modern equipment’s. 1 bedroom with queen size bed (160cm)  1 bedroom with a single bed (100cm) 1 large bathroom with bathtub (the jacuzzi is out of order) Wooden floor, high ceiling (3 meters) Room and lounge equipped with a fireplace. Nice and quiet working/reading area  Fully equipped kitchen  High quality sheets and towel  very well located 15' from Gare du Nord/Est 30' from Orly Airport (taxi) 45' from Charles de Gaulle Airport (taxi) Non-smoking Flat / no pets allowed.

transit: 15' from Gare du Nord 10' from Gare de Lyon  Chatelet-Les Halles (the biggest hub for subway/RER - express subway - lines in Paris) is 15 min walk but the République and Filles du Calvaire stations (line 3,9,11,8,5) are within less than 5 min walk. There are also many bus lines, if you don’t fancy subways.

space: Hello In a very quiet street without car, the flat, at the second floor, is a newly renovated one-bedroom apartment located at only 5 minutes of Alexandre Dumas metro Station. THE APARTMENT  The apartment has a living room, a full-equiped kitchen a bedroom and a bathroom. The apartment is naturally enlighted during the day by four big windows that give to a quiet rear court. The couch is convertible in a double bed with a real mattress, that can perfectly be used as regular bed fo
description: In a little street without car, 2 renovated rooms, in a lively area (Lot of restaurants, bakers, supermarkets). The apartment is lightly with 4 windows.  Very nearby the Alexandre Dumas metro station. Direct to Père Lachaise and Pigalle, direct to the "Champs Elysées" avenue. You have also a direct bus for all attractive touristics visits l'Ile St Louis, Notre Dame, Louvre, quartier latin etc. The apartment has all you need for cooking. TV and Wifi.  Very cool for 2/pers, confortable/4 pers. space: Hello ! I propose you my own 70 square meters apartment in the very lively 15th district of Paris. It is on the 4th floor of a typical Parisian building from the early 1900s. There is an elevator and the building is secured by an access code and a concierge that lives on the ground floor.   The apartment has : - 1 large bedroom with a king size bed (160x200) - 1 living room facing a parc and the Eiffel tower - 1 dining room facing a parc and the Eiffel tower - 1 bathroom  - 1 full equipped kitchen : oven, cook-top, fridge, washing machine, - 1 separated WC There are wooden floors, old moldings,  and the following equipments are available : TV, DVD, CD player, Radio, high speed Wifi.  Also phone calls to main landlines are for free.  The apartment faces a nice park with a beautiful view over the Eiffel tower. It is very bright and quiet.
description: This is a quiet 70 square meters apartment  located in a very safe area of Paris. Haussmannian-style building. Beautiful unobstructed view over the Eiffel Tower. 5 minutes walk from subway station and excellent transport to Paris main attractions. Numerous restaurants and stores nearby. Hello ! I propose you my own 70 square meters apartment in the very lively 15th district of Paris. It is on the 4th floor of a typical Parisian building from the early 1900s. There is an elevator and the building is secured by an access code and a concierge that lives on the ground floor. Also phone calls to
transit: If you check on a map, you will see I am located in the south of the 15th district of Paris. The closest subway station is PORTE DE VERSAILLES and is just 250 meters away. The subway line number 12  will bring you to the very center of Paris within 15 minutes. There are also bus lines 39 and 80 running just down the street as well as bike rental stations.
interaction: Communication is very important for me. Feel free to ask me whatever you want to organize your stay in Paris. I speak English and Spanish.
house_rules: This apartment is my own home, so please treat it as you would like your home to be treated.   A few rules : - I don't smoke so smoking is not allowed - Take off your shoes when getting into the apartment. High heel shoes are strictly prohibited (wooden floor)  - No pets ! - Try to pay attention to noise level, especially after 10pm - There are no extra cleaning fees so leave the apartment as clean as possible
host_about:
I was born in Brittany, western France, in a place called Finistère (literally "The end the the earth"), but I've been living in the 15th district of Paris for 20 years now. 
I like this neighbourhood very much and I will be pleased to give you good advices about my favourite places. I like travelling a lot and meeting new people from different cultures and backgrounds. Whatever information you need about my listings, feel free to drop me a line !

space: This artist's loft is situated in the historic and artistic Menilmontant/Belleville neighborhood.  Very spacious and charming, this loft gets a lot of light, with windows giving onto the East and West.  It is located in a classical Ménilmontant building, built in 1880, and the floors in the loft are original terracottas!   Minilmally decorated with modern design furniture, this is a special and unique place to spend a week or a month in Paris.   The loft is fully furnished, with a separate bedroom with queen sized firm bed.  In the living area, there is a design sofa which also becomes a sleeper for 1 adult or 2 children.  The kitchen is big and airy; fully equipped, including utensils, plates, toaster, coffee maker, tea pots and boiler, fridge with freezer, and many spices that you can feel free to use.  There is a large wooden table in the open space, which is perfect for dinners, and also for working and reading.   There is also a desk that you can use for working. The apartment com

house_rules: The most important rule is that the apartment be cared for as if it was one's own home.   The safety of the building and the apartment are important to all of us, and with friendly neighbors around, it is expected that guests respect this environment and its safety as well.
host_about: Hello, I am an independent filmmaker who lives between Paris and Mexico City.  I enjoy spending time in both places, taking advantage of all the cultural activities that both have to offer.  I enjoy films, music, reading, parks and having nice dinners with friends.  I also enjoy having guests, whether for meals or overnight.  My apartment has hosted many people in the past, and I like to share the location and simple decor with people who appreciate it.

space: It is a 2 bedroom 35m2 on the 5th floor (no lift) located in Paris Porte de Montreuil. It has been entirely renovated in may 2016 fifth floor without a lift The apartment itself is quiet, without vis-à vis and very luminous. There is one bedroom with a sofa bed for 2 people 1.20 / 1,90 m. Can accommodate 2 other people with a mattress 1,40 / 1,90 m that can be put in the lounge or in the bedroom. Towels and sheets are provided! There is Wifi internet, TV, washing machine, washing dishes, oven, microwave ... A shower room and toilet. In short everything you need for a pleasant time in Paris! The nearest metro station is Porte de Montreuil on line 9 and the station is located almost at the foot of the building. There is also a Velib station in front of the building. Located in a lively area, close to the Montreuil market and Pere Lachaise Cemetery. 25 minutes by metro from  the center! There are many shops nearby. Ideal for couples! C'est tout !
host_about:
I am a young free lance journalist. I write reviews about cinema.  I hold a column in an magazine of art about Art Market.

I am in love about movies' of Terrence Malick, Stanley Kubrick, Francois Truffaut,Jane Campion, James Gray, Jeff Nichols, Franck Capra, Billy Wilder, Ernst Lubitsch, Max Ophuls. And many others...

Frantically in love about books, L.F Celine, Christian Oster. Colette. And many many others.

Deeply in love about art, photography, music, in fact, everything that helps you to think about something that you never thought about or something that you thought and find someone to picture/write/paint/draw/play the way you feel it. 

I was born in Paris, left this beautiful city for a little countryside and cale back ten years ago. I am now on my thirty something.

I love meeting, talk and listen to people.
I love to learn another culture than mine. That's why I travel and would like to meet new guests or host :)

space: Welcome to my appartment ! I am a french/english parisian, and I will be very happy to help you out during your stay in Paris.  My appartment is in a modern building , on the second floor with a lift. It is mostly decorated with vintage 70'S furniture .  I live there with my friendly oriental siamese cat. The room I am renting is spacious and has a vintage 70's Bed in it.  The bathroom is a shared bathroom. You have access to the kitchen and living room for breakfast and diner.  kitchen include an oven & a stove . You can cook simple food like pasta, rice & vegetables. In the living room you'll find a big television with dvd player adsl and cable tv. Phone calls are free for U.S and most countries. . You can hook yourself on internet through wi-fi.  The 75 bus will take you down in twenty minutes into the heart of the marais (the oldest part of paris). The metro will take you in twenty minutes to bastille, twenty minutes to the opera and twenty five minutes to the louvre. or the Latin
description: Mostly decorated with 70's furniture, the appartment is  30/40 minutes away from  most tourist Places and 5 minutes away from amazing Park des Buttes Chaumont . A friendly place for your stay in Paris . Welcome to my appartment ! I am a french/english parisian, and I will be very happy to help you out during your stay in Paris.  My appartment is in a modern building , on the second floor with a lift. It is mostly decorated with vintage 70'S furniture .  I live there with my friendly oriental siamese cat. The room I am renting is spacious and has a vintage 70's Bed in it.  The bathroom is a shared bathroom. You have access to the kitchen and living room for breakfast and diner.  kitchen include an oven & a stove . You can cook simple food like pasta, rice & vegetables. In the living room you'll find a big television with dvd player adsl and cable tv. Phone calls are free for U.S and most countries. . You can hook yourself on internet through wi-fi.  The 75 bus will take you down in twen
transit: Metro stops are Jaurès,  Laumiere or simon bolivar.  7 to 10 minutes away . The 75 bus will take you down in twenty minutes into the heart of the marais (the oldest part of paris). The metro will take you in twenty minutes to bastille, twenty minutes to the opera and twenty five minutes to the Louvre. or the Latin quarter.
access: You have access to the kitchen and living room for breakfast and diner.
host_about: Hi, My name is Charles. I am half french/english. I have been living in paris for 20 years now. I will be very happy to help you out during your stay in Paris.

space: Hello ! My name is Marianne, I am an English teacher and I rent my studio (30 square meters) in the 12th district of Paris for short periods of time in the school year and during the school holidays.  I live on the 12th floor of a nice building with a little garden in the front. The building has 2 safety codes and a concierge. The area is very safe anyway, even at night. The studio has a big wall window with a panoramic view on Paris (you can see the Sacré Coeur, the Eiffel Tower, the Defense, Notre-Dame, the Panthéon, etc.). The apartement is very light (the sun comes in all day) and you can see the sunset behind the Eiffel Tower every night !). Don't worry though, there are blinds you can close at night if you need darkness to sleep. I live in a very nice area , with nice bars, restaurants and cafés nearby, and the building is between two stations (ation and Reuilly-Diderot) where you can take several lines (metro lines 1, 2, 6, 8, 9 and the RER A) which will take you anywhere in Par

host_about:
Bonjour, je m'appelle Marianne, j'ai 35 ans et je suis professeur d'anglais dans un lycée en banlieue parisienne. 
Je loue mon studio pendant les vacances scolaires et parfois le week-end.
Si vous décidez de louer mon studio, je ferai de mon mieux pour rendre votre séjour le plus agréable possible. En plus de vous accueillir dans un studio aussi agréable que possible, je serai à votre disposition si vous avez la moindre question pratique sur Paris, les endroits à découvrir, les bonnes adresses.
Contactez moi si vous êtes intéressés.

space: The apartment has all the charm of a typical Parisian flat: parquet floor, open-plan kitchen including microwave oven, oven, ceramic plates, dishwasher, toaster, lemon squeezer…; bathroom in polished concrete with large bathtub and heated towel rails; double glazing. In the bedroom, you will find a large comfortable bed (160 X 200).  There is everything you need for a comfy stay in beautiful Paris! Bedlinen and towels are included / cable TV and Internet included. Two doorcodes to access apartment`// A small part of the apartment (7m2) remains locked because it is a baby room. It can be rented exceptionally if the period is long (with supplement).
description: The flat is convivial, comfortable and decorated with taste. It has been renovated recently. It is located in a quiet building looking out onto a small courtyard planted with trees. The area is young, cool and arty with many artist w
transit: Metro station Pyrénées and Jourdain are one minute away from the flat by foot. Line 2 (Belleville) is 6 minutes away by foot.  Bus 26 also serves Pyrénées. Line 11 is very convenient: it’s a 5-minute tube ride  to the République metro hub and 10 minutes to the biggest transport hub in Paris, Châtelet.

space: Gorgous and charming 1900's apartment. Classic Parisian style 700 square feet .JUST beautifully renovated. The bathroom features a brand new bathtub with powerful shower head and custom tiles. The brand new kitchen features an electric stove and dishwasher making it easy to prepare meals and clean up. The main bedroom as a queen bed and there is a queen size pull out sofa bed in the living room. This apartment also features a washer and dryer  which is very rare in Paris. The apartment is located in the charming artist neighborhood of Jourdan which was home to the famed singer, Edith Piaf. This area is also called the High-Belleville. Around the Church of St. John the Baptist, built in Gothic style in 1859, and a pastry shop almost as old. On Jourdan Street you can find many typical Parisian restaurants and wanderings of quiet hidden courtyards into artists' studios that open to flower gardens. Anything you have ever wanted to taste is in a five minute walk.  Only a ten minute direct l

space: Located in the charming and trendy Bohemian district of the Canal Saint-Martin, in the center of Paris, this contemporary Haussmann apartment will offer you a true Parisian experience in a safe neighborhood. The area is well known for its upcoming fashion boutiques, traditional local grocery stores, including one of the best bakeries in Paris (boulangerie) and many delicious restaurants and bars. The apartment of 1640 square feet is located on the 4th floor with elevator of a Haussmannian building typical of the XIXth century. The rooms are very spacious and bright with their high ceilings with moldings and large French windows. All the ancient features such as marble fireplaces, detailed ceiling moldings, oak parquet floors, has been preserved and blended with a very contemporary design and which gives the apartment a unique decoration! The kitchen is open to the living room with a central dining area, all kitchen utensils are provided for family meals! The TV with international chann

interaction: I will welcome you in the apartment, explain how to use all the features offered, answer all your questions and also recommend good places in the area. I will also be reachable during your stay to answer any questions you might have!
house_rules: I would be happy to welcome you to my apartment and would like you to have a good time in Paris. Of course, I want you to feel at home and treat the apartment as if it were yours. Leave as clean as possible and treat it properly. The apartment is non smoking. Follow the directions below for the tranquility of the neighborhood. Respect your neighbors and try to be on good terms with them (courtesy and discretion). Avoid making noise in common areas when transporting luggage on stairs, do not fill the luggage elevator without people in it (at risk of blocking the elevator), do not make too much noise in the apartment that Respect the rule in France to avoid making noise after 22 hours. space: Nice cosy flat of 431 foot on the 6th floor with elevator and terrace with a nice view on paris roof tops (see last two pictures). It has been recently remade and redocarated by architects with :  _ one separate bedroom _ a big kichen and living room + two desks. _ a separate bathroom .  The appartment is perfect for a couple. The neighborhood is in central Paris : in the 9th arrondissement. It is very close to subways and RER (Gare du Nord, Cadet, Anvers) and famous places like Montmartre and the Moulin Rouge. The Opera, the Louvre Museum and Châtelet (hart of Paris) are only, 3, 5 and 7 stations away (with line 7). In less then 3 minutes away by feet, you can find 3 supermarkets, a cheese shop, 3 boulangeries (where you can buy bread and croissants) and lots of bars and restaurants.

space: Gorgeous big studio in the heart of Montmartre, next to Place des Abbesses (one of the most beautiful and artistic parts of Paris). The large studio is fully equipped with washing machine, dryer, dishwasher, high quality queen size sofa bed, tv, telephone, internet, big bath, tons of light and looking over Paris. Although in the heart of Paris, once in the apartment it is quiet like the country side:-) It is the 7th (no lift) and last floor of the beautiful 19th century building.
description: Large studio with fabulous views. Montmartre/Abbess. Views over the whole of Paris, 33 square metres, heaps of light, very quiet, next to place des abbess, café/artistic life style, supermarkets, stores, nightlife, café terraces. Cafes, nightlife, supermarkets, public transport, montmartre. metro (abbess, pigalle) buses, taxis no elevator.

host_about: Hello, I'm a writer and love traveling to the south of france to write. My husband is a music composer and we love to travel. In order to do so we rent our big apartment. We havn't rented much in the last two years with work and baby, but now he's older, we enjoy chances of getting away. I enjoy helping visitors to Paris, it is a wonderful city and holds many treasures. We live right next to Le Bassin de la Villette, heaps of cafes and things to do. Hope to meet you soon!

space: The apartment located in the heart of the 11th arrondissement of Paris, close to the town hall in a quiet street. Arriving by public transport, metro station is on Line 9 stop Voltaire Charonne. The apartment is halfway between Bastille and Pere Lachaise Cemetery, and halfway between Nation and Republic. You near the metro, several bus lines to reach the four corners of Paris, Velib stations, stations autolib now and again a taxi rank 200 meters away. The living area is popular and all the shops are concentrated nearby. In a quiet street, you will stop in a building of two small buildings. The apartment is on the third and top floor of the first building on the street, the building is quiet without lift. After passing the entrance, you enter the kitchen adjacent to the living room. Small bedroom with bathroom. For now, the apartment is occupied by a family, so do not neglect personal and it is for this reason that it can be rented for a week and occasionally minimum. access: You will have full access to the kitchen, living room, bathroom and bedroom. However, as this is my primary home, my clothes and belongings will take up some space on the shelves and in the drawers of my corner study, as well as part of my wardrobe. I will, of course, do my utmost in concealing my belongings as discreetly as possible and making available a generous amount of space for your use in the wardrobe.
interaction: I really enjoy meeting my guests upon arrival when I find myself in Paris during their stay. I make it a point to answer any questions you may have and give any useful tips to help make your stay here as enjoyable as I possibly can.
house_rules: Please: 1. Don't smoke in the apartment. 2.Close all windows and double lock front door each time you leave the apartment. 3.Replace all food found and consumed before checking out and throw away empty packets and jars in the bin. 4. Use bin bags to line the kitchen bin and take out garbage when the bag is full and upon checking out. 5. Keep my home clean and before checking out leave all dirty laundry in a pile next to the washing machine. Thank you!
host_about:
Hello! I moved to Paris 10 years ago and set up a professional training company in 2009. It took me quite a while to find somewhere I could call home but I finally struck gold when I found this little place a few years ago.
My work takes me out of the city quite often and it doesn't quite feel right leaving my apartment empty when I'm away. I really hope you can enjoy my home as much as I do.
Charlotte

space: Le luxe d'une maison en plein Paris !... Le privilège d'un calme absolu au coeur de la ville ... Tout au fond d'une cour typique du 11ème arrondissement, à 100m de la rue et en coeur d'ilot, notre maison jouit d'un calme rare au coeur de Paris. Notre maison est un ancien atelier entièrement réhabilité et très confortablement aménagé : Séjour avec cuisine ouverte en Rez de chaussée, et les 4 chambres à l'étage ( 2 chambres avec lit individuel, 2 chambres avec lit double ) Nous sommes près de la Place de la République, à la limite du Marais et du Canal Saint Martin. Il y a 6 (!) lignes de Métro autour de la Maison ( Lignes 2, 3, 5, 8, 9 et 11 ), qui vous permettent d'aller partout dans Paris très facilement. Le quartier est très vivant, et nous sommes entourés de nombreux restaurants, bars et magasins.   Calme incroyable, Maison au charme fou, emplacement très central, transports très faciles : Vous serez bien chez nous !
description: Le luxe d'une maison en plein Paris !... Le privilège d'un calme absolu au coeur de la ville ... Tout au fond d'une cour typique du 11ème arrondissement, à 100m de la rue et en coeur d'ilot, notre maison jouit d'un calme rare au coeur de Paris. Notre maison est un ancien atelier entièrement réhabilité et très confortablement aménagé : Séjour avec cuisine ouverte en Rez de chaussée, et les 4 chambres à l'étage ( 2 chambres avec lit individuel, 2 chambres avec lit double ) Nous sommes près de la Place de la République, à la limite du Marais et du Canal Saint Martin. Il y a 6 (!) lignes de Métro autour de la Maison ( Lignes 2, 3, 5, 8, 9 et 11 ), qui vous permettent d'aller partout dans Paris très facilement. Le quartier est très vivant, et nous sommes entourés de nombreux restaurants, bars et magasins.   Calme incroyable, Maison au charme fou, emplacement très central, transports très faciles : Vous serez bien chez nous !

host_about:
Après des études de gestion hôtelière en Suisse et une expérience professionnelle à l'étranger et à Paris je gère depuis plusieurs années  des appartements dans les beaux quartiers touristiques de Paris.
Grande voyageuse et utilisatrice de belles locations à travers le monde, je suis consciente de l'attente et exigence attendue de mes futurs hôtes et tente de leur donner le meilleurs service.
Je serai très heureuse de vous faire partager les bons tuyaux et endroits typiquement parisiens et de vous donner l'envie d'aimer cette magnifique ville.

space: The apartment is located in the 11th arrondissement, right in the heart of the city. It's a young, lively and trendy area, full of trendy shops, restaurants, theatres etc. The apartment was fully renovated in april 2012, it's on the 6th floor, it is composed of a main room with open kitchen (fridge, microwave, coffee machine, kettle, stove, cooking ustensils etc.) , and a separate bathroom with shower and WC. Inside the apartment, you will find everything you need to enjoy your stay in Paris: top quality pull out bed, wi-fi and, bed linen (2 pillows, 1 large duvet, et 1 light blanket), towels (2 per person), flat screen tv with international channels, table, laundry on the ground floor, closet, iron, hair dryer... The apartment is just 1 minute walk from Goncourt metro station and 5 minutes walk from République. Private car park and supermarket are just 50metres away from the apartment.

Bonjour, 

Nous sommes un couple de Parisien d'adoption. Nous sommes originaires de Provence où nous retournons souvent les weekends. Nous aimons voyager, explorer les villes et les endroits plus sauvages. 

Nous serons ravis de vous accueillir et de vous profiter de nos bons plans ! 

à bientôt! 

Hello, 

We're a couple of Parisian originally from South France where we like to escape most weekends. We love travelling, explore the cities as well as the wild quiet spots! 

We would be happy to have you in town and share all our good tips of the city 

See you soon!

host_about:
Vet working for the Ministry of Agriculture and living between Tunis and Paris, and now Marseille. I love Paris and also the Mediterranean shore, even if it's very different, and indeed I love travelling, meeting new people, discovering new cultures… and also riding my bike, watching movies, drinking a glass of wine on a terrace, having barbecue with friends…

Vétérinaire travaillant pour le Ministère de l'Agriculture, je partage mon temps entre Tunis et Paris, et désormais Marseille. J’adore Paris, mais ne peux être loin de la côte méditerranéenne. J’aime voyager, rencontrer des gens, découvrir de nouvelles cultures. Je suis fan également de mon vélo, de cinéma, boire un verre de vin en terrasse et des barbecues entre amis.

space: This cozy 25m2 studio-apartment can accommodate from two to four people, on a business or holiday trip to PARIS. Situated on the 2nd floor, no lift. An XVIIIth century building, with exposed beams.  The apartment is fully equipped for the comfort of our guests. Queen-bed : 160x200cm. Bed-settee (140x200 cm) with a real comfortable mattress, once opened. Bath-tub and shower, towel-dryer, hair-dryer. Washing-machine and tumble-dryer, ironing-table and iron. Kitchen-area with a microwave-oven, hotplates, range-hood, a dishwasher, coffee maker, electric kettle, toaster, refrigerator with deep-freeze compartment, cookware, pots and pans and dishes,  a 32' LCD TV set, with 65 quality digital channels  - DVD Player,  High speed Internet (Web) access (Ethernet and Wifi). Phone : free calls to fixed lines of France and more than 100 destinations. Free calls to US mobiles and fixed lines.
description: Welcome to our Guests! (from two nights to one month). Conveniently located, close to 'Le Palais Royal', 'the Louvre Museum', and 'the Opera', it stands in the very heart of the Paris of Culture (museums, theatres, cinemas), of the Paris of Fashion (shops, boutiques, major department-stores), and the Paris of Business, a few minutes' walk to the gardens of Palais-Royal and Tuileries. This cozy 25m2 studio-apartment can accommodate from two to four people, on a business or holiday trip to PARIS. Situated on the 2nd floor, no lift. An XVIIIth century building, with exposed beams.  The apartment is fully equipped for the comfort of our guests. Queen-bed : 160x200cm. Bed-settee (140x200 cm) with a real comfortable mattress, once opened. Bath-tub and shower, towel-dryer, hair-dryer. Washing-machine and tumble-dryer, ironing-table and iron. Kitchen-area with a microwave-oven, hotplates, range-hood, a dishwasher, coffee maker, electric kettle, toaster, refrigerator with deep-freeze compartmen
transit: A quiet street, 200 metres from tube-stations (Palais-Royal, Louvre Museum, and Pyramides) metro lines 1, 7 and 14. Many shops and restaurants in the vicinity. Easy access from CDG airport with Roissy Bus.
access: You will have access to the whole flat.
interaction: I may not be available to welcome you in my flat. If this is the case, a friend of mine will be there to greet you and show you around the flat.
house_rules: Usually, luggage can be left from 12:15, and the apartment is fully ready at 2:00. I'll tell you a few days before your arrival if it's possible to do the check-in earlier. Check-out is usually at 12:00.
host_about: I live in this neighborhood in the heart of Paris since 1992, and since then I always wanted to stay, despite the constraints of my job. Every morning when I walk along the 'Comédie Française' and its fountains, the 'Palais Royal' and its garden, I see the Louvre at the end of the street, I still have the eyes of a visitor who discovers this beautiful city for the first time.

space: A beautiful apartment at the 5th floor with elevator in an old building with a double living room. Full south, sunny all day. Bedroom on a quiet little street. Hard wood floor, two fireplaces. TV / Internet / washing machine / cooker with oven / microwave. Bathroom with tub. Balcony, small terrace with table and two chairs. Proximity Abesses / Montmartre (10 minutes walk). All commodities in the neighbourhood (, supermarket, bakery, etc ...). The area is typically Parisian and is surrounded by small shops and restaurants. There's a typical Parisian market twice a week on the street where there are high quality products from small producers do (really pleasant!). Subways (lines 13 and 12) at 5 minutes walking and bus down the street. The apartment is very quiet and ideal for relaxing. All the main attractions of Paris are easily accessible through subways passing next to the apartment.

host_about:
Bonjour, 

Je vis dans mon appartement depuis 20 ans. J'ai une fille de 14 ans.  J'adore mon quartier. C'est un havre de paix et aussi un endroit très vivant. De nombreux touristes viennent le visiter car nous bénéficions d'une vue magnifique et surprenante de Paris. 
Vous êtes plongés dans Paris avec une population très cosmopolite. Restaurants de tout pays et commerces nombreux. C'est un quartier d'artistes avec un mélange de genre très sympa. 
Personnellement, je suis provinciale, j'habite à Paris depuis 20 ans dont 18 ans dans mon appartement que je n'ai pas du tout envie de quitter car il est très bien. J'aime les voyages, le cinéma, l'Art, danser et la nature !

space: This bright and sunny apartment is on the 6th floor (top floor) of a luxury building “Haussmannian type” near the Conservatory of Music of Paris (elevator, coded entry, concierge). 32 m² studio with a bedroom with storage, flat screen TV Box (wireless internet, 300 TV channels), separate kitchen, washing machine, Fridge,microwave, toaster, a complete set of dishes, storage,  Bathroom with Bath, towel heater, iron and ironing board. Parquet flooring (on the bedroom), modern and bright decor. Linens and towels are provided on demand without additionnal fees. At your arrival you will find a city map, a bottle of mineral water. space: Typical parisian, newly restored, beams at sight & parquet. Ideally located between the Cirque d'Hiver, high Marais, the Canal St Martin and Oberkampf. The living room and bedroom are exposed East with a view on rue Amelot, very quite and peaceful. The courtyard-side kitchen is exposed West. The kitchen is fully equipped with all you could need in a kitchen. There is an owen and a dishwasher. Great neighborhood very well connected by metro lines. Velib station at 10 mt. It is lovely to stroll among the galeries and the charming boutiques of the neighborhood.

I hope you will enjoy your experience at the apartment. The apartment is at the 3rd floor of a nice building with an elevator. It falls on two different courtyards on each side which makes it very calm and quiet.  It is composed of a nice bedroom with toilets and the bathroom, one kitchen fully furnished, and the large living-room that can host an additional person on the convertible sofa. house_rules: This apartment is my home. I rent it when i'm working out of Paris or if I'm on holiday. I trust my guests, that's why i didn't hide everything and closed all closets and boxes. But Please don't touch extra sheets and towels, unless you have an emergency. Although plants outside seem "dead" because of winter, they need water every two- three days. Thank you very much for respecting my place. I hope you'll enjoy it as much as me.

space: This charming apartment, located in the heart of the Quartier Latin, is perfect for those wishing to discover Paris, or simply reside in a vibrant and central area. It is fully furnished: bed for 2 people, wardrobe built into the wall, shelves, sofa, table, chairs ... The kitchen is separated, allowing to cook without the smells in the room! The bathroom, all marble, has an enjoyable bath, which is rare in a studio. The apartment seems larger than it is because the main room is very spacious and the integrated rack saves lots of space. 3rd floor without elevator. The 5th arrondissement is the oldest district of Paris: it encompasses the largest part of the Quartier latin, built by the Romans during the Antiquity. It is located on the left bank, at the edge of the Seine river. During May 1968, the Quartier latin was a center of the student revolt. Nowadays, the 5th arrondissement is above all an intellectual and university area; an area of editors and booksellers as well as schools and

house_rules: 1 - The apartment is non-smoking, thank you! Please take off your shoes in the apartment, for your comfort and noise reduction. Please don't make loud noises after 11pm for neighboors respect. 2 - We can settle special arrangement for the keys but usualy you can check in around 3pm and out around noon, the keys will be under the doormat and I will give you all the details to access the apartment. 3 - Free towels and fresh linen are provided for your stay. 4 - There is a free WIFI access in the apartment. 5 - There is no deposit - I trust my guests and have never had problems. 6 - I can give you free advices concerning your trip in Paris when you have booked.
host_about:
Je m'appelle Catherine, j'adore voyager et le concept de location d'appartements pour des courtes durées me paraît idéal pour les voyageurs. C'est pourquoi j'ai décidé de louer mon appartement sur airbnb!
Je serai ravie de vous accueillir dans mon studio au coeur d'un des plus anciens quartiers de Paris et de vous donner des astuces pour votre séjour!
Il y a eu des problèmes avec internet, mais j'ai installé le 23 février un nouveau système, tout est rentré dans l'ordre !

space: This charming and quiet fully furnished studio of 17 m2 for rent in Paris is located in the lovely "Passage du Chantier" and is on the 4th floor overlooking the courtyard with a view of Parisian rooftops. It benefits from great light exposure thanks to its large windows. Ideal for one person in long-term stays or two in short-term stays. All linen provided, washing machine, heating, Internet illimited and 2 hours of cleaning included for long-term stays (minimum 6 months). Electricity not included, a contract must be subscribed by the renter. No pet.

space: Looking for a nice place to stay in Paris?  This is a nice and cosy little flat (26m2) in the 11th arrondissement : just walk out of the door and you will find a lot of shops, restaurants and cafés! It very close to metro station Voltaire and Bastille where you have most of the lines (lines 1, 5, 8, 9) going to the Louvre and jardin des tuileries,  Champs Elysées and Tour Eiffel, Canal St Martin... so it is easy to visit the city or go out at night. The studio is light and very quiet,  perfect for a couple or one person. It was recently renovated with enough space to put clothes/shoes there is a double bed, a kitchen with all supplies you need and a small bathroom. Of course you have access to the internet. Don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions!

host_about:
Welcome to Paris, welcome home ...
I am very happy to welcome you in this house is mine. I live in this building since the age of 2 years, it's a bit "my" building. I realized the renovation of this apartment 3 years ago trying to think of every detail for a truly comfortable and able to feel good about this "little nest".
I'm always here to help you have a pleasant stay in Paris and ready to deliver you some of my secrets and good addresses in Paris. I work in an association of chefs at the initiative of Paul Bocuse and could give you some good addresses in Paris.

space: I am renting out my studio in the old artist neighbourghood around Montparnasse and Port Royal. It has a wonderful view over the entire city and is very luminous. It is approximately 30 m2 + 10 m2 balcony on two sides where you can have breakfast or a glass of wine in the evening. It is comfortable, proper and has a bathtub, washing machine, wifi, bed for 2 persons + an extra matress. The building is well-maintained and the neighborhood calm and safe.
description: Cosy and extremely bright studio with a large balcony, sunshine from sunrise till sunset and the most magnificent view over Paris. The building is located on one of the most beautiful boulevards in Paris and is easily accessible from both airports. I am renting out my studio in the old artist neighbourghood around Montparnasse and Port Royal. It has a wonderful view over the entire city and is very luminous. It is approximately 30 m2 + 10 m2 balcony on two sides where you can have breakfast or a glass of wine in the evening. It is comfortable, proper and has a bathtub, washing machine, wifi, bed for 2 persons + an extra matress. The building is well-maintained and the neighborhood calm and safe. The area is full of artist studios where famous artists from the 20th Century lived. It has its own local charm, is green and spacious and full of cosy cafés in the small side streets around the nearby Luxembourg gardens. The Fondation Cartier, Cimetière Montparnasse, the Catacombs, Le Bon Marc
transit: Nearest metro is 50 meters from the front door and Denfert Rochereau (on RER B to both airports) is very close as well.
host_about: I am a Danish girl living in Paris. I have studied art history in Copenhagen and Paris and work freelance as a writer and translator. I love art, architecture, literature, good conversations with all kinds of people, wine and walks in this beautiful city and in the nature - things that are slow and improvised.

transit: The access to the flat is very easy, wherever your arrival in Paris: - From Roissy Charles de Gaulle airport or Orly airport: RER B Train + Metro line 5 (50 min.) - From 'gare de Lyon' train station: Bus line 61 (10 min.) - From 'gare de l'Est' & 'gare du nord' train stations: Metro line 5 (15 min.) - From 'gare Montparnasse' train station: Bus line 96 or metro line 4 & 3 (35 min.) - From 'gare St Lazare' train station: Metro line 3 (20 min.) Lots of parking places for cars around the building
access: The whole flat is at the guests' disposal. Perfect for a couple, it can host up to 3 persons (4 incl. a baby), with a double-bed into the bedroom and a one-person suitable couch-sofa in the living room. Guests will have acces to a two dedicated wardrobes  All equipments are fully available for the guests confort.
interaction: I am at the entire diposal of the guests during their stay. Depending on the arrival,i will personnaly welcome them at their arrival or leave the keys at their attention in a restaurant close to the flat. Guest will find a short briefing on the flat equipments' use. Available 24 hours a day by phone for any question or problem.
house_rules: The flat is non-smoker but smokers may smoke on the balcony . The sound insulation of the flat is pretty good but plase respect the neighbours' comfort during the evenings and nights. Please make sure you do not leave the apartment without the keys! In fact, of the door closes, you won't be able to get inside.  Please also take into consideration that if you close the door from outside, anyone inside the apartment won’t be able to open the door and leave…
host_about:
Amateurs de bonne chair et de bons breuvages, voyageurs jamais rassasiés, nous adorons l'appartement dans lequel nous avons vécu 10 ans et serions ravis de vous faire découvrir les charmes de notre ancien quartier...Désormais installés à Bordeaux, nous gardons l'appartement pour nos séjours professionnels parisiens, celui-ci est beaucoup moins écoré désormais mais avec tout le confort minimum pour accueillir jusqu'à 3 personnes.

After Living in Paris for ten years, we left the city and moved to Bordeaux, in the South West of France. we like food, music, arts, traveling all around the world and we are constantly looking for new spots and adresses beyond mainstream (Website hidden by Airbnb) keep the flat for our professional stays in Paris, which is now much less furnished and decorated, although it offers the minimum comfort for 3 people. We really loved our ex apartment and  look forward to help you discover all the charms of our flat's great neighbourhood. Our place is yours, please feel free to contact us for any advice, we'll do eveything possible to help you enjoy the real parisian life!

interaction: Housekeeper available
house_rules: - Par respect du voisinage: pas de musique forte ni bruit sur la terrasse. - Si vous souhaitez que le jacuzzi soit nettoyé et préparé les frais de ménage sont augmentés de 60€ payables à votre arrivée. La préparation consiste à: Vidage de l’eau, nettoyage des parois, changement des filtres, remplissage en eau neuve, javellisation, allumage 24h avant votre arrivée pour qu’il ait le temps de chauffer.  Attention, la préparation d’un jacuzzi est relativement longue; il est donc nécessaire de nous prévenir au moins 7 jours à l’avance. Pour le reste, sentez vous comme à la maison...

space: Studio in the heart of Paris, rue de Rivoli, opposite the Louvre! 17m ² studio on quiet courtyard, 1st floor without elevator. The studio has one room with kitchen, table, wardrobe and a bed for two. Possibility to add an extra bed for one child. Ideal for a turistic, business or romantic trip! Opera Garnier, the Louvre Museum, the Tuileries Gardens, the Royal Palace, French comedy, Champs-Elysées, ... All Paris is yours! 2 minutes from the metro station "Palais Royal / Musée du  Louvre" (metro lines 1 or 7), 5 minutes from "Pyramides" (metro line 14). The apartment is very quiet (courtyard) and restaurants, shops, public transport are very close! Towels, bed linen and hair dryer are furnished. Everything you need to cook is available: you do not have to go to the restaurant every meal!

house_rules: The normal check in time is 3pm and check out 10am. Theses are flexible if we don't have any reservation on the same day and you will also have the possibility to make a late check out without any problem :) When you arrive in the building, please don't make noise for the neighbour and respect the property by not leaving cigarette stub on ground floor.  No parties allowed in the apartment. If you have a car, you will be able to park it in the parking du louvre located just in front of the building. My dad and I have a souvenir store located at the same number named Les Arcades Du Louvre where you can go and ask them to open you the secure local if you left your luggages the day of your departure (and also get special price if you need anything into it).
host_about: Bonjour ! Hello ! My name is Simon and I have two apartments in the center of Paris. Very close to Champs Elysées, Musée du Louvre, Opéra Garnier, Place Vendôme,... Absolutely pefect to visit our city ! I will be glad to receive you. See you soon ! A bientôt !

space: Very charming apartment in Le Marais, the center of PARIS. Rue des Francs Bourgeois, Just next to Place des Vosges. building from the 19th century. all in stone. Very parisian. 5th floor. lot of light. Balcony. with a view on parisian roofs. Very quiet. 55 m2. double living room. one bedroom on the courtyard (very quiet) 1 bathroom with shower. little kitchen separated with dishwasher. washing machine. wifi. only little thing, there is no elevator. So keep you healthy! I can provide you a list of very nice restaurants in the area.

Just next to Musée Carnavalet (Museum of history of Paris) Very close of Musée Picasso Very close of rue de Bretagne with all the fashionable bars The new contemporary art galleries area (around rue Saint Claude) Metro Saint Paul As you can see there are some plants on the balcony and on the window that make more charm into the apt. Depending of the weather, they could need to be water during your stay. I might have someone who would need to come to water the
transit: Metro Saint Paul
house_rules: Give access to the apt in case of dry weather to water the plants
host_about:
Hi! I'm parisian from generations. My great great grand-father arrived in Paris in 1871 from Luxembourg. He was a stone sculpture and came to work on the rebuilding of the City Hall after it burnt at the Commune de Paris. My grand mother told me all the stories about Paris since I was a kid. So Paris is really special to me!
What else to say. I have my own company advising big brand on the next trends to help them set up their strategy. It's very exciting and challenging. I have to travel a lot to see what's happen in other place and take the Air du Temps...

space: Welcome to my large apartment located near the very heart of Paris ! It is a quiet, clear and large loft (around 270m2 ), with a small garden (60 m2 - ideal for barbecues), and a large basement equiped with a small gymn and a cinema room (not included in the 270 m2). It provides 3 large bedrooms with king or queen size beds, each with their own bathroom. For your leisure, you can enjoy pool (french billards), the large cinema room and gymn mentioned above, and of course TV, WiFi, etc. If you use a car, there is the possibility of a renting a garage (200 € extra per month).  Regarding the location, it is one of the rare central neighborhoods that has maintained his authenticity and diversity. Near all the touristic places without being touristic, the place is full of life and parisians like to hang out here 7 days a week.  The area is called Parmentier-Goncourt and hosts a lots of restaurants, cafés, shops, bookstores, open-air markets and art galleries. There are 3 Metro stations nearb

The area is called Parmentier-Goncourt and hosts a lots of restaurants, cafés, shops, bookstores, open-air markets and art galleries. There are 3 Metro stations nearb
transit: Very convenient public transit : two metro stations within a 5' walk (Belleville, Goncourt) + major République station (5 metro lines), one metro stop away from Goncourt (2 from Belleville) or 15' walk.
house_rules: No specific behavior. No smoking inside (smoking in garden OK). Just be very cautious when playing (French) billiards. Just live the place as you found it.

space: Bel appartement spacieux typiquement parisien en plein coeur du très célèbre quartier de Montparnasse et à deux pas du romantique quartier Saint Germain.  Vous trouverez confort, espace et tranquillité dans cet appartement style année 30 pour profiter de votre séjour dans les quartiers trépidants de Montparnasse et Saint Germain.  Les pièces sont volumineuses et très agréables à vivre. Le séjour (30m²) comporte une partie salon et une partie salle à manger.  La grande chambre sur cour (20 m²) avec un lit double est silencieuse et harmonieuse. La salle de bain comporte une baignoire et les wc sont séparés. La cuisine très lumineuse est entièrement équipée (frigo, four, micro-ondes, lave-vaisselle, lave-linge).  L'appartement est idéal pour un couple et peut accueillir 3 à 4 personnes grâce au canapé-lit pour 1 à 2 personnes dans le salon. L'appartement a été refait à neuf il y a 18 mois. Il se situe au 4ème étage avec ascenseur. Nous sommes proches de 3 stations de métro : Montparnasse-

HiFi : You can use CDs, MP3 player (audio in jack entry) and Iphone 5/iPad/iPod entry Coffee  : You can use the Nespresso machine or the italian coffee machine.  Water the plants (only in summer) : Each day or each two days : 1,5l bottle for flower boxes outside (street and courtyard) Once a week for the big plant in living room and the cactus Bathroom : Thank you to clean the tub after each use with sponge because there are infiltrations Garbage : In the court building (I will give you the key), there is the special place to let garbages. space: Charming apartment of 80 m2 next to Montmartre, ideally located at few minutes of “Sacré Coeur” and "Place du Tertre". The living room of 50m2 with an American kitchen is a unique “pièce à vivre” with its great space and its amazing view on the “Sacré Coeur”. It’s provided with Cable TV with DVD reader, High-speed internet connection (Wifi), 1 sofa bed for 2 people + 1 comfortable sofa to sleep (1 people). The apartment has beside 2 bedrooms with double bed, a bathroom with bath-tub and separated WC. Towels and cloths are provided. The kitchen is fully equipped and you will find a nice bar where you can spend nice time discussing with friends. We have a secured subterranean parking located at 1 block. Don’t hesitate in asking us more information about it (extra fee). At 30m there is the Metro “Jules Joffrin” (Line 12). space: Apartment located opposite the Canal Saint Martin in a very central location, next to Republic and about 10 minutes walking distance of the Marais district, the historic heart of Paris. This large 35m2 studio is on the 8th floor with elevator in a modern building, side yard, it is very quiet. It can accommodate 2 people with a bedroom alcove. The apartment is composed of an entrance hall with access to the separate toilet. The main room with an armchair, a dining table, the kitchen and the bedroom alcove. And above all a large window with a completely unobstructed view of Paris and a balcony along the entire length with opportunity to enjoy your meals there. Then there is a bathroom with bathtub, washing machine and sink. You will also enjoy a stereo, high speed internet and all the necessary comfort for a great break and enjoy this cosy studio and its ideal location. Take this opportunity to go shopping in designer shops nearby, or to walk along the Canal, have a drink or eat outside!

For other arrival, beware that you may have to pay extra fees for late check in with the following conditions: Monday to Saturday: 3pm - 8pm: No extra fee 8pm - 9pm: 20 euros 9pm - 10.30pm: 30euros 10.30pm - 1am: 50 euros Sunday & Holidays: Before 8pm: 30 euros 8pm - 9pm: 40 euros 9pm - 10.30pm: 50 euros 10.30pm - 1am: 65 euros NO check in after 1am. ------------------------------- Pour la remise des clés, nous fixerons un rendez-vous avec un de nos agent d'accueil directement à l'appartement à partir de 15h, si vous souhaitez plus tôt, nous pourrons éventuellement vous y accueillir à partir de 11h selon la disponibilité de l'appartement, de nos agents et sur demande préalable. host_about:
Bonjour!

Je suis Pierre et je travaille dans l'équipe CityCosy depuis plus de 10 ans. Nous gérons plusieurs appartements à Paris et maintenant à Strasbourg (où je suis installé), nous répondons à vos demandes et vous accueillons à l'appartement à votre arrivée. Nous sommes tous des parisiens et connaissons bien les bons plans, petits et grands restaurants, idées shopping... n'hésitez pas!

A très bientôt :)

space: Carefully maintained, high-standard apartment located on a fourth floor of a 19th century Haussmanian building with a small but practical two people elevator. Apartment is situated between place de la Bastille, place de la Republique, the Père Lachaise Cemetery and only 15 minutes walk to the Marais district. The building lies in a central location, yet in a very quiet street in Paris’ 11th district. Renowned for its wooden furniture workshops and handicrafts school, the area boasts several nationally renowned restaurants, as well as a nightlife hotspot of Rue de Lappe. Traces of area’s vibrant rebellious history, its pre-revolutionary 18th century decadent lifestyle dotted with workmen’s bars can be easily spotted in a labyrinth of small alleys and narrow passages leading towards Place de la Bastille along rue de Charenton, rue de Faubourg Saint Antoine, rue de Charonne, and rue de la Roquette. This neighborhood provides a bit out of ordinary yet genuine Parisian experience with its d
description: Charming apartment with elevator... Located in the very fashionable district 11th of Paris near Place de la Bastille and Gare de Lyon and just a stroll from the beautiful Place des Vosges. It is a trendy district where Parisians live and work while taking advantage of 30 green spaces open to the public. If you like walking, you can stroll along the Canal Saint Martin, famous thanks to the film (Marcel Carné, Hotel du Nord). Near Place de la Bastille, Gare de Lyon, the Père Lachaise Cemetery, and just a stroll from the Marais and its beautiful Place des Vosges. space: Very elegant and bright, over a surface of 50 m2, with all modern conveniences: washing machine, dishwasher, oven, large fridge, microwave, unlimited Internet, and television channels and heating. Situated on 7th floor with lifts, one bedroom with double bed 160, large living / dining room, fully equipped modern kitchen, bathroom, separate toilet and wooden floors. It is a secured and well located apartment in a quiet place in center of Paris. The area is known as BOBO - “bourgeois-bohèmes” - mixed cultures and artists. Situated on 7th floor with lifts, one bedroom with double bed 160, large living / dining room, fully equipped modern kitchen, bathroom, separate toilet and wooden floors. You can walk to closest metro station in 3 to 5 minutes -- Zone 1 – easy on the pocket to roam around in Paris  Maraichers (line 9) and Alexandre Dumas (line 2). Buses lines : 76 directly to Bastille-Louvre-Rivoli Line 26 : Nation - Gare St Lazare Line 64 : Gambetta - Place d'Italie Line 57 : Place d'Italie - Gare d'Austerlitz - Gare de Lyon The host speaks 3 languages fluently: English, French, and Brazilian (Portuguese). Normal check-in hour after 13 pm, and check out
transit: Métro : Lignes 9 et 2 Bus : (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
house_rules: A 500 €  security deposit will be required. The deposit is returned to you when you check out providing there are no deductions or damages. Keep the apartment tidy and clean for the all stay, clear all possible rubbish in the provided plastic bags. Turn off lights, kitchen appliance, AC, TV, heaters when not indoor.  No party and no noise from midnight Please respect the neighbors

space: Small apartement located in the authentic Butte-aux-Cailles district (Paris 13th arrondissement), available when I am away. 6th floor : NO LIFT 5 min walk from Place d'Italie (metro line 5-6-7) No parking Sleeping accomodation : 140 X 190 bed for 2. You will be provided with the necessary linen, pillows ... Eating : mini-kitchen equiped with fridge, heating surface and mini-oven, + electric kettle and toaster. But no mico-wave. Latest addition : a rice-cooker ! Bathroom : washbasin + shower ; toilet in the bathroom. You will be provided with towels. Multimedia : hi-fi sound system, wireless Internet, NO TV. Shopping : there's a mall nearby with a big supermarket ; a market takes place nearby 3 times a week in the morning (along avenue Blanqui : Tuesdays, Saturdays and Sundays) There's a public swimming pool nearby (33m long) in Place Verlaine.
description: 2 rooms apartment in one of the most authentic area of Paris : la Butte aux Cailles. 6th floor (no elevator), fully furnished and with a kitchen corner with everything you need. Since this appartment is the place where I usually live, it's only available when I am away, and I can only accept reservation requests from people with previous Airbnb (positive) feedback and a completed profile. access: the full 33 m2 of the apartment :))
interaction: I rent my place while I am away, but I remain reachable by cell phone, email, messenger ...
house_rules: Please don't smoke inside and limit the noise after 10 pm, especially in the staircase.
host_about:
Installé à paris depuis 10 ans, j'envisage d'utiliser Air BnB comme une alternative à l'hôtel pour mes déplacements professionnels, qui sans être trop fréquents sont néanmoins réguliers, du moins vers certaines destinations.
J'imagine aussi qu'il y a là l'occasion de rencontrer des gens intéressants et d'enrichir son expérience des villes visitées du point de vue des habitants, ce qui me va bien étant moi-même un peu ambassadeur de ma propre ville au travers de la logique du Couchsurfing.

transit: From Airport Charles De Gaulle : - local train RER B (40mn, 11€, but hard work with several suitcases! If you are 3 people, I recommend to take a legal taxi) - step out : station "LES HALLES" (-4 floor) - go up and follow the exit "Pierre Lescot" - at the police station, turn left and walk 50 meters. From "Gare du Nord" train stations (Eurostar, London, Bruxelles, Amsterdam, Koln) and from "Gare de l'Est" train stations (Frankfort, Stuttgart, Munich) : - by bus n°38 (20mn aprox, 2€) - step out : bus stop "Grenier Saint-Lazare"  - walk 7 mn. - by metro (line 4) - step out : Etienne Marcel - walk 100 meters on Pierre Lescot PUBLIC PARKING: there is a huge parking underground just around the corner. Check price and details here : "parkingsdeparis" MEETING POINT : Café Etienne is located just outside the only exit of subway station Etienne Marcel. The apartment is located 100 yards from Cafe Etienne. TAXI: it’s pretty easy to find taxi on boulevard Sebastopol. But on saturday at 2am, you w
access: Full access to the entire apartment. I will recommend you a TAXI COMPANY who has a special care for my guest: The driver waits for you at the airport with your name on a sign, helps you with the suitcases and takes you right into the apartment. So you can call me from his mobile and adjust the meeting. ;-)
interaction: Once you book, I will send you a file PDF with a lot of info (transport, etc...) Then 7 days before you check in, an 2nd file PDF with good House rules, good restaurants, wifi, access info and much more Daily communication if necessary. I am always pleased to help my guests but I appreciate that they read the info I sent them instead of asking again and again...
house_rules: WHAT I OFFER YOU : A nice 3 bedrooms’ apartment very well located for a very good price with a good hot water system, heating in each rooms, comfortable beds, clean beddings and towels, everything to cook, wash and dry your clothes with ease, a good wifi, few TV channels in English, Blue Ray and USB input. This middle-class apartment is ideally placed to visit the city by foot. The 3 balconies and 3 large round windows « à la Française » bring a lot of charm and light to start the day nicely... What else can you expect when you go out all day visiting the city, and come back late to have dinner and sleep until the next day of sigh-seeing? WHAT YOU SHOULD KNOW BEFORE BOOKING : My own house is not an hotel… but a much bigger place for a much cheaper price. That means : - No ironing, no new towels every day, no breakfast in bed (but I provide you the equipment to do it yourself ;-) - check in/out hour arranged together ahead (can’t just pop up when you feel like) - you can smoke but ONLY
host_about:
My fully-equipped 3 room's apartment is located in the heart of the heart of Paris and at a very good price! It offers everything you really need to enjoy good vacations in Paris : good wifi, hot water, heaters, comfy beds, kitchen and balconies (to smoke cigarets or only watch the scenery of the "Aristocats" on the roofs of Paris).
I love to help my guests as you can read so many advises on my ad (and much more when you'll book!) as technical details about transportation and also the good places to eat/drink/visit/shop.
I would say that my place is perfect for the following type of guests :  Young or middle-age (couple(s), friends, colleagues, relatives) who are thirsty to visit the city all day long, come back home to relax on the balcony for sunset with a glass of fine wine, then crash on my comfy beds until the next morning to go walking along the river ’s shore (la Seine is only 10mn’s walk from my place).  You can start by Les Tuileries (the king's playground), Le Louvre's courtyard (pyramide), join Notre-Dame (the back view is the best!), follow the flow to Le Marais' fashion shops, then (for the most courageous) enjoy a night concert on a "péniche" boat and come back home riding a time-share bicycle (for the most inconscients if they survive the paris driving ;-)  But of course, if you are 60 year’s old willing to spend all day writing your script at home on an old typewriter like Woody Allen drinking sparkling mineral water, this is also allowed... Strange to me (specially about the mineral water) but allowed...  Welcome to the Old Good Paris ! :-)
Finally, if you have been diagnosed OCD, uptight or maniac about sterilized cleaning and total silence... You should choose an other apt, surely an other city and maybe an other planet. I'm helpful but I don't want to deal with heavy cases in my house ;-)

space: This charming Montmartre studio is located a few steps from the place des Abbesses and the center of Montmartre. The métro is direct to go to the Place de la Concorde, Tuileries Garden, Musée de Louvre, Champs Elysées, Saint Germain des Près and Montparnasse. In 5 minutes you are at the foot of the Sacred Heart Basilica, Place du Tertre and the Moulin Rouge, which all make it the ideal location to discover the "Paris by night". In addition, you will find many cafés, terraces, restaurants and shops that will satisfy the most demanding epicurean.  Your home away from home is located on the 4th floor (walk up), you will bathe in sunlight with clear view of the sky and courtyard.  This peaceful escape in Montmartre is enhanced by the two large double paned windows. It has wooden floors, shielded door, built-in library, and is decorated with charming furniture, a large closet, and various original paintings.  The NEW BZ sofa bed has a firm mattress 14cm, 140*200, for additional comfort.  Th

host_about:
Sérénité Hôtes Services (SHS), offers services and assistance to owners of homes who rent furnished. Dineen, founder of SHS, will inspire you confidence through her on time, friendly, cheerful and dynamic welcome. She has over fifteen years of experience in the international services sector. Dineen's experiences working in several countries and speaking different languages (French, English with some Italian and Spanish) have enabled her to gain knowledge and skills with an international clientele.

Sérénité Hôtes Services (SHS) est une entreprise de service et assistance aux propriétaires des demeures louées meublées. Fondatrice de SHS, Dineen vous inspirera confiance grâce à son accueil ponctuel, chaleureux, souriant et dynamique. Elle a plus de quinze ans d'expérience dans le secteur tertiaire international, a travaillé dans plusieurs pays et parle plusieurs langues (français, anglais avec des notions d'italien et d'espagnol). Ses différentes expériences lui ont permis d'acquérir une connaissance et un savoir-faire avec une clientèle internationale.

space: The apartment is a duplex on the 6th floor (with elevator) of an art-deco building. First level: large living room with a grand piano, kitchen, balcony on the open inner courtyard and Montparnasse Cemetery. Upstairs: large bedroom and bathroom. This is for two guests, a third guest may be accommodated on the couch (not a fold-out). Quiet and exceptionally luminous, the flat conveys a great feeling of space and freedom and feels double its actual size. Relax and enjoy the Parisian life the artistic way. Nearby: The Catacombs, the Cartier Foundation, rue Daguerre with its daily market. Tons of restaurants and shops, and Montparnasse is 5 minutes away by foot. Bus 68 and 38 will bring you to the Luxembourg, the Musée d'Orsay, the Louvre, Opéra, Châtelet, etc.. 3 Vélib stations within 1 mn walk. Ideally situated between subway stations Raspail and Denfert-Rochereau (lines 4, 6 & RER B). Easy access to and from Orly [Orlybus (7.60€), Airtrain (10€) or cab (20€)] and Charles de Gaulle (RER B

host_about:
I am a French musician, live in Paris and travel a lot. I've lived 20 years in the US (New York, Brooklyn, New Haven, etc.), and also in Berlin, Germany. 

Favorite authors: Vian, Queneau, Stendhal, Murakami, Lethem, Hemon, Davies, Maugham, etc. Music: Stravinsky, Sibelius, Mahler, Beethoven.

space: This charming loft 85 m2 is located in a 18th century building. It was originally part of a monastery which was transformed into a hotel in the 60s. En 2000, five hotel rooms were restored and transformed into a loft decorated with numerous items purchased from around the world. It's a mixture of old and modern decoration. The apartment is composed of a large room with a north/south exposure that serves as a kitchen and living room. It overlooks a 15m², (150sqft), south-facing garden terrace complete with table and chairs, a hammock and chaise lounges for lying about in the sun. The living room has a very comfortable sofa-bed for 2, a table that seats 8 and a chimney. The kitchen is entirely equiped including a stove with 6 gas burners, a large oven. The bedrooms face west and are very quiet.  The neighbourhood offers delicious restaurants, wine cellars, local stores, the famous marché d'Aligre farmer's market, trendy boutiques and night life. The Bastille Opera is nearby, there's a ga

space: Cosy and warm loft located near La Bastille in the 11th arrondissement. It is located on the 4th and last floor and a charming and very parisian building. There is no elevator in the building but the stairs are really easy to climb.  The apartment is fully equipped for your confort: wifi with high speed fiber optic internet, washing/drying machine, TV, cable, 1 sofa bed, 1 king size bed, 1 bath. In the kitchen you will find everything ( fridge, kettle, oven, induction plates, dish washer...)  Our neighborhood is full of nice and fun restaurants, pubs and shops. It will take you two minutes to walk to one of the most famous fresh markets in Paris: Le Marché d'Aligre.  A few major monuments, including Notre Dame de Paris, are at a walking distance. Our apartment is very well served by public transports. The closest metro stations are Ledru Rollin (line 8), Charonne and Voltaire (line 9), Bastille (line 1); it is also close to the beautiful train station Gare de Lyon (RER A, RER D, line 1
description: Paris en plein cœur de Bastille. Loft en poutres apparentes du XVIIIe siècle et mur en pierre d’origine. Très chaleureux il combine l’authenticité et le confort moderne. Situé dans un quartier vivant notre appartement reste calme sur une arrière-cour dégagée. Bastille. space: Central location in 1st arrondissement Lovely studio located half way between Opera and Louvre - 1st arrondissement in the very center of Paris. 18th century apartment in a passage next to Palais Royal garden. Top floor (5th), (sorry WITHOUT LIFT!) sunny.  restaurants, organic shops / bakeries, big stores and museums around.   With easy access to several metro stops : Bourse / Pyramides / Palais Royal / Musée du Louvre or Les Halles. Small kitchen with oven toaster, microwave oven, fridge, coffee maker... Bathroom with bathtub, toilets.  Suits for one person or a couple. Free Internet, Wifi, copyprinter.  Don't hesitate to contact me for further information and pictures

The other bed in the living room is a sofa bed (very comfortable mattress 140X200). Kitchen and bathroom new. Wifi, tv. space: En plein cœur du Paris qui bouge, ce charmant 2 pièces de 35m2 vous permettra de passer un agréable séjour à Paris. Après une journée harassante de shopping et de visites, vous pourrez vous reposer dans cet appartement cosy et lumineux. Vous trouverez aussi une cuisine équipée pour vous concocter vos petits repas (four, plaques induction, blender), un lave-linge/sèche linge. Des supermarchés et des traiteurs (chinois, indien, libanais, thaïlandais, pizza) sont situés à 5 minutes à pied en moyenne de l'appartement. Situé au 3eme étage de l'immeuble, les moins sportifs, ou les plus chargés, pourront prendre l'ascenseur. Idéal pour un couple. Pour toute info complémentaire, n'hésitez pas à me contacter.
description: Delightful 35m2 haussmannian flat, light and cosy. Ideally located, you will be able to discover a lot of Paris by foot. space: Tucked away on the left bank of the Seine river in Paris in the heart of the legendary neighborhood of Saint Germain des Prés, just steps away from the Louvres and Orsay museums. Its ideal location will allow you to easily discover the main touristic sites on foot, by bus or subway. Romantic walks along the left bank of the Seine river are just 100 yards from the front door and there are numerous interesting art galeries and unique shops surrounding “Le Nid de Lucie”. The Latin Quarter nearby promises exciting nightlife for night owls. If you’re looking for a modern and calm apartement ideally located on the”Rue des Saint Pères” in the 6th district in central Paris, then this apartement will delight you. This private apartement is also nicely furnished and decorated with taste for you so you can enjoy great comfort in a relaxing atmosphere as if you were at home (wifi) Completely new spacious flat in famous neighborhood Saint Germain des Pres. space: PARIS XI. Sunny and quiet and practical 430ft apartment on the 6th floor (with elevator) of 7 floors building compose of :  > one bedroom with a double Japanese bed and huge wardrobe,  > a large living room with a beautiful big wood table (great for dinner or for working), > a fully equipped kitchen (with oven and micro wave) > a bathroom with a bath and washing machine > 2 balconies, > No Tv Metro is at the corner of the street (line 3). The flat is close to all facilities : supermarkets and all shops and at a walking distance of bars area and Père Lachaise cemetery as much as République, Bastille and Marais area.  900 euros / 3 weeks (including: electricity, gaz, central heating, water, insurance, high speed Internet & wifi, free phone calls (for fix numbers in France and several destinations abroad)). space: I propose you a cozy bedroom in  my 70 square meters apartment. The apartment is on the 4th floor of a typical Parisian building, with a very nice view over the Eiffel tower. There is an elevator and the access to the building is secured with an access code and a concierge. The bedroom is 15 square meters and faces the courtyard of the building. The bed is a  king size bed  equipped  with a comfortable mattress. Towels are provided.  Of course, high speed wifi is available.  French breakfast is included : fresh pastries and traditional baguette direct from the bakery, coffee / tea / orange juice.
description: I propose you a cozy bedroom in  my 70 square meters apartment. The apartment is on the 4th floor of a typical Parisian building, with a very nice view over the Eiffel tower. There is an elevator and the access to the building is secured with an access code and a concierge. The bedroom is 15 square meters and faces the courtyard of the building. The bed is a  king size bed  equipped  with a comfortable mattress. Towels are provided.  Of course, high speed wifi is available.  French breakfast is included : fresh pastries and traditional baguette direct from the bakery, coffee / tea / orange juice. You will have access to the bathroom and the kitchen. These rooms are shared with me. I'm very open and interested in other cultures. I speak English and Spanish, feel free to come and talk with me. I will be happy to help you to organize your stay in Paris and give you advices about my favorite places. The 15th district of Paris is safe and lively. There are plenty of very good restaurants al
transit: If you check on a map, you will see I am located in the south of the 15th district of Paris. The closest subway station is PORTE DE VERSAILLES and is just 250 meters away. The subway line number 12  will bring you to the very center of Paris within 15 minutes. There are also bus lines 39 and 80 running just down the street as well as bike rental stations.
access: You will have access to the bathroom and the kitchen. These rooms are shared with me.
interaction: I'm very open and interested in other cultures. I speak English and Spanish, feel free to come and talk with me. I will be happy to help you to organize your stay in Paris and give you advices about my favorite places.
house_rules: I'm easy going, but please respect the following rules  : - Take off your shoes when getting in the apartment. High heel shoes are strictly prohibited (wooden floor) - No smoking - Be quiet  - Only the guests that have booked are allowed in the apartment
host_about:
I was born in Brittany, western France, in a place called Finistère (literally "The end the the earth"), but I've been living in the 15th district of Paris for 20 years now. 
I like this neighbourhood very much and I will be pleased to give you good advices about my favourite places. I like travelling a lot and meeting new people from different cultures and backgrounds. Whatever information you need about my listings, feel free to drop me a line !
