space: 38 m2, located on the 1st floor without elevator of a small building with courtyard,   it consists of: - One bedroom with a double bed 140cmx180cm  - A bathroom close to the bedroom, with shower, sink, washing machine and a separated toilet, - A living room with a sofa bed, - An  equipped kitchen (with microwave and hob induction). Ideal for 2, suitable for 4 max. The flat is located about 1 hour from Roissy CDG and Orly transport (1 change from Roissy or Orly). To travel  in Paris, you will find 3 metro stations nearby (Republique; Goncourt and Belleville).
description: Located close to the Canal St Martin, 5min walk from the Place de la République, 10min walk from the Marais, Oberkampf or Belleville, this easygoing flat  and very well served by public transport  is ideal to discover and rediscover Paris. 38 m2, located on the 1st floor without elevator of a small building with courtyard,   it consists of: - One bedroom with a double bed 140cmx180cm  - A bathroom close to the bedroom, with shower, sink, washing machine and a separated toilet, - A living room with a sofa bed, - An  equipped kitchen (with microwave and hob induction). Ideal for 2, suitable for 4 max. The flat is located about 1 hour from Roissy CDG and Orly transport (1 change from Roissy or Orly). To travel  in Paris, you will find 3 metro stations nearby (Republique; Goncourt and Belleville). Free Wi-Fi  Sheets and blankets  are provided during your stay.  Towels provided on simple demand. French press coffee maker, coffee and tea and whatever you find on the shelves and in the fridge
transit: From Roissy  CDG airport (app.1h):  -RER B  to Gare du Nord station -Subway 5 to République -5 minutes walk. From Orly airport:(app.1h):  -Orlyval+RER B  to Gare du Nord station -Subway 5 to République -5 minutes walk. From Gare de Lyon:  bus 20 or 65, stop at République + 5min walk. or : Line 1 to "Hotel de Ville" + line 11 to "Goncourt"+ 2min walk.
access: Free Wi-Fi  Sheets and blankets  are provided during your stay.  Towels provided on simple demand. French press coffee maker, coffee and tea and whatever you find on the shelves and in the fridge are at your disposal.
interaction: Guests will benefit from the whole apartment. I or another person will always be available by phone or in person for any matter.
house_rules: Please don't smoke inside, and read carefully the information note you'll find inside the flat. If you have any question, doubt, problem, even minor ( drink spilled on the couch, need for supplementary blankets, question on the use of a device, etc.) please CALL first.  I'll be glad to help!

space: SPECIAL UPDATE ABOUT2013-2014 CALENDAR : APT. IS AVAILABLE ONLY OCT. 22-NOV. 3, JAN. 1-JAN. 5, FEB. 15-23, APRIL 19-27, AND JULY 15-AUGUST 6 17th century building, very quiet and cosy apartment, ideally located 5 minutes walk from Louvre museum,  10' from Opera and Galeries Lafayettes. In typically Parisian and seclusive neighborhood , over looking a charming landscaped courtyard.  4th floor walk up, hardwood floors, lots of charm. Great gastronomy in the surroundings.  Many buses and subway lines within walking distance.  Large living room with fire place and piano 2 double bedrooms, one with private bathroom.  1 additional bedroom with bunk beds  1 separate 1/2 bath, separate toilets. Dishwasher, washing,machine, microwave, toaster, boiler, steamer, wi-fi connexion. Large well equipped kitchen with dining table. Cleaning can be organised during the stay Important: Minimum stay of 5 nights.

space: Located in the very heart of Montmartre, this 100 square meter flat can welcome up to 6 people.  At the corner of rue Lepic (Amélie from Montmartre) and rue des Abbesses, you are 5 minutes away from both Sacré Cœur and Moulin Rouge, close to all restaurants, cafés, shops and touristic sites of this « village » within the city.  With a spacious and bright living room and an opened kitchen, this charming family flat includes 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and 2 toilets (the parent’s bedroom with double bed, one room with a double bed, one children’s bedroom with 1 single bed and 1 extra mattress.  Renovated in 2012, it is located in a typical old style building, on third floor without elevator. The flat is calm and fully equipped :  owen, microwave, expresso machine, washing and drying machines, wi-fi. Close to the metro stations Blanche, Abbesses and Pigalle.

space: Live like a Parisian in the most charming area of Paris. The apartment is located in a very safe district.  Walk 100m up and you are at the Sacré Coeur.  Walk 100m down and you have all the shops. It is 50 m way from the Montmartre vineyards in a quiet street without any tourists. We are at the beginning of the stairs leading to the Sacré Coeur. It is on the 4th and last floor of a typical “Montmartre” building that has been completely renovated last year. space: We offer a fully renovated apartment in residential Apart Adagio in the 15th arrondissement in Paris (porte de versailles), very close to the metro and the tram between 2 and 5 minuts walk. The apartment is 35 sqm, there is an entrance, a separate bedroom and a living room with a large comfortable sofa bed for two people,, you will find a fully equipped "kitchenette", a bathroom with a bath (toilets are separated), then you will have internet wifi and a flat screen TV, a lift and a garage !! This apartment is ideal for a holiday in Paris for a family of 4 people or for a group of friends. On request a cot baby can be provided. Accomodations: - Towels and bed linen are provided - Beds are made upon arrival - Maintenance kit provided for cleaning dishes and towels The cleaning is done at the end of stay, if the lease is two weeks cleaning is done at the end of the first.

space: Former workshop, designed by an architect,  located on the ground-floor, in a clustered courtyard; very close to Place de la Bastille, and metro and busses'stations. The apartment is situated between a tennis court and the clusterd courtyard, so it  is perfectly calm. You will therefore enjoy a perfect tranquility in an area full of life. You will be close to the Opera Bastille, the Canal Saint-Martin without mentionning the Place des Vosges and the historical district of le Marais. The appartment consists in a vast openspace living area and an open plan kitchen with all the necessary modern equipment (dish washer, microwave oven, washing machine etc...) The room is large with placards and a queen bed,is opening to the shower room, which has a dryer for the toiwels. The toilets are separated. interaction: Avant, via internet, et au moins une fois une semaine avant l'arrivée des voyageurs, le jour de l'arrivée et ensuite, dans les 2 ou 3 jours de l'arrivée par internet pour savoir si tout va bien

host_about:
Passionnée par les voyages et la découverte des autres, je partage mon temps entre Paris et la Bourgogne.
J'aime l'architecture, la gastronomie, le jardinage,  la lecture et la musique, mais par dessus tout mes 8 petits-enfants.
J'aime voyager en dehors des sentiers battus, les endroits atypiques, et aussi la voile.

space: Fantastic 55sqm one bedroom apartment located in the heart of Le Marais. On 3rd floor (with elevator) facing on a calm patio.  Bedroom: Very comfortable double bed and closet. Towels and linen are all included. Bathroom: Tiled bathroom with bath tub, sink, towel rack, washing machine.  Kitchen: Fully equipped kitchen - stove, oven, expresso machine, kettle, toaster, fridge/freezer, microwave, dishwasher.  Living Room: Sofa bed (sleeps 2), large flat screen (with international channels), parquet floor.  Amenities/Facilities: cable TV, Wifi access, central heating. Grocery store : only 2 mn walk.  Location : in Le Marais, one of the most beautiful area of Paris (Metro stop : Saint-Paul), with all the trendy shops, cafe, bars and restaurants. 5-10 minute walk to Place des Vosges, Seine River, Ile St Louis, Place de la Bastille -  5 mn metro from Louvre Museum and 10 mn from Champs-Elysées.
description: Welcome to our large and authentic one bedroom apartment (55 sqm ) ! Ideally located in the heart of Paris (near rue des rosiers), fully equipped, you will feel the  atmosphere of this hip and artistic neighborhood,  the best area to stay in Paris ! Fantastic 55sqm one bedroom apartment located in the heart of Le Marais. On 3rd floor (with elevator) facing on a calm patio.  Bedroom: Very comfortable double bed and closet. Towels and linen are all included. Bathroom: Tiled bathroom with bath tub, sink, towel rack, washing machine.  Kitchen: Fully equipped kitchen - stove, oven, expresso machine, kettle, toaster, fridge/freezer, microwave, dishwasher.  Living Room: Sofa bed (sleeps 2), large flat screen (with international channels), parquet floor.  Amenities/Facilities: cable TV, Wifi access, central heating. Grocery store : only 2 mn walk.  Location : in Le Marais, one of the most beautiful area of Paris (Metro stop : Saint-Paul), with all the trendy shops, cafe, bars and restaurants.
transit: Metro line 1 goes to Gare de Lyon, Bastille, Louvre Museum, Champ Elysées avenue, La Defense mall.  Bus 96 goes to Place Saint-Michel, Saint Germain-des-Près, Gare Montparnasse Bus 69 goes to Louvre Museum and Orsay Museum
access: Access to all the apartment
interaction: We answer to all questions to our guests and we'll try to be there at the check in and out. If not, we can rely to our concierge to give you the key of our apartment.
house_rules: Considering this is a quiet building, no loud music/TV nor stilettos heels noises will be appreciated. Double lock the door each time you leave the house. We trust you to treat our home with respect like it was yours.
host_about:
Bonjour! 

Franck and I like the good things in life and love to make our guests feel completely at home. The biggest compliment we can get is when our guests leave with "We'll be back soon!". 
The thing we love most about traveling with Airbnb is that we get to stay in places with a story. Houses, build and decorated with love and care.

space: On top of the hill of Menilmontant, here is a lovely 2 rooms accomodation of 40 m², equiped for 2 or 4 people, entirely redecorated in 2010 in keeping the typical spirit of a parisian workshop. Opening contemporary and fully equiped kitchen on a warm living room, including a sofa bed ( 2 people extra accomodation) , home cinema TV, hifi and wifi. The quite doublebed bedroom (with a desk corner) and its bathroom is overlooking a garden : only birds are waking you in the morning ! Rest and comfort guaranteed after an exciting and exhausting day walking around in Paris. Located in a quite street, nearby all transport facilities (bus line n° 26 and metro line n°11, a few minutes away) , you directly get in 10 minutes to the heart of Paris : Châtelet- les Halles- Beaubourg- Hotel de Ville- Notre Dame- le Louvre, etc... Nearby, the village like quarter of Jourdain with its church, square surrounded by bars,  shops, restautants make you feel the parisian atmosphere. A few more steps and you d

transit: La ligne de métro Chatelet - Mairie des Lilas vous amène dans le centre de Paris en moins de 10 minutes. La ligne de bus 26 rejoint la Gare du Nord et le RER B pour rejoindre l'aéroport ROISSY CHARLES DE GAULLE. Dans les deux cas, notre station "JOURDAIN"
house_rules: Merci de respecter les lieux et équipements mis à votre disposition, les espaces privés signalés. Penser à remplacer les produits alimentaires utilisés et veiller à la tranquillité de l'immeuble. L'appartement est destiné uniquement à l'accueil des locataires prévus. Le jour du départ, merci de vider les poubelles, enlever les draps et les plier, et vous assurer que l'appartement est dans le même état qu'à l'arrivée. En cas de problème durant le séjour, merci de contacter les référents indiqués dans le livret d'accueil.
host_about:
J'ai 57 ans. Parisienne d'origine italienne, mariée depuis 28ans et mère de trois garçons. Je suis actuellement retraitée mais je travaillais en tant qu'assistante sociale. Les contacts humains et les relations sociales sont très importants pour moi.
Je vis entre Paris et la Bourgogne où se trouve ma maison de campagne. C'est alors que je loue à Paris. Airbnb m'a permis depuis 2013, de faire de belles rencontres lorsque je reçois mes hôtes, à Paris ou en Bourgogne mais aussi lorsque je voyage puisque j'ai le temps désormais de découvrir de nouveaux horizons.
J'aime beaucoup recevoir et partager de bons moments avec mes amis et ma famille, cuisiner des petits plats car je suis gourmande...
Je parle un peu anglais, un peu espagnol,mais il faut être indulgent !

space: Our charming studio for rent is located in the hyper center  of Paris in a nice historical building on a quiet street in the 9th arrondissement, near Montmartre, Le Louvre and Opera Garnier. Our studio is completely renovated, light and airy, with two windows overlooking a courtyard. Our Paris lodging offers all the amenities needed to make your stay comfortable (queen size bed, bed and bath linens, toiletries, coffee machine, wifi, etc). The rental sleeps 2 persons.  Located in the center of Paris, our studio apartment is perfectly situated, nearby the chic Opera Garnier place and the historic Martyrs market street. The Louvre museum, Palais Royal, and Galeries Lafayette are also just a short walk away. Just outside your door, you'll find several excellent restaurants, cafes and boutiques.  * Max occupancy: 2 people  * Centrally located in 9th district  * Free internet, broadband, wifi  * Bed and bath linens, toiletries, coffee machine-Nespresso, etc  * Paris tourist info: maps, guide

space: 36 Durantin Street, right on the Butte Montmartre, this architect's little boutique offers a suite of 36 m2 ideal for a couple (can accommodate two extra people in a double bed). The glazed facade of the boutique gives directly on Durantin street located right in front of ''Le petit moulin" restaurant. The facade can become either opaque or transparent simply by pressing a button (Saint Gobain Glass new technology: Privalite). Once inside the boutique, there is a long narrow corridor that communicate with the other rooms. This space disposes a console table which can be used for having your breakfast. At the and of the corridor there is WC and a kitchenette equipped with a fridge and an induction hob. At an a slightly superior level separated from the ground floor by a few steps, there is a leaving room equipped with a cinema projector, a ceiling mounted projection screen and a sound system (record player, radio) with embedded speakers. space: Welcome by the Noemie's apartment! My apartement is located in the center of Paris, in the 15th district (subway line n°12, stop: Convention). My adress is 24 rue Robert Lindet, 75015 Paris. It has a nice and luminous livingroom, with a coach on which you can sleep, for 2 people. There is an part with a table, you can eat. You have the TV and an internet wifi connection. The kitchen is fully fitted with fridge & oven. Then, you access in my bedroom, with one double bed, it has a beautiful sight with a little garden outside. My last piece is the bathroom, you can take showers and baths too!  You will feel very good in my apartment. It is very quiet & confortable. It is near of the Georges Brassens' park, you can walk and make runnings. You have the Parc des Expositions behind my logement, there are always many exhibitions, and just near of it, the Palais des sports, with shows & concerts. In my quarter, you have alimentary shops & small supermarkets. Near the park you can have nice even

space: Renovated apartment of 57 m2 in 2011 in a secure building. The apartment has a bedroom with 140 cm bed (queen) with an excellent mattress shape memory. In the living room there is a sofa bed (140 queen bed with a real mattress very confortable) In the bathroom, a large shower, sink are available. Comfort (wireless Internet: wifi, large flat screen 3D TV, washing machine, dryer, iron, hair dryer) Linen and towels provided, Fully equipped modern kitchen with bar / island for dining (espresso machine). The apartment is very quiet because it gives almost entirely on a courtyard from the 4th floor. Double glazing to all rooms. Close to the apartment, you will find a small supermarket open 6/7 until midnight. Very convenient in terms of transport, there are three RER lines B, D and E that allow you to reach the airports (Orly ORY et Roissy Charles de Gaulle CDG) quickly 35/40mn. space: We have just returned from more than 1 year abroad. During that period our apartment was not available on AirBnb, which explains why our last review dates back from August 2016. THE APARTMENT : It is a large & ancient (146 square meter) family duplex in the heart of Paris – you can see the wooden ceilings in most of the rooms.  The apartment is in a private and very quiet courtyard, on the 3rd (last) floor (no elevator, like a lot of old buildings in central Paris, but the 60 stairs are regular and are no problem if you are reasonably healthy). It is fully furnished ; linen and towels are included in the price.  Downstairs, there is a large living-room with an open kitchen, a fireplace (not for use), a hi-fi system (with an iphone connection), a large sofa and two leather club chairs.  The kitchen is fully equipped: AGA stove, refrigerator, oven, coffeepot, Kitchen Aid artisan & blender, dishwasher… We also leave basic cooking ingredients, condiments & dishwasher powder, and, if you ar
description: Spacious duplex, full of light and very quiet. It is located in a trendy area, close to the metro and surrounded by some excellent local restaurants and traditional markets. We have just returned from more than 1 year abroad. During that period our apartment was not available on AirBnb, which explains why our last review dates back from August 2016. The apartment is in a private and very quiet courtyard, on the 3rd (last) floor (no elevator, like a lot of old buildings in central Paris, but the 60 stairs are regular and are no problem if you are reasonably healthy). It is fully furnished ; linen and towels are included in the price.  Downstairs, there is a large living-room with an open kitchen, a fireplace (not for use), a hi-fi system (with an iphone connection), a large sofa and two leather club chairs.  The kitchen is fully equipped
transit: We will tell you precisely how to reach our place.
access: Our guests have access to the whole appartment except for a small storage room (locked anyway!).
interaction: We will normally be meeting you at check-in time to show you around the place.  In addition, we leave a "home book" for you with a lot of recommendations on the restaurants & shops in the area.
house_rules: This apartment is our home, so we expect our guests to treat it with respect. It is a non-smoking flat.
host_about:
We are a French family with 3 kids. 

We love to travel (we have taken several months off to travel with our kids in 2012 and in 2017), and we enjoyed so much meeting people from the countries we were in & sharing with them during our trip that we know feel people should be able to enjoy a true Parisian experience!

space: Beautiful and quiet apartment in Montmartre, at the top of "rue Lepic", where lived Vincent Van Gogh, where there is the "Moulin de la Galette", and then the village of Montmartre with the "Sacré Coeur" and all the small streets with beautiful houses, painters, grapevine... 110 M2: a large double living room (with TV), a bathroom with bath and shower, two nice rooms with double bed (one with TV), one with a single bed. Housekeeping before each rent. Very close from the "Sacré Coeur", the "Moulin Rouge" and Abbesses (less than 5 minutes walking!). There are a lot of stores in the district: clothes (famous brands like Maje, Bash, Petit Bateau, Claudie Pierlot) , shoes, typical french food stores (bakeries,  cheese dairy, butcheries, fish shop...).  There are also a lot of restaurants, cafes, bars and theaters.  There are supermarkets and beauty shops. Metro (5 or 10 minutes walking): Abbesses, Blanche, Place de Clichy. Buses: number 80 or 95

access: Wifi, tv, microwave, Nespresso coffee machine
interaction: Non
house_rules: Nothing special... Just respect my place and my neighbours! Leave the apartment "normally" clean. My housekeeper will come after your stay (or during your stay if you spend more than 5 days). Check time: write me, I'm sure you we will find the best arrangement for you.
host_about:
Parisienne qui vit à Montmartre depuis des années et qui adore son quartier!
Enseignante auprès de jeunes enfants et passionnée par ce merveilleux métier.
Aime voyager, lire, sortir... une vie normale quoi!
Originaire de Corse, j'ai la chance de passer beaucoup de temps sur cette île magnifique.

space: Very nice apartment completely redone with new taste 2 minutes from two metro stations : the station poissonniere (line 7) and the metro gare de l'est ( line 4-5-7 ) and the Gare du Nord (RER B) , it needed to go to the airport directly. In the same building there is a supermarket, a baker and a launderette required to wash clothes in case of need. house_rules: L'appartement est un havre de paix situé dans un immeuble calme et respectueux de la vie de ses voisins. J'attends donc le même respect de la part des personnes qui y séjournent. Propreté et soin doivent être de rigueur. Il y a de nombreux objets de décoration, de bibelots, nous demandons donc à nos hôtes d'être précautionneux et de faire attention à la décoration en place.
host_about:
Bonjour, 

Je réside à Paris depuis 10 ans et depuis 4 ans dans la quartier de la Bastille, métro Ledru Rollin.

Je co-dirige mon agence de communication depuis 2 ans spécialisée en événementiel corporate, en relations médias, en digital et en direction artistique. J'ai également créé, avec mon associée, un magazine culturel digital.

Passionné de design et de brocante, mon appartement porte les traces de mes différentes trouvailles. Je suis également un grand passionné de plantes et de jardinage. Si vous séjournez chez moi, vous verrez que la nature est bien présente !

Parmi mes loisirs, je chante dans un groupe de musique et je joue au tennis.

Amateur de bons vins et de nourriture, je suis un épicurien à qui les soirées entre amis sont importantes.

À très bientôt je l'espère, 

Jean-Charles

Montmartre is the most visited place in Paris and even France. It was originally a small village overlooking the capital, it was soon annexed by the metropolis while retaining its special character.Montmartre was part of its originality to the many mills that were used to grind grain for the inhabitants of Paris. Subsequently, thanks to its charm, its cabarets and mysterious places, Montmartre became the inevitable place of all the great painters, writers and artists who have marked the twentieth century. space: The kitchen, though tiny, has everything you might need to cook. The price is the same for one, two, or three people. I  have one true (double) bed, wich is brand new from january 2014. If you're three, or two not willing to share a bed,  one person  sleeps on the couch. Sheets, blankets and bath towels are provided. There are two separate rooms, wich makes it perfect for parent(s) and child, or people who do not wish to sleep in the same room.
description: It's a bright, quiet and cosy flat on the last and fourth floor of a typical parisian building.If you're not busy elsewhere, you'll be able to admire the sunset while sipping a glass of wine on the couch. The kitchen, though tiny, has everything you might need to cook. The price is the same for one, two, or three people. I  have one true (double) bed, wich is brand new from january 2014. If you're three, or two not willing to share a bed,  one person  sleeps on the couch. Sheets, blankets and bath towels are provided. There are two separate rooms, wich makes it perfect for parent(s) and child, or people who do not wish to sleep in the same room. There is no elevator in the building.  You have the whole appartment for yourself. There is a washing machine and soap you can use for your laundry. Then, you can either hang it to dry or go to the laundrymat, 50 meters from the building. You can also freely use oil, vinegar, salt, peper, sugar, tea, and whatever is in the fridge. I live in the
transit: Don't feel like walking ? No worries. Bus, tram, metro, Velib, everything is no more than a 2-minute walk. Metro station is "porte de bagnolet". If you visit the public transportation site, you can easily visualize where it is and you can even calculate how long it takes to get to any place you want to visit. A parisian tip : when you look at the metro map, if you count 2mn per metro station, you know almost perfectly how long a trip will take (on a long ride, it will even be less). Does not work for RER or bus, just for metro or tram. Bus 57 takes you directly to my place from "gare de Lyon" and "Gare d'Austerlitz" without having to climb metro stairs with your luggage.
access: There is no elevator in the building.  You have the whole appartment for yourself. There is a washing machine and soap you can use for your laundry. Then, you can either hang it to dry or go to the laundrymat, 50 meters from the building. You can also freely use oil, vinegar, salt, peper, sugar, tea, and whatever is in the fridge.
interaction: I live in the appartment, so I rent it only when I do not need it because I am not in Paris. And of course I leave my belongings in the place. But then, because I live there, it is fully equiped, especially the kitchen. When I'm not in Paris (which is quite often) , I rent it for as long as I'm away.  Please, contact me through  airbnb mail if you want me to answer quickly: I get an SMS everytime I have a message on airbnb. Or send me an SMS andI will call back. In any case, whether I am in Paris or not, don't worry, I will call to check that everything is all right upon arrival, and call friends or neighbours to help you out if needed. I will do my best for you to enjoy Paris as much as I have enjoyed every single minute I've spent abroad.
house_rules: I'm not very fussy and I don't have anything very fragile ou very valuable.  So just be "normal" and take care of my stuff as if it was yours. You must  do a "normal" cleaning before leaving (correctly clean  the dishes,  empty the garbage, sweep the floor, wipe the tables, clean the shower and sink) before leaving, Or you can pay a 40 euros cleaning fee (on demand). Even though I quit smoking (at last!)  I understand one can appreciate a cigarette confortably sitting on the sofa . So you can  smoke in the living room if you wish, But make sure to get fresh air in the room , so it does not smell, and please don't smoke in the bedroom. If you stay a long while,  thanks for watering  the plants once a week.  Please, tell me about anything that might be going wrong as soon as possible, and I will do my best to sort it out. Check-in, check-out A person passes between each tenant to verify inventory and change the sheets . It is capable of passing any time between your departure time and ar
host_about:
Je donne des cours de théâtre. Sinon, j'aime voir du pays, les soirées autour d'un bon repas et un bon vin, et le grand air. A Paris, pour la vie culturelle, c'est parfait, mais pour le grand air, c'est pas terrible, alors je m'échappe vers la campagne quand je peux..  
I give theater classes. I love travelling (but don't do it enough), chatting around a table with good food and wine, and nature, gardening. Paris being grate for many things, especially culture,  but not for nature, I try to escape once in a while.

space: Charming Paris flat, with a bedroom incl a queen size bed, a living-room overlooking a cute courtyard, incl a sofa bed, small shower room inc toilets, separated kitchen.  Located in the residential 15th arrondissement of Paris, left bank, within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. Ideal for a couple, a family or friends. I have a folding baby bed if needed. The flat is great for a couple with or without a baby or with children above 8, not really below as there are a few fragile, illadapted stuff for children aged 4/6. 3rd floor, NO lift. WIFI, fridge and freezer, oven, 2 cooking gaz fires, Nespresso machine, washing & drying machine, hair dryer. NO TV, no microwave nor dishwasher. Quiet area of Paris, easy access to all major point of interest thanks to 3 subway lines (10, 6 and 8), food and convenience store very close. One can find a few nice restaurants around. And the famous, Rue du Commerce, an old shopping street dating when Paris was still a group of villages in the early 19t

interaction: I'm available to help prepare your trip and organise
house_rules: Please, leave the place as you found it. This is the place where i live, when i'm not at my boyfriend's or travelling. You're welcome to use stereo and CDs and read books as long as you leave them at my place when you leave. Inviting over guests is fine, within reason: I have a diner table that accomodates up to 6 guests and that's fine; over than that or having a party is not okay.  Don't be too loud please! I have a quiet old woman on the flat under mine, and would like to keep good relationship with her. I'd appreciate you not walking with noisy shoes in.  I'm a non smoker, but i have friends that smoke. Smoking is only permitted in the kitchen and in the living room, please. You'll find ashtrays in the upper bookshelf, on the glasses shelve, and out the living room window. Please use them and air a bit afterwards!
host_about:
Hi,
I'm a 42 years old Parisian, working in photography and communication. I live with my partner and our son in Paris 15. My step son is also often home with us. We travel as much as possible, and love diving, in France or abroad.
Renting flats or houses is our prefered way to travel, as it makes the experience more comfortable and gives the ability to feel a bit local.
I have open my own homes to Air BnB for a fews years and I will treat your place with all the care and respect i expected my guests to treat mine.
Thanks for hosting us!
Until soon.

space: Very close to the Moulin Rouge, Montmartre, and Galeries Lafayette (to do shopping), the small studio is perfect for couples. On the 8th floor (with an elevator) you will enjoy an AMAZING view over Paris. You will see from the terrasse the beautiful garden of the romantic life museum, the Eiffel tower, Pantheon, Invalides, Grand Palais, Louvres, Opéra etc. The building built in the 1930's has a lot of character.  Very quiet and peaceful and you can easily sleep at night,  You will be in the artistic area of Paris (Montmartre), many restaurants and bars. Many places to go out as well.  Lots of metro very close to the flat (Metro: 2, 12, 13, ) you can go anywhere in Paris very easily.

space: Our appartment is full of light. The living room is very spacious and has 3 big windows overlooking Paris streets. It is 64 m². There is a table (up to 8 people) and a convertible coach. The kitchen is fully equiped and is connected to the living room with an open window. The floor is all oak parquet, which give a warm feeling. The temperature is balanced : during summer, the flat is cool, and during winter, it keeps warmth even with few heating. There are two rooms : 1 for parents with a highly confortable  double bed (1,6m large), and one for kids with a short bed of 1,5 m long (convenient for babies) and a single bed in a mezzanine (picture coming ssoon).  Bathroom is splendid with true zellige tiles and a bathtube. Toilets are in the bathroom. There is a baby bath and a baby changing mat.  The flat is 3d floor accessible by a staircase. We don't have TV (but we have a wide computer screen).
description: Luminous and charming apartment in the authentik neighborhood of Oberkampf/Republique. Children an babies are welcome, gastronomy and good wine lovers too ! Our appartment is full of light. The living room is very spacious and has 3 big windows overlooking Paris streets. It is 64 m². There is a table (up to 8 people) and a convertible coach. The kitchen is fully equiped and is connected to the living room with an open window. The floor is all oak parquet, which give a warm feeling. The temperature is balanced : during summer, the flat is cool, and during winter, it keeps warmth even with few heating. Bathroom is splendid with true zellige tiles and a bathtube. Toilets are in the bathroom. There is a baby bath and a baby changing mat.  The flat is 3d floor accessible by a s
transit: As it is central in Paris, you are near the hot points of Paris : Marais (15 minutes walk), the theaters area (10 minutes walk), Bastille (10 minutes walk), parc des Buttes Chaumont (10 minutes cycling), Canal Saint Martin (10 minutes walk), ... Every other famous place (Louvre, Tour Eiffel, ...) can be reached by metro in less than 30 min. There is a velib station (self service bicycle - not fonctionnal at the moment) just in front of our building. Metro si only 3 minutes away (3 lines : N°9, 3 and 5). There is an autolib station 1 minute away (self service car). Going to Fontainebleau is 40 minutes away by train (the station is only 15 minutes away). You have bookshops, fashion clothes shops just round the corner.  Airports can be reached by taxi/RER in 30min/1h.
access: Guests will be able to access the whole appartment.
interaction: We will be happy to talk with our guests when giving the keys, or by phone at any time ; and to give advice on our favorite places for food or shoppping.
house_rules: We do not smoke in the appartement and we take off our shoes.
host_about: My name is Pierre. I'm 37, and I'm a physics teacher, working at the Ministry of Education. l'm found of guitar, clothes, nutrition and sport. My wife Magali is 39. She works in urbanism and plays theatre. We have a 8 years old son, who is completely found of pokemom, and a 3 years old girl who's favourite colour is pink for everything. We used to travel before (Asia, Iran, Europe, Brasil...). We like theatre, good restaurants and wine. We also like architecture and nice towns.

space: Quiet apartment in the center of Paris, in the Marais district. The room is a mezzanine in the living - not very high but very well seated, not standing - with a futon and a sofa bed downstairs. There is a well equipped kitchen (induction, toaster, food processor, Nespresso, dishwasher etc ...) and a small bathroom with a bathtub. The living room has TV, DVD, Netflix, games and even dumbbells and books ... especially food! Perfect for two people. Possible four, but you must like living tight :-)

house_rules: I do not smoke. But you can. A small incense, when you go, will be enough. If I leave hanging socks on the floor, you have the right to do when you leave. But to make it as clean (or more if you are motivated) than when you arrived.
host_about:
What a vast complex subject on which we could discuss for centuries. :-) First resume : boy, lesbian, work on the web's sphere. But the simplest is to ask me! No? For the rest, I am my own boss in the extremely ruthless but highly successful web business. I am developing, sometimes designer, consultant and trainer. It tells me I'm nice but stubborn when I'm convinced of being right which is very often.  Moreover, Rule No. 1: I am always right and Rule No. 2: If I am wrong, refer to Rule No. 1. :--))))) They told me that I am energetic and full of humor. Because I am empathetic. I draw energy from those around me... Sorry ! But for my funny side, others say pathetic. :-( I work on that! :-) For more details, please consult me for opening hours.

Quel sujet complexe sur lequel nous pourrions discuter pendant des siècles. :-) Tout d'abord en résumé : garçon, lesbien, travail dans le web. Mais le plus simple est de me questionner! Non? Pour le reste, je suis mon propre patron dans le monde impitoyable du web. Je développe, je suis aussi consultant et formateur. On me dit gentil mais têtu quand je suis convaincu d'avoir raison, ce qui est très souvent le cas. En fait, règle n°1 : j'ai toujours raison et règle n°2: si j'ai tort, se référer à la règle n°1. : -))))) On me dit énergique et plein d'humour. Le premier parce que je suis empathique. Je tire l'énergie de ceux qui m'entourent, je suis donc épuisant ... Désolé ! Pour l'humour, d'autres disent pathétique. :-( Je travaille là-dessus ! Pour plus de détails, me consulter aux heures d'ouverture.

space: Here you are in the real CENTER of Paris. It is the cutest street of the neighborhood, and you can also meet some movie stars just downstairs, such as Lenny Kravitz and Peter Doherty (who lives next door) that love to eat the traditional jewish falafell at Rue des Rosiers (at Las du Falafell). What else?  Well, I can teel you: ten minutes walk from Notre Dame Cathedral. Just in front of Saint Paul Metro Station (Ligne 1), directly connected to all the main parisien monuments such as Louvre Museum, Tulleries, Hotel de Ville, Chatelet, Concorde and of course, the Champs-Elysee. in 10 min by foot on each side you are at the river, la Seine. And I haven't even mentioned all the best restaurants, cafes, "boutiques", art galeries and museums just in the corner. space: Located on Paris’s prestigious Left Bank, the spacious apartment is nestled between the Ecole Militaire and Les Invalides. It is on a quiet street but just minutes away by foot from the world-famous Eiffel Tower, Champ de Mars, U.N.E.S.C.O., Musee Rodin, Musee Branly, Musee d’Orsay, Grand Palais, Petit Palais, Trocadero, and the rue Cler, one of the best street markets in Paris.  Paris’s 7th arrondissement is true chic aristocracy.   Your apartment is on the second floor of a classic building with secure entry and elevator.  There are 5 French windows across the front of the apartment letting in the gorgeous light from the wrap-around balcony.  Around the corner you can catch a glimpse of the Eiffel Tower.  The apartment windows are double-glazed for your comfort. The 105 square meter (1,130 square feet) apartment is tastefully furnished with a mix of 1940’s antiques and contemporary.  The artwork was especially selected to give you the true feeling of being in Paris, the City of Light
description: Imagine waking up in Paris with the sun peeking in your window, just teasing you to get up and start your day with a lovely cup of coffee and a croissant or pain au chocolat.  From here the Parisian world of excitement awaits you.  You could start with a stroll to the Eiffel Tower, around the corner and up the street.  Whatever you choose to fill your day, Jacques will be an excellent base from which to explore.  At the end of the day you can retire to the comfort of your own piece of heaven. transit: Metro -- You have several options with the Metro.  There are multiple-day passes available.  There is also a ‘carnet’ which is a pack of 10 tickets, with no expiration date and the pack can be shared by multiple people.  Currently a carnet costs 14.90 Euros.  The amount of times that you plan to use the Metro/Bus will help you determine which deal is better for you. Nearby Metro stations include:   - 4 minutes to Station Saint-Francois-Xavier - 8 minutes to Station École Militaire For those that prefer the bus, there is a stop just in front of the building.
access: The entire apartment is yours, with the great views and proximity the places like the Eiffel Tower.
interaction: I'm always reachable, whether by voice, TEXT/SMS, (Hidden by Airbnb) , email, or even Carrier Pigeon......assuming he knows the way!

host_about:
We are french and recently retired. We share our time between Paris and Toulouse.. We have a lot of friends in Scandinavia, US, Canada, Germany, Russia, Italy, Japan.
We do appreciate music, architecture, art exhibitions, movies. Suzanne was librarian at national level. Serge was CIO in a big international company.
We speak fluently english, danish and a bit of other languages (spanish, russian).

host_about:
I'm from   Argentina,living in Paris for more than 35 years.  I like to contact with people from different countries...sharing experiences...helping them discover Paris and  my country France.

I can manage many languages​​: I speak English, Spanish, French, and now I'm learning Italian.

I am interested in the social sciences, economics, archeology and  gastronomy.

My recent travels: Ethiopia, South Korea and Tierra del Fuego,India,China,Japan,USA.

I advise my travelers on tours in Paris to perform according to their interests

space: Charming third floor studio apartment located on a peaceful courtyard of a pedestrian neighborhood in Paris city center, 2nd arrondissement. The apartment sleeps 4 comfortably; and is equipped with cable TV, wireless internet connection, full kitchen including cook top, oven, microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher, all utensils, as well as a washing machine.  The apartment can accommodate 5 people only if at least one of the guests is a child. The apartment is a 5-minute walk to Montorgueil Street, a very lively area with many cafes, restaurants and bars. Given its central location the apartment is within a short walking distance to many major public transportation lines (Reamur-Sebastopol or Sentier: 5 minutes; Chatelet/Les Halles: 10 minutes); as well as walking distance to many major sites (Louvre Museum - 15 min, Opera - 15/20 minutes, Chatelet - 15 min). house_rules: In order not to disturb the inhabitants of the property during the rental : - Respect your neighbors and try to keep on good terms with them (politeness and discretion). - Avoid making noise in communal areas when carrying luggage in the stairs, slamming the front door, running in the stairs, ... - Noise should be kept to a minimal level, if you think it might bother you, then don't do it yourself. - Observe the general prohibition in France to make noise after 10pm. - Follow the instructions and regulations posted in the building. - Do not smoke, or crush cigarettes in public areas of the building. - Do not dispose of litter, paper or cigarette butts in public areas (staircase, lift …). - Do not throw your cigarette butts out of the windows. - Keep your Paris short term rental and its content in good condition.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Antoine
I'm an American from the midwest, who lived in France for 15 years but moved to London in Feb 2012 for professional reasons. I'm renting my studio in Paris that I lived in for many years. I hope you like it. 
Je suis américain, ayant acquis la nationalité française après avoir vécu en France depuis 1996.  J'habite actuellement a Londres, et de ce fait je loue mon appartement a Paris. J'espère qu'elle vous plaît.

space: In the heart of Paris'night life, enjoy a large, quiet private room and bathroom in our great apartment,  free access to our kitchen with dining area and to our living room with balcony. You will enjoy the sunny views to the horizon over the parisian rooftops,on the sixth floor above ground (with elevator to the fith floor) of our 19th century stone building in one of the most round-the-clock lively neighbourhoods in Paris, with a great number of cafés and restaurants, theatres and night clubs, historical "passages" and shopping areas. 15 minutes walk south to the Seine river, west to the Opera, North to Montmartre, we also have several major bus and metro lines (7,8,9,3 and 12) that will take you anywhere in the city within about 20 minutes. Our closest metro station : "Grands Boulevards". My husband is a journalist, I am an architect and we will be pleased to welcome you and give you some tips to discover our wonderful City and country.  The private room can accomodate 2 people (we c

transit: We give detailed informations to each traveller to help them reach our place easily from whichever airport, train station or road they will arrive.
access: free access to our kitchen includes a refrigerator, all cooking equipment, washer and dryer, free tea and coffee at any time.
interaction: We both work long days, however we make sure our guests have everything they need and we like to share a drink and a good conversation when the opportunity arises. The variety of people we have hosted is fascinating, we have never been disapointed and we want to keep enlarging our knowledge of the world's cultures by hosting more people, french and foreign, whose curiosity have brought them to our city.
house_rules: We want people to feel at home and welcome with respect to our neighbors, and our appartement. More specifically "no smoking except on the balcony.
host_about:
Jean-Pierre is a journalist and Mathilde is an architect, we both run our own buisnesses.
When we are not at work we like worldwide travelling , especially horse back riding across wild country and enjoying the company of local people.
our favorite destinations are Argentina, Italy, Mongolia, Syria and NYC.
We like contemporary art, theatre and music.
and we also snow or water ski and bike ride in the country side.

space: Large, quiet 2-room Apartment in the very heart of Paris : a refurbished Building, with security disposals and lift. Apartement is at 4th floor. The flat has been totally renewed and refurbished in a contemporary style. It includes one separate bedroom  equiped with a large size bed (160x190cm, accommodates two) and a dressing. 2 sleeps more in a large leather sofa in the Living Room.  A dinning space is next to the open kitchen, so you can cook at home if you want (utensils available, fridge/freezer, oven, microwave oven, 4 cook tops, kitchen ware - there are also supermarkets near the building).  Please note the bathroom is 8 steps below the flat (1/2 floor); you reach it by an inside staircase. WC are inside the bathroom. Kitchen is fully equiped, it includes dishing and washing machines.  Wifi access. TV.

Well served with lots of subways line (1-9-8) and buses lines. At the foot of the flat is the 9 subway line. You can go directly to Opéra (shopping at Galeries Lafayette, Printemps stores) Champs Elysées (Grand Palais et Petit Palais museums), Arc de Triomphe, Trocadéro, Musée d'Art Moderne, Tour Eiffel, and with the 69 bus line you go to the Louvre and Orsay museums, by the river Seine..Centre Pompidou museum of modern art is at 20mn of walk...and you can see much more! Taxis are available near the apartment.
access: The entire apartment (3 sleeping rooms and a big dining room -lounge) a big kitchen in which you can eat. 2 bath rooms.

house_rules: Make yourself at home!  Respect of the place: watch the systematic closure of electricity ,gas, front door when you live. Reasonable use of water. Loss of keys or degradations of the apartment are not included in the price of the rent, and must be repaid by the insurance of the tenant after registration. host_about: Nous serions ravi de vous accueillir chez nous. Nous sommes aussi grands voyageurs et aimons notre confort après une journée de ballade! space: Stunning 2 bedrooms apartment located in the heart of Le Marais which is the most central and convenient area.  The entire apartment has been completely renovated by a well-known Parisian architect. This property is actually a 2 storey (floors) apartment with at the 1st floor a large and bright living room and dining room. The very cozy and charming living room has a fireplace and a brand new pull out sofa. The modern kitchen is upgraded and fully equipped. The amazing terrace will make this apartment unique with a very relaxing patio to enjoy your glass of wine. Upstairs, the master bedroom with its double bed and flat screen TV and the second bedroom is actually a kids bedroom for one person which make a total guest of 6 people. There are 2 toilets (upstairs and downstairs). Kitchen: oven, microwave, Nespresso coffee machine, washing machine, kettle, induction cooker....   The area is probably the best in town! Easy walking distance to all major attraction, restaurants, coffee places

space: Dear guest airbnb,  Studio to let right in the heart of Paris in the switched-on quarter of the 11th Arrondissement 2 minutes from Metro station.  Studio is not included in a flat. You will not have to share anything. Furnished room with built-in kitchenette, small bathroom with shower and toilets, television, electric heating. Unpretentious but with all the basics for a couple to spend a weekend in Paris at the minimum of expense.  The studio is in quiet surroundings on the second floor looking over a courtyard; without any noise pollution but with all the advantages of the trendy quarter of the Bastille in Paris. The shops stay open until 10 p.m. and there is no lack of cafés and places to go to right next to the bedsit. The studio is unpretentious but provides all that’s needed to spend a few nights at low prices - single or couple. The Metro station  is 2 minutes from the building. host_about:
As CEO and creator of the organic lingerie brand "Do you green" and educated as an architect DPLG (diplômé par le gouvernement – government qualified) I have enjoyed working and living abroad when I had the opportunity - in Taiwan and today in Tunisia, where I travel regularly. I am a fan of the television programme "J'irai dormir chez vous"* – (I don’t know if you know it?) I can give you tips for interesting visits and shopping addresses or my favourite restaurants in Paris – don’t hesitate to ask me.   The best cafés in Paris – in my opinion – are in the luxury hotels - and for a price that is astonishingly reasonable for the place and comfort (and you can stay there several hours). I recommend visiting one at least! I wish you to enjoy your visit and have a magnificent stay in this beautiful capital!

* J'irai dormir chez vous - Antoine de Maximin invites himself into ordinary people’s homes all over the world accompanied by just two cameras.

space: This flat is perfect for 4 people visiting Paris. It is located in the center of Paris, near the Eiffel Tower. The flat is 36 square meters and is composed with two rooms (one with a double bed, the second with a table for 6 people and a sofa bed for 2 people). The area is safe (500 meters to the police station) with a lot of shops and restaurants. Near to the flat you will find a market with fruits, cheese, fish, vegetables, ...   The street is calm (no noise). You will be very near to different subway stations in two different lines (Vaugirard line 12, Cambronne line 6). 10 minutes by subway to the Champs-Elysées, 15 minutes by subway to the Louvre museum,...  Equipments : wifi, washing machine (with a dry function), fridge, oven and microwave oven, big sreen tv (with more than 200 channels in French, English, spanish,...), shower. I would be very happy to rent my flat to you. Please ask me if you have any question.

space: The apartment located on the 7th floor (with elevator), is an ancient "atelier d'artist" (artist studio), now a charming and bright duplex of 75 m2 (807sf) overlooking the rooftops (you can even see the top of the Eiffel Tower). Ideally located in the center of Paris, next to the Champs Elysées. It is located in a very quiet street and the flat is very very quiet. It is decorated with French antics style furniture (the owner is also a designer) with a contemporary touch.  The large confortable bathroom has a large round bath and a shower. Toilets are separated. The sofa in the living room can be use as one kid's bed. You’ll find all the restaurants you could ever want in the neighborhood but in  case you want to stay in and cook for yourself there is grocery stores (Carrefour and a Franprix) and many Bio at 3 minutes walking from the apartment. space: You will immediately know you are in the heart of Paris when you will see the Eiffel Tower twinkle through the windows of this modern one-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in a quiet and secure residential area, you are just minutes away from the most visited landmarks and venues in Paris. The Eiffel Tower and the Champ de Mars are just at your doorstep (a 1-minute walk) and it will take you less than 20 minutes to get to the Champs Elysées by foot. Unless of course you choose to stop on your way to enjoy the sweeping view over Paris from the Trocadéro (a 10-minute walk from home), a Matisse painting at the Museum for Modern Art (a 10-minute walk), ancient Maya artifacts at the Quai Branly Museum (a 10-minute walk), or a spectacular art exhibition under the glass and steel ceiling of the Grand Palais (a 15-minute walk). But who said you had to walk ? The appartment is just 5 minutes from the subway (Bir Hakeim, Dupleix, La Motte-Picquet stations for lines 6, 8 and 10) and the undergro

space: FLAT  DESCRIPTION: 1 large living-room with TV,Internet HI-FI and DVD. 3 bedrooms (6 sleeping couches):  - bedroom with a double bed  - children’s bedroom with 2 single beds (and 1 baby bed if needed) - guest room with a sofa convertible into a bed for 2 people 1 well-equipped kitchen (oven, micro-wave, ceramic hob, fridge, freezer, dishwasher) 2 bathrooms:  1 with shower  1 with bath tub & washing machine and dryer All the necessary infant facilities are available (baby chair, bed, toys, child bike, etc...).  2 adults bicycles + 1 child bike & 1 child bicycle seat. If you have any question regarding the area or any advise you’ll need for your stay in Paris, we will be very happy to help and give you the best adresses. See you soon Stéphanie and Jérôme.
description: Very pleasant and quiet flat 82 m2 (872 ft²) with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms in the center of Paris (near Montmartre and the Sacré Coeur). FLAT  DESCRIPTION: 1 large living-room with TV,Internet HI-FI and DVD. 3 bedrooms (6 sleeping couches):  - bedroom with a double bed  - children’s bedroom with 2 single beds (and 1 baby bed if needed) - guest room with a sofa convertible into a bed for 2 people 1 well-equipped kitchen (oven, micro-wave, ceramic hob, fridge, freezer, dishwasher) 2 bathrooms:  1 with shower  1 with bath tub & washing machine and dryer All the necessary infant facilities are available (baby chair, bed, toys, child bike, etc...).  2 adults bicycles + 1 child bike & 1 child bicycle seat. If you have any question regarding the area or any advise you’ll need for your stay in Paris, we will be very happy to help and give you the best adresses. See you soon Stéphanie and Jérôme. Ideally located in the 17th district of Paris near Montmartre and the Sacré Coeur (20mn at walk).
transit: Public transportation from Charles de Gaulle's Airport to our apartment (1h05): - RER B (direction Massy-Palaiseau) to Gare du Nord - Line 2 (direction Porte Dauphine ) from La Chapelle station to Place de Clichy station - Line 13 (direction Anière/Saint-Denis-Universite) to Guy-Moquet or Brochant station
interaction: Nous serons ravis de vous aider à organiser votre séjour (itinéraires, visites, conseils), n’hésitez pas à nous contacter ! A bientôt Stéphanie et Jérôme
house_rules: House's rules: - you can make some noise during the day but after 22pm, just be careful to not wake up the neighboors  - respect the place, the instruments, you may use it if you care about it.  - please do not smok in the bedrooms.
host_about:
Hello,

My husband Jérôme is 38 years old and he's engineer. I'm Stephanie, 38 years old and I'm buyer. We have 2 daughters and 1 son: Margot is 8 years old, Romane 5 years old and Bastien 1 years old. We love travelling and discovering new cultures.

Mon mari Jérôme Ingénieur et moi même avons 38 ans. Je m’appelle Stéphanie et je suis acheteur. Nous avons 2 filles et un garçon : Margot âgée de 8 ans, Romane 5 ans et Bastien 1 an.
Nous aimons voyager et découvrir de nouvelles cultures.

space: This is a quiet and lovely apartment, very bright, (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) ), last floor of a brand new building. Located in a popular neighborhood, recently renovated and only a few steps from "Montmartre". Many food stores and lots of restaurants. The subway (line 4 & 12) is only 1/8th mile away. This will take you downtown in no time (well let's say 15mn...) Le Louvre, Notre Dame, Le Chatelet... And many bus lines. There are two bedrooms with high quality bedding. One with a queen size bed, upstairs. The second one with a regular bed. Each room has it's own bathroom with tub and toilets. A large and particularly bright living room with one sofa bed and a confortable couch, and an open kitchen fully equiped. And, last but not least, a terrace at each floor. 200ft2 around the living room and 120ft2 in front of the upstairs bedroom. You won't be allowed to smoke but on the terrace WIFI, TV, washing machine and dishwasher. sheets and towels are included. Umbrella, table, chairs

It is expected that all guests will be respectful of apartment property, private belongings. This whole system rests on mutual respect for each other. I respect you by providing a very respectable living situation, and you respect me by enjoying it in a respectful manner.

space: This beautiful corner apartment with balcony is situated in Montmartre, just a few meters from the famous Metro Abbesses and the Sacré Coeur church. Located on the 2nd floor, it has a large living room of 30 m2 and a fully equipped kitchen. The apartment has ONE BEDROOM and a bathroom but it's possible to book an EXTRA BEDROOM with his own bathroom IF YOU BOOK FOR MORE THAN 2 GUEST. FOR 2 PEOPLE, you will have access only to a part of the apartment, the bigger, containing the large living room with an open kitchen, one bedroom (double bed) and one bathroom (with shower) and restroom. (Green zone on the picture). OVER 3 PEOPLE, the apartment becomes a 60m2, including an additional bedroom (double bed) and bathroom (with shower) and restroom. (Blue zone on the picture).  Of course you can book the entire apartment for 2 by choosing 3 guests. For a Couple, with the family or with friends, this apartment is ideally located in Montmartre and perfectly arranged and equipped. The balcony will
description: Beautiful corner apartment in charming Montmartre, with one bedroom and in option a second bedroom, each with bathroom. Ideal for 2 couples. Metro 2 mins walk. The Louvre in 25 mins walk. Many shops and restaurants nearby This beautiful corner apartment with balcony is situated in Montmartre, just a few meters from the famous Metro Abbesses and the Sacré Coeur church. Located on the 2nd floor, it has a large living room of 30 m2 and a fully equipped kitchen. The apartment has ONE BEDROOM and a bathroom but it's possible to book an EXTRA BEDROOM with his own bathroom IF YOU BOOK FOR MORE THAN 2 GUEST. transit: Perfectly located, the apartment is served by Line 12, Métro Abbesses (don't forget to take the elevator, too many stairs!) and by Line 2 Metro Pigalle or Anvers located a little further. Many buses serving the city centre. You will also find the Montmartre train tour to discover the aera or if you're brave you can rent a bike at the Velib station! The proximity of Gare du Nord makes it easy access to both Charles de Gaulle and Orly airports by RER.
interaction: Once you have booked the apartment, you will receive an email from airbnb with all the information you need and a link with a set of instruction about the district and transport access to the apartment from airport or train station, as well as the car park nearby.
house_rules: The earliest check in time is 14:00 hrs and the latest check out time is at 11:00 hrs. Thank you for respect it. We need 3 hours to clean the room. You can arrive any time after the agreed check in time.  When you arrived in the apartment, take the time to read the instruction manual for an appropriate use of the place, which will allow you to get back your security deposit of 300 Euros via Airbnb.  Faults that are found before or during the rental period are to be reported to the owner immediately. In case of damage by yourself, have the kindness to notify me before the chek out. The day you leave, we ask you to clean and store your dishes. Take out the trash. Store the apartment and turn off the heating and light. There is no daily housekeeping service. For long stay (more than 10 days), there is a cleaning service once a week. A set of 1 large and 1 small towels per person are available. It won't be possible to provide more. This is a no smoking room. Only use appliances for their i
host_about:
Bonjour, je m'appelle Marthe. 
Mon appartement est décoré avec soin. Je demande à mes locataires d'être  respectueux des lieux et je demande également d'être particulièrement calme et discrets afin de préserver mon voisinage. 
Je parle anglais, espagnol et français.

space: In a charming little street the Cité du Midi is located in a very lively neighborhood. The apartment is small (50m²) but practical, bright and in a great location. There are two rooms, I stay in one, the other one is for you. It is ideal for one or  two persons. The bed is a full size bed (140 x 200 cm). There is only one bathroom that you will share with me. It includes a sink, shower and the toilets. There is also a washer and dryer. The kitchen has an oven, microwave, dishwasher, electric kettle, Tassimo coffee maker, toaster, refrigerator/freezer with ice and cold water.  The closest Metro stations are Pigalle (line 2 and 12) and Blanche (line 2), a little further is Place de Clichy (line 2 and 13).  Access is easy from Charles de Gaulle (CDG) airport with the RER B (train) that you take to Gare du Nord and then you connect to the Metro line 2 for four stops to Pigalle.  From the apartment you are really close to rue Lepic (you can go to the café where they filmed Amélie Poulain) a

transit: Les directions précises seront envoyés quand la réservation est confirmée.
access: Guests have access to the bathroom that we share.  They can also use the kitchen to cook some meals.  They can order to go and come eat at home.  They can store food in the fridge.
interaction: I enjoy talking with my guests and getting to know them a little, but I understand that they may want to be left alone or with their travelling companion.  During the day I work from my computer in my room so I am less available but I will always answer questions, give directions or recommend places to go to or things to see. I just ask that you understand that I can't spend hours with you or make reservations for the rest of your trip, or solve complicated problems. At least not during my regular working hours.
house_rules: I like to help  young travelers who need a comfortable, inexpensive and safe place to stay. Some people tend to think that since they pay they can expect perfection. Well, I don't know what that is so I just like it when people are nice, kind and thankful.
host_about:
Bonjour, j'habite un quartier très animé de Paris: juste sous Montmartre. Mes enfants vivent maintenant à Santa Barbara, CA, USA. 
I am French and I live in Paris, by Montmartre a very busy place... My boys now live in Santa Barbara, CA.

space: IN ENGLISH :  Vast and clear apartment in the area of Menilmontant. Closed (2 minutes) to the subways station Couronnes and Menilmontant.(15 minutes direct to Montmartre, 15 minutes Notre-Dame-de-Paris) The appartement includes : - 3 rooms : a parental room with a small shower-room, 2 kids  rooms (one with a single bed in a mezzanine and a children bed, one with 2 single beds). We have also a baby cot. - a bathroom (bath, washing-machine, dryer) - a well equiped kitchen (dishwasher, microwaves, induction hob..) - a large living room with big table, sofa, TV, wifi... - you can park your car in our underground park car (the park car is closed and reserved to the residents) - the appartement is very clear and quiet. It is located in a sixties residence that includes several buildings with courtyards et gardens closed where children can play. - the residence is located just in front a very nice park : "le parc de belleville" with a lot of kids games. - the area of Belleville-Ménilmontant i

house_rules: Nous ne louons cet appartement qu'à des familles. Cet appartement est celui où nous vivons. Nous laissons nos affaires personnelles, ainsi que celles des enfants. Merci de respecter les lieux et de faire attention à nos effets personnels, notamment les jeux des enfants.  Ne pas ouvrir les placards scotchés. La résidence est familiale, merci de d’éviter de faire du bruit.  L’appartement est non fumeur. Only for families. We live in this appartment. We leave at home all our personnal belongings, including kids belongings and games. Thank you to respect these belongings.  Do not open the closets with adhesive. The residence is family friendly, thank you to avoid to make too much noise.  The appartment is no smoking.
host_about: Nous sommes une famille parisienne. Journalistes tous les deux, nous avons trois enfants de 9 mois, 6 ans et 11 ans.

space: Bonjour,Je loue un appartement situé dans le centre de Paris au coeur du quartier Montorgueil.L'appartement peut accueillir confortablement 6 personnes. Il mesure 55 m2 et se situe au 6 ème étage.Il est très lumineux et ensoleillé, car il bénéficie d'une double exposition.Il est composé trois pièces, dont deux chambres. La première est composée d'un lit double et la seconde d'un canapé convertible. Il y a un deuxième canapé convertible dans le salon.Il y a un grand salon qui dispose d'une grande table pour diner, d'une télévision écran plat câblée (box + canal plus) avec de nombreuses chaines (Website hidden by Airbnb) salle de bain est composée d'une baignoire et d'un lavabo.Les toilettes sont séparées de la salle de bain.La cuisine est toute équipée avec deux plaques de cuisson, d'un four, d'une cafetière, d'un grille-pain et toute la vaisselle (Website hidden by Airbnb) apprécierez les 3 petits balcons séparés avec une petite table pour diner à 2!Les draps et les serviettes sont fou
description: 55 square meters flat which can easily accommodate 6 people. 6th floor, you will appreciate the view over the rooftops of Paris and the Eiffel Tower! 2 bedrooms, first one with a king size bed, and the second one with a convertible sofa. An other convertible sofa is in the main room.  You've got everything to enjoy you stay in Paris : wifi, cuisine fully equiped kitchen, tv, dining table... space: Beautiful 5-room duplex of 115m2 (square meters), fully renewed in 2015 by an architect, at the 2 last floors of a modern building. 2 lifts available to reach the apartment. On the 9th floor :  - Living / dining room with fitted kitchen (including a Nespresso coffee machine) - 1 bedroom with dressing room and en-suite bathroom with huge walk-in shower & double bathtub - 1 separate toilet. - Home cinema videoprojector in the living room and HiFi system. On the 10th floor : - 2 bedrooms. The first bedroom has 1 double bed (+ 1 baby crib). The second bedroom has 2 single beds (truckle bed). - 1 bathroom with bathtub - laundry room with washing machine, tumble dryer and iron - 1 separate toilet. An extra travel babycot can be put in a bedroom if requested.  Floors and designer furniture, highly comfortable. Air conditioning available (only at night) in the 3 bedrooms and in the livingroom during hotest summer days (when outside temperature is more than 30°).  Modern building : the apartmen
description: Pictures will talk for themselves :  115m2 duplex with exceptional view for unforgettable experiences. Have breakfast above Parisian roofs, enjoy sunsets over the Sacre Coeur of Montmartre, look flashing the Eiffel Tower. Prestige design and comfort with 3 bedrooms (with AC) & 2 bathrooms in the heart of the "real" traditional Paris of Canal St Martin. Car park. Ideal location to discover Paris (foot, bicycle or subway) Get our 30 page guide with our favorite places to discover! On the 10th floor : - 2 bedrooms. The first
transit: The apartment is located at only 15 minutes by walking from Gare du Nord et Gare de l'Est (where arrive and leaveTGV speed trains, Eurostar et Thalys), so it is very convinient for travelers who come to Paris from London, or even Belgium or Germany. 3 subway stations are located just nearby the apartment: - Subway line 2 at "Jaurès" station (to go to Montmartre and the Champs Elysees ) - Subway line 5 at "Jaures" station (to go to Bastille, Gare de l'est or Gare du nord stations directly) - Subway line 7 at "Louis Blanc" station (to go to the Opera Garnier, department stores, on the Ile St Louis , the Louvre museum, ...) Also several buses right down to the building... All within 5 minutes walk maximum from the apartment.
access: If you rent the whole apartment, you 'll have access to all the apartment without any restriction. It is the apartment we live in all year long so there will be some of our "stuff" inside. We will welcome you personally at your arrival (or the building's concierge / keeper if we cannot be here) to show you all the apartment details and give you some tips on what to visit in Paris, restaurants nearby, etc.
interaction: We love to travel and share experiences with travelers, French or other languages (such as English or Spanish), we always find a way to understand each other. We have plenty of good tips to share with you (restaurants, original visits, theatre, ...) in order for you to enjoy the maximum possible. We prepared for you a  30 page guide with our favorite places (known ones... and hidden ones).  If you want we can arrange you some wine or champagne or full appetizers to enjoy your stay. Just ask what you would like...
house_rules: The apartment has been completely renovated to new by an architect and it contains some of our personal belongings (clothes ...) and beautiful valuable furniture (eg : sofa, chairs and lighting design, paintings and photos of artists, bath room furniture ...). We ask you to be respectful of this decoration and be especially careful not to damage the apartment, furniture or belongings because its replacement’s value can be very high. We ask you in particular to pay attention to the elements below and to please respect them: · Remove your shoes at the entrance of the apartment (in particular because of the presence of wooden floors and carpet) · No smoking in the apartment · Pets are not allowed in the apartment (dogs, cats, etc.) · Systematically close the front door of the apartment with the key, even when you are present in the apartment because the door closes badly and sometimes it can easily remain open (it has happened several times in the past) · Make sure, before leaving the apa
host_about:
Nous sommes un couple de 37 ans avec une fille de 4 ans et demi et un petit garçon de 6 mois.
Passionnés par les voyages et le mobilier design, nous avons entièrement rénové et façonné notre duplex pour en faire un lieu lumineux, ouvert sur Paris et le monde. 
Voyageurs baroudeurs, et toujours équipés de notre appareil photo, les nombreuses photos présentes sur les murs de notre appartement sont autant d’invitations à vivre nos voyages. Nos coups de cœur : le carnaval de Rio, l’Inde du Nord, Pétra en Jordanie, le catamaran aux îles Grenadines et tellement d’autres encore…
Toujours en quête de nouveaux endroits à découvrir dans notre quartier, nous apprécions les partager avec nos amis et, depuis que nous sommes hôtes airbnb, avec nos voyageurs.  
Amateurs de bons repas agrémentés de vins, nous aimons recevoir nos amis et leur faire découvrir des produits du terroir et des vins souvent méconnus. Nous recevons nos voyageurs « à la maison » et préparons avec eux, en amont, leur venue pour que chaque séjour soit personnalisé.

space: You will be the second roomate of a 45m2 appartment, located at the foot of the  Butte Montmartre. You will have your own set of keys, your freedom and autonomy. It is an ideal place for visiting Paris and stay at for a while The appartment is close to shops and the subway (Chateau Rouge line 4, Marcadet Poissonniers line 4 and 12, Jules Joffrin line 12, or Barbès Rochechouart line 2). The appartmenr borders the "hipster" and the popular neighborhood. It is quite alive and eclictic! It is easy to get around to the center of town. It is the second bedroom of the appartment, originally inhabited by the second roomate, who has to leave sometimes. Comfortable for a single person or a couple. Things to know : - You may use the kitchen, the bathroom, the living room too. - Because of the configuration, there is no defined dining area. We recommend eating in some nice affordable restaurants around, and some cute bars. You may however eat in company of the roomate or use the kitchen for your o

interaction: If you need any advice or tips for a restaurant, some shopping adresses, transportation intineraries, touristic spots, ask us, will be glad to help you.. We are two roomates Agathe and Gabrielle and you could be in contact with one or the other depending on our disponibility.
house_rules: Ne pas perdre les clés, respecter le voisinage et le calme de l'immeuble, la fête peut se faire partout ailleurs dehors ! Si vous utilisez la vaisselle, merci de faire comme chez vous et de la laver ! Pour le reste enjoy !
host_about:
Jeune femme française aimant les chats mais n'en ayant pas car vivant en appartement. Aime le spectacle vivant et les bons repas, aime communiquer. Enseignante en FLE (français langue étrangère)
En colocation
Aime les belles rencontres.
Pour moi le voyage est une rencontre.
Si je reçois, c'est à la bonne franquette, et je partage avec plaisir les soirées entre amis.
Si je suis reçue, j'aime qu'on me donne de bonnes adresses on qu'on m'y emmène carrément. Je suis curieuse et ouverte aux expériences de manière générale.
Ma devise, l'ouverture d'esprit, sans pour autant faire l'assistante sociale !

space: On the fourth floor of a 1930's building, this is a charming 30 square meter flat located just around the corner from “La Campagne à Paris”, near the famous Père-Lachaise Cemetery, in the lively and family-friendly 20th district of Paris. Newly renovated in a contemporary style, the apartment is very bright and retains some of the traditional Parisian decor features such as traditional Parisian wood flooring.  Apartment layout: A cozy entrance opens up onto a fully equipped kitchen (microwave, fridge, ceramic hob, toaster, electric coffee machine, electric kettle….) and a comfortable living room (15sqm) furnished with a queen size bed (new mattress), a double sofa bed, and ample storage, Flat screen TV ( with International channels). Large bathroom with shower and storage space. Hairdryer available.  Baby cot available upon request.  Bed sheets and bath towels provided. Free wifi available.  Non-smoking.   - FOR ALL  ARRIVALS :Please arrive at or around the time agreed upon. Times are

Less than 20 min to Parc de la Villette (museums, very large park, big children's playground, exhibitions, restaurants, concert hall…). -Metro (line #3) Porte de Bagnolet, is within less than 3 min walk down the boulevard. Line 3 will take you directly to places like Pere Lachaise, Republique, Opera, Blvd Haussmann, St Lazare railway station…. -Bus #76 (Bastille, St Paul-Le Marais, Le Louvre…), Bus #57 (Nation, Gare de Lyon) - Easy connection via tram to Metro Line 1 at Porte de Vincennes. This is the main line for visiting Paris, as it stops at many neighborhoods and sites of interest, including the Louvre, the Marais, the Arc de Triomphe/Champs Elysees....  -Within walking distance to two movie theaters (movies in France are often in original version, but with French subtitles, so even if you don't speak French, you may be able
access: We do not accept pets.  This accommodation is non-smoking.
interaction: I work from home and am available most of the time if you need anything.  Just give me a ring!
house_rules: - The apartment is for 4 people MAXIMUM (bedding, towels, cutlery, glasses, plates ..) Do not exceed this figure, for reasons of housing insurance (However we can accept 2 adults and 3 children). - Thank you for respecting the tranquility of the neighbors, both in the apartment, and in the stairwell (especially at night). - Parties are not allowed in the apartment. - Please leave the apartment clean, dishes done, and empty the trash (the garbage bins are located in a small room off lobby of the building, left of the lift).  Please leave empty glass bottles in the apartment, as they're recycled in a special location. - If you've used it, please leave the sofa bed in the open position when you leave the apartment (it's easier for us to clean). - BE CAREFUL : the apartment is located on the 4th floor with lift BUT the 3rd floor by the stairs! - The apartment is non-smoking. - PLEASE DO NOT LET IN solicitors (there are many in Paris, and they often say they want to check gas, chimney flues
host_about:
Bonjour!  I'm Alysa, an American who's called Paris home for more than a decade.  I've traveled a lot, especially in Europe and the US, but the City of Light is my favorite place in the world, and I love welcoming people here.  

I'm a writer, travel planner, and cat person, among other things.  Besides my family, what I love most in the world are: books, travel, museums, history, hypocritically critiquing celebrity fashion, and cookies.

Like my friend and neighbor Nathalie, I want you to feel welcome, comfortable, and even inspired in our charming studio.   And as someone passionate about Paris, I'm always ready with tips on what to see (from the "musts" to the offbeat), great local places to eat and shop, and more.

~~
Bonjour!  Je suis Alysa, une américaine qui vit à Paris depuis une bonne dizaine d’années.  J’ai beaucoup voyagé, surtout en Europe et aux Etats-Unis, mais la Ville Lumière est mon endroit préféré au monde.
 
Je suis écrivain, organisatrice de voyages, et fan de chats entre autres choses.  En plus de ma famille et de ma ville,  j’aime les livres, les voyages, les musées, l’histoire, faire des critiques hypocrites sur la mode « people » et les biscuits.
 
Comme ma copine et voisine Nathalie, je voudrais que vous vous sentiez chez vous, à l’aise, cosy, et même inspiré(e) dans notre charmant studio.  En tant que passionnée de Paris, je serai toujours là si vous le souhaitez pour vous donner des suggestions sur quoi faire ou voir (que cela soit des « musts » ou des choses insolites), des supers restos ou magasins du quartier, etc.
